Reviews.Title: “Nice, big rooms”
Reviews.Author: SupergirlNZ
Reviews.Content: Good service and huge standard rooms at a very high class hotel. Would recommend to anyone, particularly if you are there in busy

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Mark S
Reviews.Content: True five star hotel experience. Really quiet, fantastic bed, big room. Awesome, No need to say anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Problems handled extremely well”
Reviews.Author: suez
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night stay at this hotel. We were checked in to a park view executive suite. After one night we had a problem with our room and called the manager at 6aqm. He responded brilliantly and advised us he would relocate us immediatly. He upgraded us to a beautiful suite which was really appreciated. The hotel has been one of our favourites for years and I would like to thank the manager Christian for handling the situation well. Thought our bill might have been paid at the end too but no luck there unfortunately

Reviews.Title: “Usual good standard”
Reviews.Author: Winos52
Reviews.Content: My family and I had 2 room adjoining rooms just prior to Easter on the city side of the hotel which was extremely quiet, having stayed at the hotel many times in both the park and city side rooms. Check-in was efficient although 1 room wasn't quite ready when we checked in before 2pm. The hotel's proximity to shopping, Surry Hills restaurants and the Art Gallery and gardens make it ideal - the only issue is the rooms are very dark during the day and could use a soft refurbishment. Breakfast at Bottanica was fine but the night we tried to get a drink after the Lucinda Williams concert, both the Hilton's Zeta bar or the Shearton bar was to no avial - they close at 11pm - what is it with Sydney and early closing hotel bars? We were greeted at the bar with bar staff bringing out the mop whilst people were still finishing their drinks for those lucky enough to score some!

Reviews.Title: “Love it !!”
Reviews.Author: Sandra12blue
Reviews.Content: OMG such a classy hotel and everything about it is perfect: service, rooms are immaculate, location, views and food. Would definitely stay here again - photos say it all :))

Reviews.Title: “Great Sheraton in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Helicounsel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently and had a great trip. The hotel is located overlooking the park (hence the name) and is walking distance to transportation, sightseeing, and business. The room size is average, but the bathroom was re-done and very nice. Biggest tip from this stay- the Club Lounge at this location is worth the upgrade. As we learned, going out to meals and drinks in Sydney can be expensive! The club breakfast, free drinks, evening snacks, etc, easily make up for the upgrade price (ours was $50.00 at checkin). Plus, the free internet and views don't hurt either! The pool is small, but located on the top floor with a fun view, and the fitness center is more than adequate for a hotel this size. I've stayed at many Sheratons, and this one was easily my favorite so far. One other tip- a cab from the airport can be expensive ($50-$60aus), but there is a train station directly across from the hotel which costs closer to $15 for a one-way ticket to the airport. The public transportation was safe and decently clean, so next time I would take that route.

Reviews.Title: “Plush and relaxing hotel in central Sydney”
Reviews.Author: silkcashmere
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Sheraton on the Park. It is located opposite Hyde Park and in proximity to the main city streets, shops and attractions. Our room was very generous in space and offered great views of Hyde Park and the adjacent sprawlings. The bathroom was superb, the spa and shower ample in space. Having had a hot stone massage and taken use of the steam room at the spa facility upstairs, it was a truly relaxing experience to retreat back in to a luxurious room with view of the lovely Sydney nightscape. Breakfast was also impressive, with great variety and quality on offer. Overall a wonderful experience and I would be glad to stay here again (in contrast with the 4 Points by Sheraton located nearby, and which I did not enjoy as much).

Reviews.Title: “They make you feel at home”
Reviews.Author: travellersforever
Reviews.Content: For a big international hotel, the thing that keeps taking us back here is the feeling of family. From the moment we arrive, we feel like we are coming home. Attentive staff, beautiful rooms, stunning views (from Hyde Park to the Harbour) terrific central location. We love it. Oh, and their Executive Club is lovely, friendly staff, where nothing is too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: jenkeane
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. I landed after a delayed flight into Sydney and arrived at approx 1am. Service was great, and I was upgraded to a park side room, after having booked a cheap rate on a discounted last minute website. Exceptional value. The room was just beautiful, and spacious. Unfortunately, I was only there for the one night! Would loved to have stayed longer. Next time!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Paul_n_Cris
Reviews.Content: large very clean room, great bed. The bathroom is one of the best I have had at a hotel. The first thing I noticed was that the room was decorated in a very professional way. Not just the usual hotel tacky print on the wall to fill a large space, there were many pictures and wall lights that made the room more homely. Very pleasent as I have spent most of my year so far in one hotel or another. The black marble bathroom....Ohhh. Check in efficient, curtious staff. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location...”
Reviews.Author: Akamu
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights at a Grand Club room... great value for money... customer service was professional and friendly, room was clean and well decorated, location couldn't be any better, all good contact from reception staff to doormen to service reps in the Club Lounge. Great gym and nice pool... all in all an excellent choice for central Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “eighteen months - nothing changes”
Reviews.Author: dgvictor
Reviews.Content: went back to this hotel after eighteen months. obviously the great location is the main attraction. suprised by a few things: 1. they asked us to leave executive room at night (with our 5 year old daughter) and suggested we go the bar on level one......this was easter sunday.....someone please explain this to me. 2. we left a cash deposit ($300 dollars extra - above room rate) when we checked in and was then asked to pay cash for room service. What is the $300 for ? 3. no complimentary water in the rooms - they kindly offer $9 bottles 4. room service remains expensive and limited in choice - they still have the $8 delivery charge service still a problem as there was limited staff over easter. when you compare five star starwood properties in asia and this proeprty you will be very disappointed. the westin in sydney is a far superior property in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “A short stay”
Reviews.Author: IntrepidTravella
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because it made sense. I was going to a concert and transport options virtually were non existent afterwords. The hotel room was a cityside room as I was not particularly interested in a park view. The room surprised me as one of the most spacious I have stayed in. It had a walk in wardrobe, standard bathroom and spacious bed-living area. Of note was the homely feel the room had. Also the bed and pillows were particulary comfortable. The staff were effcient and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Philostratus
Reviews.Content: We normally stay at the Intercontinental another 5 star rated hotel in Sydney. So here is the truth - Sheraton on the Park (SOTP) is more luxurious, has better rooms, better breakfast and dinner buffet ($60 per head for guests), friendlier staff and from our room on the 12th floor - just a glorious view of Hyde Park in front of you, the cathedral and the harbour beyond. Location is perfect for State Theatre (we saw John Cleese) shopping, museum, art gallery,etc. and you can still walk to Opera House. Try to book a room from the 10th floor up, for best views. Go to their own website for best deals. You can park on site ($45 per night). Black Marble bathrooms are fabulous with proper sized bath and separate shower. We will be staying here from now on.

Reviews.Title: “a lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: JENKINSWILSON
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at Sheraton on the Park last week. We decided to book the Club Floor. This level of accomodation included tea and coffee, breakfast and best of all drinks and canapes in the Club Lounge. The views from this area are oustanding and the array of food on offer is a credit to the hotel and catering staff. The staff in the lounge were probably the most welcoming and efficient I have experienced in a hotel in Australia for a very long time. The hotel itself is as expected with front desk staff efficient and pleasant. A little more information about the facilities on offer would have been appreciated. The Park View room was a good size and well appointed. We had to call in cleaning staff as it wasnt as clean as it should have been. Instead of scrubbing stains on the bed head whilst we were in the room, it would have been better to apologise and move us to another room. The rooms are getting a little bit tired and worn, but we would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Five star comfort”
Reviews.Author: estniopery
Reviews.Content: Everything you want in a top hotel, nice friendly staff and wel equipped rooms. Good central Sydney location.Importantly we slept well and ate even better.

Reviews.Title: “Great when you have a park facing view”
Reviews.Author: RonWamberal
Reviews.Content: Have read the other reviews and well understand the issues. I stay here quite often and have experienced both levels; the quality of the stay depends greatly on which room and where you face - like your most recent reviewer said, the majority of the rooms face the city which in practice means a brick wall. When I have a room facing the park I love it as it has to be one of the best locations in the world. The main reason for me to stay here though is the Executive Lounge; probably my favourite lounge in Sydney - the view across the harbour to the Heads is simply stunning and the service and food selection is wonderful. The only problem with my stay this week is that my meetings didn't allow me to get to the Lounge until 7.33 and they had cleared the food within the 3 minutes. I have stayed here twice in the past 2 weeks and have been upgraded to an Executive Suite on each occasion so my experience recently has been first class. The location is clearly a major factor - go out 1 door and you are in a wonderful park; leave by the other door and you are only minutes away from the commercial and retail hub of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you would expect”
Reviews.Author: Munlm
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel close to nice shops. Rooms are small on the park side but a lot better view than the back of the hotel. Local bars and food outlets close early. We tried to find a takeaway one night about 10 pm but resorted to room service as everything was closed. The beds are very good!

Reviews.Title: “ORDINARY HOTEL IN GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: styleandfashion888
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2012. We are Starwood Platinum members and had quite high expectations after checking out hotel's website. The stay from beginning to end was very disappointing. 1. Reservation - we emailed the hotel regarding our stay and were assured of an upgrade to a suite on a arrival being Platinum guests. When we arrived we were assigned a small room facing a brick wall. Complete shock! After a long talk to the club reception they told us that our suite will be ready at 8pm and we can't check in until than. I've never heard anything like that before. They refused to give us any other room to stay in (I had 2 small children with me) until 8pm check in. That was at 3pm. They suggested I take my children for a walk for 5 hours!!!! In the end they found us park facing standard room (after 45 min of heated discussion). 2. Rooms - be careful most rooms are facing the back. Only park front rooms face the park. So if the view is important to you double check your reservation. Rooms are comfortable but could do with a bit of updating. Bathrooms are quite old. Park facing rooms are quite spacious. 3. Service - awful! A lot of times at the hotel we felt that we were in 3 star hotel at best. No complimentary water in the room, no slippers, no dental kits. have to ask for everything and they get things wrong. When we asked for water we were told that on that level they don't offer water! I had to call the manager to complain again. 4. General - bathrobes in the room were all ripped, very old. Same with the towels. Toiletries are the cheapest around. 5. Pool - nice little pool on top floor. Also has steam rooms / sauna in the change rooms (separate for men / women). 6. Club lounge - quite pleasant but food is very ordinary. We didn't find anything to nibble on. 7. Location - Excellent, right in the middle of the city, close to nice shops & restaurants. All in All - we would never stay here again. Wouldn't recommend it to anyone either. Not up to standard. 3 star at best. For a similar price - head to the Hilton Relaxation room or Shangri La for an amazing Harbour view renovated room.

Reviews.Title: “What a delightful surprise!”
Reviews.Author: ragout
Reviews.Content: One can usually expect comfortable beds, good bathrooms, clean rooms at the Sheraton chain but this one was simply outstanding. We booked a Executive Club floor room. After paying a small premium in the hopes of an upgrade via the SPG program. It was a wonderful surprise to have follow through and have a very large room with a great view and a spacious bathroom assigned to us. But best of all was the powerful shower. The best we had in a month's travel "Down Under"! The next treat was the service in the Executive Lounge where the gracious staff served the drinks. Kept things under control so no annoying drunks or their hangeron friends. The buffet food was attractively arranged, fresh and simply delicious. This Lounge was a huge improvement over any other Club lounge we have been in - including other Sheraton's Also the main floor Front Desk Concierge - Sonny (?), gave us wonderful advice on inexpensive transportation options and truly made our stay in Sydney the best ever!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth and D... S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the night after our wedding as a treat. We booked an executive suite and mentioned when booking online that it was our wedding night. I thought this might mean they sprinkle some rose petals on the bed or something else to make it a bit special. Well I completely underestimated the service at the Sheraton on the Park. Upon check in, we were informed we had been upgraded to a Terrace Suite, provided a letter to take to the bar for complimentary drinks and a late check out (2pm). We wanted to head to the bar with some friends while we were still in town at about 3pm, but unfortunately the bar didn't open until 4pm. This was a bit disappointing, but not to worry. We went out to one of the local pubs instead. When we came back, we went up to the Executive Lounge for pre-dinner drinks and canapes. The staff in the lounge were very attentive and it was a lovely setting to spend our first evening as husband and wife, overlooking Hyde Park and across to Garden Island. The staff in the lounge arranged our dinner reservation for us too. Once we got back to our room, we found a nice bottle of red wine waiting and a letter from the hotel manager welcoming us to the hotel and offering his congratulations. We went to dinner which was at the hotel restaurant. The food was lovely, but unfortunately I couldn't eat enough! Checking out in the morning was a breeze and the car came up very efficiently. Jason on reception was very helpful when we first checked in and all the other staff we encountered were very professional and friendly. We would love to stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sparkie17
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently in a club room. Rooms are small and a little tired. Superb location. However the biggest disappointment was the service, particularly in the club lounge. The staff in general were arrogant, unhelpful and tended to serve only those return customers and leave the rest of the guests to help themselves. Front desk staff were equally as unhelpful. When I checked in I got offered a room on the 5th floor (had requested a high floor), then the 6th floor when I asked for a higher floor, and then when I expressed confusion as to why my request was not granted, the 14th floor. Interesting. Also found the bathroom dirty, shower dripped, air con noisy in room and room noisy with traffic noise (windows not sound proof). Unfortunately I will not be returning and would much rather stay at the Westin where they treat you like a person and not part of the furniture.

Reviews.Title: “Super Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maestro
Reviews.Content: We loved our 2 night stay at this great hotel. Our spacious room overlooked the park on Elizabeth Street. *Hotel has a good fitness centre. *Bathroom in our room was a huge and well appointed. *Kettle with complimentary hot chocolate, tea, and instant coffee *Hotel offers 1 hour of free wi-fi for guests to use in the lobby *Hotel has 6 computers in the lobby for guests to use. *Easy walk to the vibrant seaside, stunning botanical gardens and great shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: Djay39
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable stay at Sheraton on the Park. Friendly and efficient staff at reception.Spacious rooms and ideally located a short stroll to the new Westfield complex. City view just looks directly into the Stockland building but wasn't expecting alot. Well appointed gym and health spa (pool, sauna, steam room etc.). Can recommend paying the extra to include the Executive Lounge as the facilities,food and staff really made it a memorable experience. The only small negatives were one of the window shutters was broken in my room and some blood stains on one of the pillow cases.

Reviews.Title: “St. Patrick's Weekend, 2012”
Reviews.Author: Judith113
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton on the Park is undoubtably one of Sydney's premier hotels, and I decided to spend my birthday weekend enjoying its facilities. It's fun to be a tourist in your own city, and the location right on Hyde Park is ideal for seeing the real Sydney....DJ's, Strand Arcade, the new ritzy Westfield, QVB. Whilst the harbour hotels have the Opera House view, this hotel has the most central position! Parking is $40.00 per day but worth it. The rooms are comfortable and spacious, with superb beds and marble baths. I wanted to watch the St. Patrick's Day parade and concert in Hyde Park, so chose a park view room and the aspect was expansive, with views as far as South Head. On saturday, I trawled Sydney's high class fashion shops and, in the evening, went to Mass at St. Mary's Cathedral and strolled down to Stanley Street, with its fabulous restaurants......ten minutes away! The pool has an amazing view of the city rooftops and membership of the executive lounge allows you breakfast and delicious pre-dinner canapes in privacy. The downstairs buffet is, however, excellent for both breakfast and dinner, with windows to the park and a variety of asian and western choices. Staff are friendly, and ready to please, even calling me by name after a day's stay! I have stayed in other Sydney hotels and certainly recommend the Sheraton....a true five star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for fading star”
Reviews.Author: Dale S
Reviews.Content: Three and a half stars would better describe our recent experience at this comfortable, well located hotel. The building is impressive, rooms comfortable, large and clean. The staff were friendly and tried to be helpful, although no-one at the concierge desk seemed to know much about the destination of the buses at the stop right out front, or about Sydney Bars or eateries other than the hotel. The breakfast buffet is expensive ($ 45 per person) for serve youself luke warm eggs , bacon, tomato,etc., and stand in line to cook your own toast ? There's a nice little gym on the upper level, and the pool has a knockout view over Hyde Park and St mary's cathedral to the outer harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Taniwan
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton on the Park is located within short walking distance to Sydney's main attractions and reasonably priced for a 5 star hotel if you book a deal early that also includes breakfast and parking. The hotel has a grand "cruise-ship" like lobby and communal areas which are spacious with lots of spare seating available after a long day in the city. The bar overlooks Hyde Park and the service was very good over the entire weekend. In fact, the service was very good overall, staff were friendly and we experienced no issues at all. There is a decent tea lounge on the ground level which serves high tea and a limited range of unusual cocktails during the day. Perhaps the hotel could review the cocktail menu, there were very few popular cocktails and the existing menu choices were quite strange. The breakfast buffet was exceptional, one of the best I've had in Australia with options to suit the tastes of those from many nations. If it doesn't stock anything that you would like to eat for breakfast, then you must have a problem. The dinner buffet also had a wide array of food including several curries which were very tasty. The seafood quality was nothing special which was a bit of a let down. My partner stayed in a basic king size room of which I found surprisingly spacious, good size bathroom and additional lounge area to place clothes etc for the following day. The bed however was quite firm, not the best I have slept on however at home I have a top of the line mattress so this may not be a fair comment depending on what you're used to and what your mattress preferences are. The hotel does live up to its 5 star rating, it isn't the nicest 5 star hotels in Sydney however based on what it offers at its average nightly price, the hotel certainly doesn't disappoint and is good value.

Reviews.Title: “Location x3”
Reviews.Author: Kisiek
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, easy to find, not so much the underground parking, but overall conveniently located, stone throw away from the shops or Hyde park. My room was spacious, well equipped and had exceptionally large bathroom. The view wasn't too pretty but for the price I didn't expect much. Easy and fast check out. I highly recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't disappoint”
Reviews.Author: Mumofteens
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay again, this time with family, all are now converts. Amazing breakfast, great beds, excellent service, excellent room service if somewhat a bit pricey. We stayed in 1907, a corner room with great views but despite being on the 19th floor we could hear buses and motor bikes. Ask for a room on the otherside if you are noise sensitive.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in the heart of Sydney, at Sheraton on the Park”
Reviews.Author: ByronVIPTravelWriter
Reviews.Content: You canâ€™t get a better location for Retail Therapy in the Heart of Sydney. At Sheraton on the Park you are on the doorstep to iconic retail stores like David Jones, and Centrepoint with all the leading luxury stores. And across the road from the Sheraton is the beautiful Hyde Park in the heart of the city. You are struck with large scale elegance with the majestic staircase in the Foyer of the hotel, and the standard of service matches the elegant surroundings with efficient, smart and helpful porters and reception staff. I was impressed by the service immediately when I checked in, as the clerk responded to my questions with lots of information about the Hotel. He described in detail The Executive Club, and the Starwood Preferred Guest program, SPG, and he even showed me on his own mobile phone, that you can download an SPG application, which should make future bookings easy. My room was upgraded from city side to Hyde Park view room, which was warm and inviting, with a selection of interesting artwork adorning the walls, and elegant round mirror above the bed. The marble bathroom was a good size with large bath and separate shower, which had amazingly good water pressure; I wish I could have it as good as that at home. There was a large plasma Tele, L shape lounge and large desk with an executive style chair. The cleaners should be highly commended as all the shiny appliances and tap wear literally sparkled. From the 10th floor you look out to the bank of trees in the park across the road, and you can see the gothic roof top of St Marys Cathedral, but from that level you donâ€™t see into the park. Most importantly I slept very soundly, as the bedding is very comfortable, so much so Iâ€™d like to buy their linen, quilt and pillows from their Sheraton at home range. The pool is arguably one of the best Hotel pools in Sydney, located on the top floor of the hotel with a glass ceiling. Remember to take your camera to the pool to capture the amazing vista from the azure blue pool, across Hyde Park to St Marys Cathedral and out to the Sydney Harbour. The pool and spa were both heated to perfect temperatures, and the overall impression of the area is relaxing and luxurious. The change rooms are fitted out with lockers, and there are spare bathroom products to use in the showers. I didnâ€™t have time to try the steam and sauna rooms, or the Spa treatments but will try them next time. However I did meet the Spa staff at the Spa reception and they were very helpful supplying towels, a robe and locker key. . The 21st floor Executive club is another place to take your camera, as you can step out to a couple of small Juliet type terraces and enjoy the stunning view. There are lots of comfy booths and arm chairs, soft mood lighting, complimentary drinks and snacks, a relaxing place to escape the bustle of the city. I bumped into a business man, who said he travels 200 days a year, and that Sheraton in the Park is his favourite hotel worldwide, and I can understand why. Get to the Exec club early if you get a window seat to capture the full view. If you have a sweet tooth then look forward to sampling the gorgeous little desserts. Chrissy the Club manager is delightful and her team are quite attentive without being intrusive. I enjoyed breakfast the 1st day in the Exec Club, nice to have breaky with a view, and the staff are cheerful, quick to deliver tea/ coffee, and selection of eggs, bacon, baked beans, fruit, yogurts, cheese and bread. The 2nd day I had the buffet breakfast in the downstairs Restaurant. Eggs & omelettes are cooked on the spot by the chef to your personal preference, which I've experienced more predominantly in Asian Hotels but not so much in Australian hotels, so I was pleasantly surprised to get my tailored made omelette, and yes it was fabulous. Huge buffet selection in modern and sleek surroundings with outlook to the park through the large glass windows. My trip was for business, so I found the location very convenient. When I needed a taxi in the morning there were a couple of taxis waiting at the entrance. but thereâ€™s also bus and train stations just across the road. I was grateful that Katrina from guest services arranged to have my luggage collected from the room promptly while I was having breakfast, and it was there waiting for me as I grabbed a cab. The location is in walking distance to the other major streets in the CBD. Also just a quick stroll across the park, and past the beautiful large fountain, is St Marys Cathedral, one of Sydneyâ€™s most treasured buildings. So many reasons to recommend this beautiful Hotel, its definitely a favourite Sydney hotel and I hope to go back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “World class hotel in a world class position”
Reviews.Author: Jackoaa
Reviews.Content: An elegant hotel with discreet but friendly staff. Beautifully appointed with 'to die for' beds and big marble bathrooms with separate shower. Park views are lovely but city view rooms are best value for those without a coal or gold mine to back them. Breakfast is fine if it comes with the room. For $40 I would prefer the local coffee shop. Super location for shopping for the less mobile.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel near Botanical Gardens”
Reviews.Author: debrina108
Reviews.Content: From entering the lobby for check-in to the rooms, restaurants, lobby lounge, and breakfast, this is a wonderful city hotel. All services were impeccable and the staff superb. I can highly recommend this city hotel within walking distance to the botanical gardens, the harbor, movie theatres and all city activities. I definitely will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: GuitarmanBowral
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when attending a work function. What a great room at a last minute rate of $200!! View to Sydney Harbour. Powered blinds and plantation shutters meant the room was sublimely dark. The pool and views from here a just beautiful. This is an old fashioned and beautifully comfortable hotel in a prime spot. Would stay again.....for the right rate.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby rooms”
Reviews.Author: cabsavie
Reviews.Content: What is it with this Starwoods property, as a Gold Starwoods member there is never an offer of anything extra here unless you ask for it, their "sister property "the Westin" on the other hand couldn't go further to make you more welcome and acknowledge your loyality. Stayed here twice, both single nights recently, before and after flights, tired outdated rooms no internet access, and to add insult we were placed on the lowest floor at the front of the hotel we may as well have slept on Elizabeth Street, probably would have gotten a better nights sleep. Came time to check out and now they surcharge to use a credit card. Next time I shall load them up with cash and let them pay the surcharge to the banks to handle the cash!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth every cent!”
Reviews.Author: robertsmits
Reviews.Content: We ot a twin bed double room after showing up unanounced. Beatiful furnished room, very spacious, very well insulated for noise. Big screen LCD TV, bathroom robes and all other things you expect in a 5 star hotel. Great fitness centre and swimming pool. Parking available and the staff was absoltely fabulous. Loved every minute of my stay. You can't get anything better for under 200 bucks!

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Cullen652
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel and our room overlooked the park. The room itself was spacious and very clean. The choice for breakfast was excellent and the service we received was very good - I sadly left a bag with 2 bottles of champagne at the terminus and the Concieage did everything he could to see if it had been handed in. The location of the hotel was great, very central and I would recommend it to travellers. We stayed 4 nights and would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: PatrickP
Reviews.Content: Even though I prefer boutique accomodation, the Sheraton on the park in Sydney wins big on several fronts. Firstly it is pretty well located, being just on Hyde park so circular quay is only a short woalk as is the botanic gardens restarants and china town plus darling harbour. Secondly it is a seriously well appointed set up. Although I got a citry facing room, it was beautifully decorated and the black marble barthroom was a pretty striking feature too. On a less positive note, although the Sheraton offers free wifi in its foyer, Wifi in the room costs AU$20 a day, which seems excessive given the growing number of hotels that offer this for free. Because of that Id rate it very good rather than excellent. This said, if Wireless internet access isbt a biggie, then this is a hotel that is definitely worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: MontiNb
Reviews.Content: We choose to stay at this hotel most times we visit Sydney. They just do it so well. We stayed for 3 nights in November 2011. The rooms are a good size with an excellent bathroom. The buffet breafast is consistantly the best at any hotel we have stayed at in the world. We always have a drink in the bar at night and the staff are friendly and efficient. The hotel is in a great location if you are shopping. Just out the back door and David Jones, Myer and Westfields are right there. The seafood buffet is also good. We look forward to many more stays. If you watch you for a Stay, Park and Play special is not too bad in price as it includes the room, breakfast and self parking.

Reviews.Title: “A quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: ondama
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel for work before and this time was on a family trip. We got a good deal on Wotif.com. The rooms are a nice size and the place has a classy feel to it. We also love the enclosed pool on the roof.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - except for internet”
Reviews.Author: charlieg
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for one night but will return. Great location, right across from St. James station and easy walk to all m ajor attractions. Beautiful room/bathroom. Only drawback was no internat access in the rooms which these days seems so standard. They did have a station of computers at the back of the lobby but this is the only weakspot to an otherwise excellent hotel

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: Jack C
Reviews.Content: We had tried to stay at the Four Seasons but they were sold out and we booked this hotel instead and boy were we happy with it.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: golfcaddy101
Reviews.Content: We spent Monday Feb 13 and Tuesday Feb 14 at this hotel. Grand Hotel to say the least. The canapÃ©s and drinks served at the Executive lounge on floor 21 were 1st class. Great selection of wines and beers. Oysters Kilpatrick , Oysters plain ,Smoked Salmon , Crispy bread rolls etc etc served between 05.30 and 07.30 in the evenings. The rooms are large and very well appointed. The aircon is quiet. There was no door slamming or at least we did not hear any and we usually do. Fantastic friendly staff. Spotlessly clean. Excellent service all round. A friendly hint. Walk out the front doors of the hotel on Elizabeth Street , turn right , 100 meters down the footpath is a small restaurant with little French tables and chairs outside as well as seating inside. Its named Bambini Wine Room but is much more than a wine room. Great wine selection, fabulous cocktails, I ordered grilled whole fish which was honestly as good as I have ever had. Cooked to perfection and rolled in slithers of almonds. The waitress was from Toronto Canada. She deserves a mention. Happy, informative and nothing was too much trouble for her. The only problem with this restaurant is that I now have to go back again, which means yet another few days in wonderful Sydney Town. Justin.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for a family break.”
Reviews.Author: bvcfamily
Reviews.Content: Had a four night stay in January 2012, two adjoining rooms for the family. Rooms well appointed and spacious which was good with the 2 kids. Swimming pool and spa upstairs and location was great. Breakfast downstairs was chaotic, we kept getting a table right next to the food and very busy. And they really struggled making a half decent coffee.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasent surprise in the attitude of staff make this hotel one of Sydney's finest.”
Reviews.Author: alstar5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sheraton On The Park, Sydney for 1 night in February 2011 in order to attend a conference with my partner. We were checked in by Sayeh and offered an upgrade to the Executive Club for $50.00 which included canapes and drinks in the afternoon as well as breakfast in the morning. Our room package already included breakfast and we had prior arrangements in the evening so did not take up the offer. Check in was completed efficiently without any issues and Sayeh was able to secure a booking for us at the best available rate in April when we're returning. Our room was located on the top floor (level 21) and was a City View room with a view of Castlereagh Street. The room was large for Sydney standards with a full bathroom featuring a separate shower and bathtub with large mirrors, marble floors and beautiful artwork. The staff were professional, courteous and up to 5 star hotel standards which was a welcome surprise and a significant improvement from prior stays at this hotel. The bar on level 1 serves beautiful food and a wide selection of cocktails, beer and wine. The bar boasts views of Hyde Park making it an ideal place to unwind after a day at work. I have grown up in Sydney and spent many nights at this and other similar hotels in the city. I was pleasantly surprised at the difference in the attitude of staff and would absolutely recommend this hotel to anybody wishing the stay either for business or leisure purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Location and class”
Reviews.Author: Waynos22
Reviews.Content: One of Sydney's better upmarket hotels - warm and inviting with good staff. Good rates available at certain times and while on the expensive side the food is great. Rooms are also big and light and you're right in the centre of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Average”
Reviews.Author: Siom T
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton on the park used to be decent. It is in a great locale, but service and maintenance have really been neglected. The beds appear very old and saggy. The fittings in the bathroom and desk are aged badly. Check-in was so very slow and many people with only one checkin assistant - so annoying when you arrive at a hotel and you have to wait so long to get to your room. Room service was slow and poorly. Food was cold and I called them to say and she was very rude on the phone. Everything like breakfast and coffee is expensive - a rip off. Don't stay here - try another hotel instead

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Jenni H
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most beautiful hotels we have ever stayed at in Sydney. Big room and great bathroom (with separate bath). We had a package with breakfast and although the restaurant was very busy (Sunday morning) we only waited about 2 minutes to be seated and the service was perfect. The hotel has a lovely atmosphere, very relaxed. All staff we met were friendly and helpful. Definately a great place to stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: codypearl
Reviews.Content: This is a great business hotel--it looked quite new and elegant, the rooms were spacious and comfortable and the breakfast spread was incredible. Customer service was excellent with perfect patience for my English-only speaking.The scenery outside is another great feature of the hotel where you can see the stunning views from the hotel. Awesome stay. Will definitely visit here again sooner.

Reviews.Title: “Our fav Sydney hotel”
Reviews.Author: RandallM81
Reviews.Content: We are in Sydney at least 5 or 6 times a year and when we can the Sheraton on the Park is our choice of place to stay. Try and get the park stay and play deal which is normally about $280. It includes parking and breakfast for two. The breakfast is possibly the best I have had anywhere and great value when you get it as part of the deal. Rooms are of the standard you would expect and you will want one of the beds to take home. I also like the bar for a drink before dinner, great selection and very relaxing. You are walking distance to most of the good places to eat in the city. Like most sheratons the service is not over the top but your needs are catered for and the staff are helpful. One little tip is we always take our swimmers, summer or winter as the pool way up on one of the top levels has a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Another comfortable stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi_acct
Reviews.Content: Second stay at a good hotel in Sydney. On both occassions it has been for business. I like the hotel and find it comfortable, though I did find the additional costs such as for internet and meals a little on the steep side. I got around the internet issue by using the wifi in the lobby and the breakfast issue by frequenting local cafes in Castlereigh Street directly behind the hotel. The staff were helpful and the room was kept in good order by room service. The fitness centre was good with helpful and chatty staff. I like the location as it is close to our office in Sydney and also it is fairly central for George Street and the ferry terminal. It is also not too far to walk to The Rocks. It is opposite Hyde park which is good for a stroll, also close to the Botanical gardens whch are worth exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: adeline90
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton the last weekend in January and found it excellent. The staff were gracious and polite, what I expect from a hotel like this, despite what other reviewers say about snobbishness. We had the buffet breakfast everyday and it was a little different each day and the food was constantly turned over. We also had room service one night after an exhausting day and it was excellent, though it was expensive it was great value for money. The room was tastefully and classically furnished. Extremely comfortable and the bathroom was huge with a shower (that sealed at the bottom so no water on the floor) and a great bath. The hotel is within walking distance of Darling Harbour, Surry Hills etc as well as around the corner from Westfield Sydney and other great shops. Was a little apprehensive about staying here because of previous reviewers take on the staff however I found them all to be polite, helpful and extremely gracious. I will definitely return to this excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: KillaSeal
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton on the Park is located right across the street from Hyde Park in Sydney. I stayed for 3 nights, and I really enjoyed it. The room was clean and comfortable, with a nice, comfortable bed. The bathroom had a separate shower and tub, and was well appointed. The toilet had two buttons: one for a half flush, and one for a full flush (I guess that it's a energy saving option.) I had a city view room, so I could only see an office building, but the windows did have electronically controlled blackout shades, which I really enjoyed, since I like to sleep in total darkness. The fitness center was small, but adequate, as was the pool and hot tub (the hot tub was very small, but as I said, adequate.) I had Sheraton Lounge privileges, so I had breakfast each morning, and complimentary cocktails and canapes in the evening. The lounge is on the 21st floor, with very nice views of the harbor. There are also a few outside seating areas in the lounge, so that you can sit outside and enjoy the breeze, or even have a smoke, if you wish. This hotel is within walking distance of Chinatown, Darling Harbor, and Circular Quay, so it's a good spot to stay at if you dont mind walking around and taking in the sights. Overall, I was very happy with my stay, and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: dione22
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 4 nights, and found at all times that the staff were very friendly and helpful. The concierge were always able to help with any directions, but the comfort of the rooms was the highlight for us. The beds were the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept in, the rooms were an excellent size and the bathroom was amazing. The little cupboard where we put our suitcases is great because it means that they are not in the way. The location is just perfect and central in Sydney for any shopping or sightseeing. There is not one thing I have to complain about this hotel and would definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Lyn W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton on the Park during January '12 and couldn't fault the experience. Great service and particularly great room! This hotel is close to all the major shopping in the Sydney CBD which makes for an easier time when carrying bargains! Loved the experience and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent City Hotel with top notch facilities!”
Reviews.Author: Sporthead
Reviews.Content: Did an overnighter here in mid december as a weekend getaway with the wife. I'd last stayed here about 15 years and found it to be an excellent hotel. Now its even better! The staff are very friendly but above all helpful! We were initially told the restaurant was fully booked out for the evening, but when they found out we were hotel guests, they literally brought in a table and a couple of chairs and accommodated us. I have the Starwood Privilege card which entitles a 50% discount on food. This made the buffet dinner very good value for money otherwise at $99 a head I think its a bit steep! But the food was very fresh and the selection plentiful! The rooms itself are quite nice and spacious. Luxurious marble bathrooms and top quality furnishings. It was spotlessly clean and smelled very fresh. Above all the king bed was very comfortable. There really is no negatives about this place. I highly recommend it to couples, business travellers and families alike!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: cuzinGJ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights. Staff was very friendly and helpful.Lobby decor very upscale. Nice size room had views of city, Hyde Park, and harbor. Definitely work out a deal for executive club if you are a Starwood member - food, drinks, service, views are terrific. Less than a mile walk to Opera House, Bridge, Gardens, shopping, Chinatown and rest of harbor activities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but a Tad Snobby”
Reviews.Author: mangoriver
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights, and while I was happy with our park-view room, I thought the service and general atmosphere for the hotel was a little too uppity. I've stayed at a lot of nice hotels, and I'm not sure why this particular Sheraton has so many airs. Snobbishness aside, the stay was great! The club lounge on the 21st floor is convenient for breakfast and a drink / snack before dinner, but the offerings are limited. And the staff insists on getting all of your drinks for you -- even water and juice. And service ends promptly when it's supposed to. The location across the street from Hyde Park is great, and it's just a skip to the Cathedral and a hop to the Botanic Gardens (my favorite attraction in Sydney). It's also walkable to the Opera House, Darling Harbour, and the Chinese Friendship Garden. A couple of good eating options nearby include Spice I Am (Thai food) and a great vegetarian dimsum place near the Cathedral called Bodhi. Westfield Mall is also closeby with a food court.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and well located”
Reviews.Author: Deb R
Reviews.Content: The decor is spectacular and the rooms very comfortable. There was even Picasso prints in the room which was extra special given that we were in Sydney to view the Picasso exhibition. The staff at the Concierge desk were helpful and knowlegeable about things to do and places to ear. The location is really most convenient. A taxi to anywhere is provided from the door and modestly priced. (You wouldn't want to drive or park in the city anyway - too busy.) I recommend to anyone visiting Sydney that you should stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful birthday visit!”
Reviews.Author: Bontaks
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our luxurious stay at the Sheraton thanks to an amazing â€˜Suite for Roomâ€™ deal on lastminute.com.au. For $9 more than the price of a standard room, we had an executive suite on the 16 floor with gorgeous views of Hyde Park and St Maryâ€™s Cathedral. This deal included the perks of Executive Club membership â€“ canapÃ©s and drinks 5-7:30pm and breakfast 7-10am. This also entitled us to use of the business facilities, the pool and the gym (which we didnâ€™t have the time or urge for!), and gave us a free laundry â€˜pressingâ€™ of two items and a shoe-shine on arrival. A huge bargain, really! We arrived early in the morning and took advantage of the valet parking and left our luggage at the hotel. After strolling across to the Art Gallery of NSW to visit the Picasso exhibition and wandering back to top of Westfield for itâ€™s large choice of excellent restaurants (level 6 â€“ see my review of Xanthiâ€™s), we did some shopping and went back to the hotel to check in (it really is within walking distance of so many of Sydneyâ€™s attractions). The suite was large with magnificent views from the park right across to nearly the entrance of the harbour â€“ watching a Celebrity cruise ship sailing out while sipping champagne in the Executive Club that evening was a lovely way to begin a night of celebration with friends. The suiteâ€™s amenities were as you expect â€“ very clean, stylish, comfortable and beautiful; the bed was bliss to sleep in and the shower pressure was strong and hot. The only negative thing was that after a very late night, a staff member mistakenly rang our door bell twice and let himself in â€“ stopping the second he realised the security latch was in place and calling out his apologies before retreating. Kind of funny, really, and although I couldâ€™ve done with a little more sleep, it enabled us to leisurely shower and get ready and indulge in the breakfast provided in the Club Lounge before check out at 11am. Each staff member we encountered, from the valet parking attendant to the shoe shine man to the helpful woman on the reception desk who snipped a loose thread on my dress, were friendly, approachable and good at their job. And there are ample staff members to help you with everything you need (we experienced at least 10 members of staff personally, and only stayed one evening). The only thing that would prevent me from staying at the Sheraton on the Park every time I visit Sydney is the cost. I donâ€™t think it is expensive for what you are getting, itâ€™s just that most of us cannot afford such luxury on a regular basis. We were celebrating a milestone birthday, so the indulgence was worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good”
Reviews.Author: Hangaroundgirl
Reviews.Content: I think that one would expect a Sheraton to be consistently good. I use this hotel for business so price is not too much of a factor. The restaurants are expensive if you choose to dine in, but the food is good. I like the proximity of this hotel to the train (easier to get to and from the airport) and its proximity to David Jones! My Sydney hotel of choice now.

Reviews.Title: “Even in adversity”
Reviews.Author: CurlsOnTop
Reviews.Content: Well we didn't have the smoothest stay ... but the good news is that the problem was fixed promptly and efficiently. This is a truly lovely hotel - top notch. I loved waking up in the morning and going for a swim in the roof top pool with views of the Sydney tower and Hyde Park. The buffet breakfast (included in price) was lovely and the omelette cooked to order the icing on the cake. The problem that we had was that after checking in late (11pm) after a long day on the road our shower didn't work. After a call to concierge and a porter being unable to fix it and we were moved to another room (with our bags carried for us). The rooms (we saw two) were beautiful and roomy. The bathrooms luxuriously appointed. Bathrobes for use while there. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Sydney!!!!”
Reviews.Author: navindt
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many different types of accommodation in Sydney, from budget to apartments and many 5 star hotels. The sheraton on the park is my Favourite of them all. The interior is stunning from the lobby to the rooms. It has a cosiness about it even though the rooms are massive and the bathrooms are extravagant. I loved the "frames" decor above the bedhead. There is a lounge, desk and lots of storage space- and this is in a normal room!! The black marble bathrooms are amazing, it gives that special touch I haven't felt at any other hotel which all feature the same modern white/cream bathrooms. Loved the separate bath and shower too. Breakfast was great- had everything you'd expect and lovely view of Hyde park. The location is good, quiet next to the park but close enough (2 blocks) to Pitt street mall where there is many shops at all price range, miu miu, Zara, sportsgirl etc. You can also walk 15 min to darling harbour where I'd recommend you eat at a restaurant overlooking the water. Also the hotel is opposite the st James train station for quick access to the airport or 1 stop to circular quay :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: threezacrowd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for two nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We were upgraded to the Club Executive Floor and had a 'city view'. (There are two options a park view of Hyde Park or City). The city view was a nice way of saying we are looking into an office block. The Exective Club Lounge was enjoyable. The room was lovely with a King Size Bed, desk, lounge and a massive bathroom with separate bath/shower. The service was efficient and excellent professional. The staff were all friendly. The buffet breakfast had a large variety of choice, all fresh. We have stayed at a number of Sydney's hotels now and we feel that this one is one of the city's best.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay at the Sheraton on the park”
Reviews.Author: aussieontour42
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in November and the staff were wonderful, the Sheraton upgraded us for free and we had a wonderful room. very spacious, very comfortable and a short walk to the show we were seeing. We would definitely stay at the Sheraton again, it's 5 star value at an excellent price.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay but not necessarily rushing back”
Reviews.Author: JohnStockholm
Reviews.Content: As an SPG gold member we were given an upgrade and the room was large and comfortable. However the bathtub had pubic hair from the former guest which somehow spoiled the feeling for the room. I contacted the reception shortly after check in to have this cleaned but had to follow up twice before anything happened but the following day was contacted directly by the on duty manager who offered his sincere apologies and provided us with a bottle of sparkling wine and some chocolates. The gesture was appreciated but I would have preferred a clean room to begin with. We paid around 600 AUD / night and at this rate the price of internet and breakfast should have been included and I felt that it was ridiculous that it was not. Charging extra for internet is nowadays akin to charing for water or electricity consumption...! It makes one feel that the hotel is trying to squeeze one dry. Location of the hotel was ok: good for shopping but a bit of a walk to the wharf. I would be willing to return but don't feel that I must rush back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, good location, acceptable price”
Reviews.Author: aloha75
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel just before Christmas on a very good deal including breakfast. The hotel has an excellent service, friendly staff and all amenities necessary. Rooms: Big rooms with TV and DVD player, minibar and air conditioning. Bathrooms again very spacious with shower and bath tub. Amenities: free WiFi, free internet in the business centre (incl. free printer), free newspapers, spa and pool on top floor etc. Breakfast: Huge selection of delicious hot and cold food (pancakes, waffles, eggs, toast, muesli, fruit, ham and cheese, juices, coffee, tea etc.) Location: Good location next to the park and central transport. Approx. 10-15 min walk to the opera and harbour bridge. Shopping mall (Westfield) just behind the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that was good in the middle but bad at both ends”
Reviews.Author: awoody91
Reviews.Content: This hotel ruined what was a decent, by no means perfect stay with what seems to be dodgy financial practices and Bad communication skills. We stayed at this hotel for an 8 day period over Xmas for what was overall a reasonably enjoyable experience, i will get to the review of the property later but first..... On the day of check out after signing the final account and paying by credit card we discovered that the hotel had charged us for an in-room move that we had never purchased. We returned to the club floor and explained this to the staff who quickly removed the movie and canceled the first charges on our card or so we thought(just a quick note this hotel seems to enjoy charging guests for things they did not use as we were also charged for 1 night of Valet parking funny when we arrived in a Taxi) Our trouble began the day after we checked out when we arrived in our next destination Hong Kong. After checking into our hotel in HK we checked our credit card online to find that our limit had been reached and exceeded by charges from the hotel,with a very expensive phone call back to New Zealand we where informed that the hotel had attempted to charge our Card Three times for the stay as well as placing holding amounts on the card that exceeded the total amount of our stay by a considerable amount. So overall they had Clogged our Credit Card with an amount that was 4 Times what our total bill was. as you can imagine this can be problematic when traveling and is incredibly inconveniencing requiring days of emails and international phone calls to rectify. Prior to all this and while in the process of booking the hotel we also found a complete lack of service over the phone with reservation and front desk staff and management. It took three attempts to get a correct booking confirmation sent to us and at least 12-13 attempts to get a quote on a Hotel car to pick us up from the airport. Management made excuses for both errors and made a offer to send a European car to pick us up from the airport instead of the standard car when paying what i think was about $ 120 Aud for a car i would expect that it was European to start with not a glorified Holden Taxi. We politely declined the offer and payed for a Real Taxi which cost just $40 and came equipped with lovely driver. Now to the actual stay. We had booked an executive suite with club privileges. We found check in incredibly quick if not extremely welcoming. The room was large for an executive suite in a city hotel and had nice decor in the living and bedrooms with the bathroom aging but gracefully so. The room also boasted a great open view over Hyde park and Sydney harbor. The amenities on offer in the room where reasonably standard with two LCD tv's with all expected channels, well stocked mini bar ect ect..... The breakfast in the club lounge while decent could have done with a little variation after 8 days it got extremely repetitive. The lounge it self was average and the service incredibly hit and miss for example some mornings and evenings you would be asked for your drink order while others you would have to chase the staff hard to get a coffee or cocktail. The other bugbear was the supposedly free WI-Fi in the club lounge, on our first 2-3 days this WI-Fi was easy to use and access as expected with a password provided by the staff But apparently some bright spark thought this was costing the Hotel too much and to discourage the guests form using it they would make them connect to a much slower network with a password provided by the hour so guests would have to chase the elusive staff in the lounge for a password then while in the middle of something would have there internet cut off with no warning. Come on Guys I have stayed in guest houses in Cambodia with Free Unlimited internet its not too much to ask. The Food a beverage at the hotel we found to be Top notch both through room service and the restaurant and clearly the F&B manger has it ticking over nicely unlike other areas of the hotel. All in all if you want to be Ripped off not Replied to and Ignored the Sheraton On The Park Sydney is a great option. If not stay at the Westin or the Intercontinental we have and will again. They also have great rooms but seem to have discovered the secret......its called Service. P.S We have since been credit the majority of the money back, of course minus the inconvenience & some money actually because of the exchange rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mamadodo
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a night at this hotel for my 50th birthday after drinks with friends at the Rocks. It was a great experience. The room was spacious with a king bed and lounge area, there was a DVD player (not that we used it, but this is something often lacking in many hotels), the bathtub was enormous, breakfast was served in a cheerful restaurant overlooking the park, service was terrific. Wish that they had family rooms as I would have loved to take my kids back but they only allow 1 child in the room, despite the fact that it would easily fit more. We also recieved a bonus of late checkout - 2PM which was great after a night on the town!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, this place is incredible”
Reviews.Author: elgarbo
Reviews.Content: This is probably the nicest, most luxurious hotel I've ever had the good fortune to enjoy. I wish my stay had been longer than a single night. The good things that I could say are probably endless, but here are some of my favourites: - the swimming pool, surrounded by glass, affording amazing views out across Sydney while you swim. - the his and hers change rooms for the pool with lockers, steam room, showers etc. Classy, elegant, enjoyable and stocked with all the little things you might need. - the rooms are beautifully furnished, spacious, and grand. - friendly reception, very professional. - located right in the heart of Sydney's CBD, opposite the park and only a very short stroll from Pitt St mall and the other delights of the city. - we paid about $300 for the night on a secret deal, so the value for money was truly astounding. Seriously, this place is majestic. A perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not for families”
Reviews.Author: Beth V
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 booked 2 rooms at ridiculous prices ($700/room/night!) for4 nights over New Year's Eve. We called about a week in advance to request rooms that are connecting or at least next to each other. We were told that they would put a note on our reservation. Upon arrival, they informed us that they only had a reservation for one room. Luckily, I had printed the email confirmation for 2 rooms. Next we were told that they did not have 2 rooms on the same floor much less next to each other available and that there was not a note regarding our previous phone call to request such. We quickly learned that this is definitely not a family friendly hotel. After being informed that we would have to pay an add'l $25/day/internet connection to have internet in our rooms they informed us that since we had paid more to have Executive Club benefits, there was free internet in the club and in the lobby so it wouldn't be a big problem. Well, each time you want to use the internet, you have to ask for a code (at the front desk for the lobby) or one of the servers in the Executive Club and then you receive a code that is good for one computer for one hour. They were not very friendly about giving out the codes and made you feel this was a special privilege! Our children were told the first morning that they couldn't wear thongs to breakfast in the Club, yet we saw other adults in sweatpants and thongs. Our children definitely felt they were not welcome in the Club or really anywhere in the hotel. They are not allowed to use the hotel lobby computer area, not even under adult supervision. Ridiculous! I would only recommend this hotel for business travel or couples. The location is good with Hyde Park across the street but beware that unless you book a park facing room, you will be looking at a wall outside your window from the buildings next door!...even at $700/night!

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: mariaoct
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night whilst on a shopping trip to Sydney. Stayed in a city view room which was very spacious clean - the bed and pillows were very comfy. Its really close to shopping and restaurants. The view across Hyde Park from the breakfast, dining room is lovely, it makes you forget that you are staying in the middle of the city. The pool on level 22 was fantastic, as was the gym. Staff were very pleasant and helpful and the buffet breakfast was excellent. Would definitely stay here again. Only one small thing the decor is very dark and masculine but thats just a personal thing - it wouldn't stop me from staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Quality all the way ...”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryTravelWife
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Sheraton on the Park, Sydney, with two teenagers (adjoining rooms) for the second time in as many months. The rooms - while not the newest on the scene - remain true to traditional luxury accommodations - great beds, comfy pillows and luxury linen. They are well appointed and enjoyable in every sense. Breakfast was delish with a good variety and some interesting highlights including the honeycomb tray - yum! Overall, a very relaxing and pleasant experience repeated twice over - must be the sign of a well-run hotel ;-) Note: Staff need to watch slamming the doors when servicing rooms/checking minibar - management can't control the thoughtless guests who think the world is sound-proof - but staff not following suit is manageable.

Reviews.Title: “good location in the city”
Reviews.Author: michael t
Reviews.Content: stayed mostly sheraton on this vacation, and this hotel was in a good location making it easy for us to walk and see the sights, definitely saved us some sore feet day two and three.

Reviews.Title: “At these prices this is a steal!”
Reviews.Author: every_ones_a_critic1
Reviews.Content: I spent one night here whilst passing through Sydney after Christmas, the rate was $200 per night, the room was very well equipped and clean, the king bed was very comfortable with a good selection of pillows. The building is not the newest in the world, but it has been comprehensively renovated, the rooms are tastefully decorated, the room and bathroom size are both generous. I did not use the hotel Internet connection, it is an option at approx $25 per night, I think that in this day and age it should be wireless and inclusive, this is the only negative point that I have about our stay. Overall the hotel was excellent and at this price very good value given the quality of the room, fittings, facilities, services and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great city location”
Reviews.Author: NormanBristolUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the sheraton for 3 nights early December, as a surprise visit for my daughter. We had emailed in advance to let the hotel know that we would be arriving early from London and requested a front view of the park on a high floor Arrived at 7.30am check in was swift and room request granted and ready. Location is excellent 1 minute from St James station, opposite Hyde Park and very close to all the shops and Darling Harbour. Room was clean and bathroom a great size with walk in powerful showed and deep bath. We used the pool, sauna and steam rooms. Breakfast was excellent full range to suit all taste, must recommend the omlette service, try and book in your room rate as it is expensive at $40 per person. All the staff we came in contact with were polite, profeshional and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to any visitor to sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Should be great hotel, but beware Internet charges and other issues”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: This should have been an excellent hotel, as they widely promote that it was the best hotel in Australia in 2011 and 2010. Judged by that criteria I was disappointed. I therefore rated it in comparison to truely great hotels I have stayed at elsewhere. It was cheaper than some of the other high-end hotels in Sydney, but was not cheap. However it has a frustrating, and very expensive, Internet policy. I came with family of 4 who travelled with a laptop, iPad, iPhone and iPod. Each device had to pay its own internet access charge of $25 per day, meaning an additional $100 per day if we all wanted to use our devices, even though we were staying together. This needs to be changed before I could recommend this hotel more highly.Â  Some positives about hotel include a wonderful location and reasonably sized rooms (though don't appear as large as North American Sheratons). However, there were a number of other minor niggles that you wouldn't expect to see in the "best" hotel: smelly food left outside room overnight wasn't picked up for 36 hours; key requirement to operate lift confusing and ineffective-anyone only has to wait for somebody to put key in then all floors available throughout elevator ride- either do it properly or not at all; a half-opened bottle of juice from a previous tenant was in the fridge when we checked in; wine not refilled in minibar (and expensive of course); staff OK in attitude but definitely not outstanding; quite a lot of noise when people in room above walked around; lots of noise in our room from the pipes when others presumably having a shower or bath; and bedroom pillows uniformly thick, so out of luck if you prefer a thin pillow (thought to be fair I didn't specifically request this and they may have got one for me). Overall, could easily justify 4-5 star rating, but definitely not there yet and surprised it has won this award twice in a row.Â These issues were why I rated it only 2-stars.

Reviews.Title: “High Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Niek87
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after leaving a cruise in Sydney for 2 additional nights to see the city. The hotel is very good, what you can expect of a Sheraton hotel. I did find it higher than the standard Sheraton hotel, especially those in the USA. The hotel didn't win awards for best hotel in Sydney for nothing... Check-in was efficient, and the concierge took my bags as I arrived at 10am and my room was not yet ready. At 12noon, exactly according to schedule, the room was ready and when I came there the luggage was already brought up without anything getting lost (4 pieces, so a pretty good chance on it). The location of the hotel is good, even though it is slight out of the main area of Darling Harbor and the Rocks. Nevertheless, a 10-20 minute walk and you're everywhere in Sydney. Breakfast is good as well, with a full range buffet that had several items change every day, the increase variety. Option for eggs made to order also available, even though it was busy because of a weekend. Also the Link@Sheraton in the lobby makes it very nice to have free internet available, both with a desktop there or your own laptop. Overall, I'm very happy with my choice of hotel and would stay there again any time. Only downside was that I requested a shuttle to the airport which the hotel arranged correctly, but the concierge informed me that I could pay the driver with credit card. However, once I sat in the shuttle he only accepted cash. I would expect the hotel to be aware of this!

Reviews.Title: “Not your average Sheraton: really outstanding”
Reviews.Author: DadTravelOrganiser
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton on the Park is a really great hotel. Whether you are regularly travelling on business or coming to Sydney for the first time I can highly recommend this hotel. There are lots of hotels in Sydney, and many of these are closer to the quay or harbour. I would still recommend the Sheraton. It is right next to the main shopping areas, it is a 15 minute stroll to pretty much anything you might want to do and, if you need to, cross the road and catch the train from St James. Why do I recommend it? There are a range of positives: * Quiet rooms (mostly). If you have a high floor, no problems regardless of where you stay. The â€œcity sideâ€� rooms are noisier if low down â€“ the â€œpark sideâ€� rooms mostly are quiet and have good views. * Sizeable rooms and bathrooms with all the things you need. I like the corner rooms for their size and space, but the bathrooms in all rooms are the sort of size all hotels should aspire to. Nothing tiny here. * Views. If you look onto the park, this is really good. Note that park-side rooms do not all look directly onto the park. * Great access to areas for a stroll or run. Head down to Mrs Macquarieâ€™s chair from Hyde Park, and then around the Botanic Gardens to the Opera House. A nice touch is that in the morning there is bottled water and towels available on your return â€“ classy. * Breakfast where simple things are done right. There is a selection of four newspapers, the buffet really is one of the best I have experienced, and if you ask for tea or a particular coffee, it comes. The room also looks out onto the park â€“ nice. * Really friendly staff and a great concierge. I have received restaurant recommendations (when looking for Spanish and Japanese), and these have been good. The Seafood buffet in the restaurant in the hotel is good too.

Reviews.Title: “Great city location”
Reviews.Author: NeptunesExpress
Reviews.Content: This property continues to be a winner in Sydney for its centeral location right in the retail centre. Easy walk, train, bus or taxi to the opera house and the harbor. Rooms in good condition and spacious. Afternoon high tea a real must.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the heart of Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: zaphodneo
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying here since Saturday. The hotel is opposite Hyde Park in the middle of the Sydney CBD...a fantastic location to explore Sydney. In 5 minutes you can walk to George Street and in 10 minutes get to the Rocks. The rooms are spacious. Only complaint about the room is the lack of curtains (they have blinds) which can wake you pretty early in summertime. Our room rate did not include breakfast so cannot comment on the breakfast buffet. However, the tea buffet (scones and tea) was quite nice. Would be back from sure.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I didn't have to say anything negative about this one”
Reviews.Author: ozmel88
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite at the Sheraton on the Park for the weekend of our wedding because it was across the park from our wedding venue. Â This was the most expensive stay I have ever had at a hotel and it is a shame everything wasn't perfect. I booked a hotel car to take my bridesmaids and me to the wedding because I thought it was the least risky option (eg, we were staying there so the car is in the same place). Â  When we were ready to go, I asked my brother to go over and tell them we were ready. He did. And came back to report there was no car booked. Now, although the hotel has never actually explained what happened, I have the emails I sent asking for it and when the woman at the front desk checked the book the next day she said it was cancelled. Somewhere along the line there was a misunderstanding. But what I am most frustrated by is that nobody actually apologized to me when it happened. In fact, nobody from the hotel even spoke to me about it. Nor did anybody actually try to fix this problem. I had to walk out to the front of the hotel in my wedding gown and hail a taxi.Â  Ideally, when it happened, I think they should have escalated the problem, sent a manager to talk to me who should have said "what can we do now?" and I would have said "just get a taxi". If that had happened I probably wouldn't be writing this now. We did express our concerns in a letter to the manager of the hotel and he has apologized and offered us a free upgrade next time we stay. Thanks but we really don't plan to ever stay here again. Was everything else perfect? Not really. The ceiling was leaking in our suite-there was quite a bit of rain water coming in; I don't think it just suddenly happened that day. We were given towels to clean it up. We did have an issue with an item on our bill but that was resolved when we questioned it. I will still give it four stars because although we were unlucky, we had a lovely suite with a great view and this is a gracious hotel in a great location. But it is a five star hotel and we should have had a five star stay.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it”
Reviews.Author: DontGo4_2ndBest
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing. If 5 star hotels, is you thing, you won't get better value for money. Lovely big bathroom. Well refurbished. quiet. Hot hard shower. Just the best

Reviews.Title: “Regular 5 star, good stay”
Reviews.Author: Bhakti_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 Saturday night in a normal city side room. It is a decent 5 star hotel, no complaints really, nothing extraordinary. Room is decent size, pretty comfortable. No view, just another building but I had the blinds down most time. Confortable bed, bought my own dvd's to watch at night. Nice bathroom, seperate walk in robe. No slippers provided so I did have to ask for them. Room was clean, service was pleasant. The lobby is pretty at this time with the christmas trees up and check in was a breeze. I used the fitness centre which is small but decent, no one else was there when I was using it except for the attendant. Did not try the restaurants or spa. Hotel location was great as I could walk to pitt st mall in 2 minutes. Rooms were quiet though, even with being in centre of city didnt have any noise disturbance. I opted for express checkout, do make sure you check your bill after as I was charged $50 for valet parking when I did not drive to the place. Which is why i only gave the hotel 4 stars as this type of mistake should not happen at a 5 star hotel. I did call and they called back later and said it has been rectified and apologised for thier mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location!”
Reviews.Author: LarisaNagra
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located. Close to a park which very often has interesting activities taking place. Rooms are spacious and bathroom is fantastic! Nice staff. Value for money!!

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY FIRST CLASS- BRILLIANT!”
Reviews.Author: Pifkie
Reviews.Content: We stay here whenever we have a special occasion as we live in Sydney and joined the Starwood program quite some time ago. Hopefully eventually we will gain some benefit from that . The Hotel is stunning, and perfectly located. We always ask for a City view corner room- and they are usually excellent. The bathrooms are luxurious with stunning black marble tile surrounds and flooring; the puffy white towels and bathrobes are always welcome after a day out walking in town too, and the large bathtub with separate shower is another touch that is not always seen in city hotels.
