The front desk staff have always been very professional to us over a long period of time, indicating that they are very well trained for their duties in a 5 star Hotel environment. Recently we tried the Executive Club option, which had an additional cost, however it was certainly very well worth that extra cost, and we fully intend to take that option the next time that we book. The American staff member in the Exec Lounge was impressively attentive, and made us feel very much at home. The package includes canapes and drinks as well as breakfast, in a private situation with lovely water views- thoroughly recommended. We really love the atmosphere at the Sheraton on the Park and thoroughly recommend this Hotel. Have stayed in just about every type of room over the years, however whilst most folk will recommend the Hyde Park rooms, we like the Corner City View rooms better- just a matter of taste. Breakfast here is always top class. The only Hotel on par that we have found is Sheraton in Port Douglas. A tip though if you go for a Hyde Prk view room- We stayed on Floor 4 or 6 and the view looking into the trees instead of higher up, is very lovely. Kudos to the management here- we have never been let down by bad service or sloppy housekeeping. This Hotel is always immaculate.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great hotel to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: FunkyBeat
Reviews.Content: Sheraton on the park, is my overall favorite hotel.The location of the hotel is in the middle of Sydney CBD,close to Pitt Street Mall and Public transport.The rooms are modern,the beds are comfortable and I have soft spot for the black marble bathroom. The staff are attentive and professional. The main the highlight is the buffet breakfast,has an excellent choice of savory and sweet dishes. Overall a great hotel to stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Our favourite hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaJulian
Reviews.Content: Attentive friendly staff. Beautifully appointed lobby and rooms.Easy access to David Jones shopping. Lovely buffet breakfast. Quiet. Clean. Comfortable bed for a good nights sleep. Great Gym. The only crticism is no access to fresh air/balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Your best option in SYD CBD”
Reviews.Author: GTSINC
Reviews.Content: Frequent visitor to SYD, and, have stayed at several other properties in CBD, SOTP is by far the best option. It has an enviable location next to Hyde Park , close enough for a stroll to AGNSW, Sydney Opera House, Circular Quay, MCA, etc. Also numerous buses stop outside for trip to Bondi for e.g and St James station across street. for SYD INTL . But even more important than comfortable beds, Executive Club, SPG perks, it's the warm, professional friendly staff from porters, front desk, EC, that make stays so memorable

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Shazzamelbourne
Reviews.Content: Always stay here when in Sydney....both on business and pleasure. Great location and fabulous comfy beds. Pool, gym and spa great as well and location second to none. Executive Lounge a must.......drinks, snacks and breakfast. Great ambiance and wonderful staff. Very quick to respond when there is an issue and always quickly resolved.

Reviews.Title: “One perfect night...”
Reviews.Author: soloTravellerGirl
Reviews.Content: I needed an escape from reality and got a great deal through their own website for one night. It was a city view room.. not view of the city but a view of another building. Next time i will choose the Hyde Park view room. The check in staff where friendly, their directions to hotel's elevator was a little off but i found it. The pool was the hotel's best feature! it was on the roof, fully enclosed and heated. Amazing it along with the sauna and steam room made for a perfect girls night away. The only bad side was the shower- the pressure was great but the door didn't close properly and the bathmat got really wet from the water. Other then that minor thing it was a perfect night. The bed was so soft and comfortable- best hotel bed ever i have slept in.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous customer service!!”
Reviews.Author: jane p
Reviews.Content: I pulled into the drive-way and my car was valet parked only $45 night, excellent value ....after being greeted by the warm and friendly check in staff, i proceeded to my room which was much larger than i thought also with a great view of hyde park!! My package include free pressing of 2 garments but upon asking about this they said my shirt and jacket wont be ready until 7am... I needed to be dressed by 6.30am!!after a little persuading the ever polite and smiling guy who picked up my gear said ok ....I was i bit concerned as to wether my clothes would be back on time but......they were!!!full credit to this service 6.30am on the dot !!! woud stay at this hotel again sheraton hotels "always consistent service". have stayed in others

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, smooth experience”
Reviews.Author: 100daysperyear
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times before and it's had it's ups and downs with service. Now I must say, they got the service right, very good for Australian standards even (not to be compared with Aisian or European five star standards though). The decor is starting to age a bit and the place will need some overhaul in the next year or so but overall this hotel is nice, comfortable and staff are friendly. Works for me on business travel. Technology wise they are not state of the art though - no wifi in the rooms and very slow wifi in the lobby. If you were planning to use you iPad in your room forget about it... Anyway, great location, nice staff, ok food. Good place to stay when in Sydney, not to be confused with the 4 Star Sheraton which is true dump.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis”
Reviews.Author: DukeOfCumberland
Reviews.Content: After a night in a dreadful hotel in Sydney (see my other reveiws) I moved into the Sheraton for a couple of nights. From reception to food to cleanliness to helpfulness this place was great. I was at a conference here and the arrangements for that were first rate as well. The rooms are luxurious, it over looks the botanical gardens which are wonderful for a morning walk, it is close to the shops and the CBD (including our Sydney office). All in all well worth a visit. Only one minor gripe. The young blonde bar manager (I won't name her) can get extremely stroppy if you change your order or stay a little late. Perhaps needs a lesson in customer service.

Reviews.Title: “100% happy, wonderful hotel, luxurious and perfect location. Just 1 potential drawback for young people”
Reviews.Author: Brittany D
Reviews.Content: Hi there, I stayed at the Sheraton on the Park this weekend from Saturday 12 till Sunday 13. We had an executive park view room. For hotels, the bathroom is the most important feature in my opinion. Let me tell you that the Sheraton had the BEST bathroom in all of Sydney. I did a lot of research on 5 star hotels and I am absolutely 100% glad that I booked with Sheraton. I would have regretted it if I stayed anywhere else. I'll explain why in more detail: The bathroom was sensational and luxurious, I loved the marble! The beds were comfortable and the room was pretty spacious. The dÃ©cor of the room and the lobby was perfect for a 5 star hotel! You really felt special here. I did expect a better view from the room though. I guess the photos on the Sheraton website aren't an accurate representation of the view for ALL rooms in the hotel....but I did expect to see much more of the park from my room and less of the hotel walls. This is why I can't give a 5 point rating to "value" or "rooms" on Trip Advisor because I did choose to pay more for a room with a view; and expected a really beautiful view..but it just wasn't beautiful at all! The breakfast (which was included in the price of our room) was wonderful. Lots of choices and really delicious. The server was so kind to me because I have a lot of food interolances (gluten free, dairy free etc) and she went back and forth to the chef (on her on accord, I didn't even ask her too) to see if they had other gluten free cereals for me. They already had gluten free bread and soy milk which was great! It really relieved a lot of stress for me and she was so kind to help me out and comforting too. The only thing I was disappointed about was the reception. I felt like they weren't as polite/accommodating as they could have been..maybe because we are young guests (I am 18 my sister is 21) but at the end of the day, we are still paying guests and should be treated the same. I was asked 3 times by security if I was really a guest in the hotel and he seemed dubious when I said I was. I think that happened because I believe there were celebrities (or a really special guest) staying at the hotel at the time, so I do understand if they were just being wary of fans loitering in the lobby. However, if there weren't celebrities there, they really shouldn't have inquired whether we were guests or not. Do they think young people loiter in hotel lobbies for fun? No, I've got better things to do in my time, thank you! As for the location of this hotel, it is FABULOUS. You could not ask for better. We were walking distance from a beautiful park (perfect for touristy photos), and SO close to the CBD mall and other specialty shops (ie. David Jones, an alteration's place, JBHIFI, lots of restaurants etc etc). Plus, the sydney opera house was only 6 minutes away in a taxi. Overall, it was a wonderful choice to stay in the Sheraton. I am so glad, and TRULY cannot wait to my next stay there! I am going to recommend it my friends, and probably bring them along with me on my next stay! The only thing is I hope that they learn to treat younger guests the same because we are paying guests too and have the absolute right to be treated as such. Whilst the drawbacks I mentioned were annoying at the time, I don't think they impeded on my overall experience and I would still stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service; very good room; extremely efficient Executive lounge”
Reviews.Author: Bavaria34
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton on a business trip and the stay was great thanks to a very well run hotel. Room is very comfortable and Executive lounge was extremely good

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay in Sydney ...”
Reviews.Author: BillLA1
Reviews.Content: It's hard to beat the Sheraton for location and service. The hotel is right on the park, plus within walking distance of the harbor and botanical gardens. The facilities are very good - gym and pool on the top floor have great city views. My room was very large. And the breakfast buffet was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect !”
Reviews.Author: Geoff48
Reviews.Content: We are regular Guests at this wonderful Hotel. From the moment you are met by Tedley in the Driveway to Check In and all the Staff, everything is perfect ! We would recommend upgrading to the Executive Floor take advbantage of the Club Lounge, the Staff there are wonderful and the Drinks and Canapes are very welcome at the end ot the day. The Rooms are all a good size, wonderfully comfortable, and the Sweet Sleeper Beds are just that !

Reviews.Title: “From Great to Average”
Reviews.Author: rajeshkk
Reviews.Content: this is the 2nd time i stayed at the Sheraton on the Park - the first time was back in 2007. Whilst during my first stay, i recall my overall stay as being pleasant, this time around I was dissatisfied with the services provided. At checkin, i was disappointed that i was not provided an upgrade even though I was a platinum member. I was given a park facing room of average size. Next day, I noticed dust on the table and other surfaces - obviously they had not been cleaned/dusted. On another day, i had to call the service desk 4 times and wait for an hour before my laundry was picked up from the room. Definitely did not expect this from a premier hotel like the Sheraton. On the good side - the location is terrific. Bang in the middle of CBD with Hyde Park, Malls, Restaurants, Offices, Darling Harbor etc all close by. The exec lounge was also nice with a great view of the park.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: robertajaneSydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the second time -only a one night booking. Reception were lovely-allowed to check in early and received an upgraded room with both city and harbour views,Couldn't be happier with room and service.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly treated even though I'm a frequent guest”
Reviews.Author: TreyZ
Reviews.Content: I travel to Sydney every few weeks on business and typically stay at the Sheraton on the Park, and whilst it's by preferred hotel in Sydney I'm increasingly disappointed by the service, specifically at check in. The hotel is very conveniently located, the rooms are comfortable, spacious and well appointed, and the hotel facilities including the lounge, business centre and health club are all very good and the breakfast is excellent. As an SPG gold member I'm entitled to automatic room upgrades (upon availability) and whilst usually the staff are friendly and accommodating, I've now had two bad check in experiences in recent months including rudeness and general foul attitude from one of the assistant managers Christiann. Perhaps the Sheraton should invest in some common courtesy training as (some of) their front desk staff and managers poorly represent the brand.

Reviews.Title: “outdated hotel, needs upgrading”
Reviews.Author: rick79m
Reviews.Content: Was in sydney for business. checked in on friday and was amazed that they didnt have wifi. had to borrow a router to plug in which was fine (i have an ipad). ahd to leave hotel on saturday and return sunday but front desk assured me i would have the router in my room when i returned sunday night. returned sunday night and they had run out of routers (apaprently they have 5 for the whole hotel). told them this wasnt on given i was assured on friday i would have it and they suggested i work from reception where they actually have wifi. Ridiculous that a hotel that caters to business travellers doesnt have wifi - i expect that from a hostel (maybe) but the sheraton?? So i checked out to go to another hotel (Swisshotel - much better, bigger rooms, wifi, great views, cheaper) and after having spent 10 mins in the room they said that they would have to chargge me for that night. again i told them this was ridiculous and i had to insist that the manager do something about this. in the end they didnt charge me but seriously, get your act together Sheraton. you have far too uch competition very close to you that provide better service and features to rely on the strength of your brand name.

Reviews.Title: “good start to a holiday”
Reviews.Author: annincardiff
Reviews.Content: excellent location with helpful staff. Stayed for 3 nights at the start of a month long World cup holiday and was a nice way to begin the holiday. We arrived at 7 am and were told our room was ready and could book in early rather than dump the bags and come back later so we were very grateful for a nap and a shower to start the day with. Had to ask for the extra bed as it wasn't a triple room as booked but that was sorted quickly by very helpful staff. Free internet in the lobby and were not made to feel out of place by our less than 5 star attire. Good location to explore Darling Harbour and CBD sights of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a revamp!”
Reviews.Author: AW99
Reviews.Content: I have been a very regular guest at Sheraton on the Park for the last 7 years. The location of the hotel is fantastic, rooms are comfortable and the executive lounge is ok. However, this place really needs a refurbishment! The furniture is looking old, the aircon is temperamental and the technology is outdated. I also find the features in the bathrooms need updating and it is not uncommon to have maintenance visit to adjust water temperatures, etc. As other people have posted, the hotel is nice but certainly not 5 star! My other beef is upgrades. I am an SPG Platinum member and always used to enjoy upgrades to a suite or balcony room. However, these are now a thing of the past and I generally only get upgraded every 4th or 5th stay.

Reviews.Title: “Luxe and Close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: Maryanne K
Reviews.Content: Whenever my husband and I visit Sydney, we are sure to stay at the Sheraton On The Park. Service does not get any better than this. The staff are so attentive and lovely. The rooms are divine. Our last stay we were in an Executive Suite which was perfection. The location is close to shops and all the sites that tourists would want to see. Breakfast is also good, with quite a variety however I have never eaten any other meals there. Last time we were there, I saw Miranda Kerr! What a bonus to see her and know that she was staying at the same hotel!! We look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, good location, nice room.. But not 5 star luxurious”
Reviews.Author: junebug75
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for a week at the Sheraton. Very good location and good consistent service. The room is comfortable and so is the bed, however the overall interior of the rooms and the hotel is not what I would consider 5 star luxury compared to the amazing new hotels popping up all over Asia. But it's good value for money (except for the internet) and a good business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: maiire
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for two nights on a business trip. Pro's: - The staff are very friendly. I arrived at 7am and there was a room ready for me but I was informed that it may be noisey due to it being a joining room. I declined this room and they gave me access to the health centre so I could have a shower (after a 24hr flight). - Gym and health centre are great - shower, sauna, steam room, pool with a view - excellent. - Business centre on level 21 is great. Wifi was pretty quick and I could sit there at my leisure and have some nibbles and go online. Breakfast was free every morning & you also get free wine at happy hour so it was very good. Staff again are very attentive. Not everyone gets access to this area you need to be a preferred cardholder or pay for it. - Service - when I checked in my room wasnt ready. I was in the business centre when my room became available. They dropped up the room key to me and then left my bag in my room for me - it's the little things like this that make you feel special. - Mini-bar was well serviced. - Room & bed were comfortable. Cons: - No WIFI in the rooms - I still cannot understand why hotels charge $24 for internet access in your room it's bizarre. - Shower door was jammed - I had to jank it open. Much better than the Four Points by Sheraton which is where I am staying now - eek!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: d t
Reviews.Content: Rooms - very spacious, well laid out and comfortable. They are not in any way soundproof though and we were kept awake all night with traffic noise (and we weren't even facing the main road). That alone would preclude us from coming back. Shame because otherwise it's great. Service - very good. Food - one of the better breakfast buffets in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: Ajmac09
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights for a business trip. On arrival at 10pm I was greeted buy a very friendly trainee and her manager. All paper work was completed quickly and professionally and was soon in my room which was a city view room. The room was lovely, clean and the bathroom very impressive. The room was well insulated from the noise despite being on the 8th floor due to electronic shutters that can be closed. The room was generous in size and well thought out with separate lounge, desk and good size bed. Great size LCD TV, the only bad part was poor reception on channel 7. The buffet breakfast included in the price was fantastic and had everything you can think of. All of the staff I encountered were very friendly and accommodating and I can highly recommend this hotel which is in the best location for exploring the CBD and surrounds. I will definitely be back for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “True Sheraton Experience”
Reviews.Author: SPG-41640084489
Reviews.Content: This is always my first choice of hotel when staying in Sydney; it is one of the best hotels offered by SPG. From the minute you walk though the door you will feel at ease and a sense of belonging. I have created many special memories in this hotel and it will always have a soft spot in my heart. Lovely rooms and AMAZING Suites One of the BEST executive clubs I have ever seen! Well equipped gym and nice lap pool Sheraton Beds are so commutable i purchased one for home True 5 star service (especial in the executive club) and excellent rates to top it off I have stayed at many hotels especially under the Starwood brand, and I truly believe that Sheraton on the park is the best way to experience Sydney for business or pleasure. A stay at the Sheraton on the park is an experience and I look forward to my next one To me the only one word describes this hotel and that is â€œAristocracy" Best regards and keep up the great work. [--]

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: why_travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 days, and it was a very enjoyable stay. here are some pros and cons Pros: 1-Reception staff very helpful and quick at check in/check out 2-Gave us our room several hours early, which was awesome since we arrived 7am and we were knackered! and it was very much appreciated. 3- We paid for our breakfast on the first day since it was to included,however on the last day we left before breakfast was served, and so at check out it was deducted from our bill. 4- Breakfast was really really good, and has so many different choices in it plus an "egg station" which made for a great start to the day 5- The fitness center was a lot better than expected with all the equipment mostly used and enough of them so you did not have to wait, plus a sauna and a steam room too. Towels are provided and the place is very clean 6- The room was spacious and had a lovely bathtub and shower to relax in after a day of sight seeing 7- the location is fantastic. Close to everything. Cons: 1- the first room we checked into was not a "park view" like expected, you had to turn your head around form a side window to see the park. It has to do with the angle the building is at. So if it really matters to you , double check before you book the room 2- The plumbing in the first room was a bit off, so when the bath tub was emptying out the water, the rest of the bathroom flooded! 3- The first room was also right next to the service room, so there was a lot of door noise through out the day and night. All of the cons were dealt with by the staff immediately and we moved to a proper "park view" room that was very spacious and nice. The entire hotel is very friendly and all the staff smile and say hello whenever you pass by them in the halls. Overall we had a fantastic stay and we would happily return there again on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the service”
Reviews.Author: Eurofriends
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton on the Park is in an excellent location opposite pretty Hyde Park. Itâ€™s deceptive because on maps it seems to be out of the way, but itâ€™s actually very well located to get to anywhere else in the City. Thereâ€™s also a railway station a few metres away. Rooms are well furnished, the Sweet Sleeper beds very conducive to a good nightâ€™s sleep. Room service was on time and the food high quality and hot. The pool opens at 6am which means that youâ€™re able to have a refreshing swim before starting your work day. The views are great, but because the pool is heated to a comfortable temperature (thankfully!) it means that the windows steam up at that time of the morning, so you should step out onto the balcony to see the view. But in the end itâ€™s really all about the 5 star service. Check-in and out are efficient, the concierge and bell hops extremely helpful. In fact all of the staff are very professional. There is a business centre just to the left of the lobby where the Internet is accessible at no additional charge, but internet included in the room rate would be useful. Thoroughly enjoyed my stay, the Sheraton on the Park may have just become my favourite hotel for business stays in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “locked out!”
Reviews.Author: esrafabri
Reviews.Content: We spent nearly a week at the Sheraton. (Aug 2011)The hotel is very well located, absolutely beautifully decorated( we were on the executive floors) we could have had an unique experience if we were not locked out an evening during our stay. The hotel had a problem with our credit card and instead of contacting us, locked us out immediately. Once we learned what was going on, it got resolved but we had a sleepless night because we were completely nervous after such an experience with two small kids sleeping on the hallway. The person in charge could not even present himself (manager on duty Steven Hamilton)to ask for an excuse, neither a Miss Penelope at the reception after they both have been less than polite... Otherwise the ladies at the lounge of executive floor and the housekeeping personnel were amazing. Probably there needs to be more attention on management level than the personnel...

Reviews.Title: “My hotel when in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: SavannahLady2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed here and at the Westin Sydney while on business, and I actually preferred this hotel. It was in the CBD, right across from the park. Just loved this place. The only comment I would make to Starwood - and it's not a criticism of this hotel particularly, is that the pillows are too soft. They should offer tempurpedic pillows upon request, especially for Gold and Platinum members. The spa here is top notch and unexpectedly reasonably priced. A full massage, body wrap and scrub was $199 and that's a pretty darn good price at a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location”
Reviews.Author: spe18z
Reviews.Content: Have never considered staying here before due what I thought was a poor location. Well I have to say the location is perfect, you are so handy to everything & a very easy walk to pretty much everything. My room was fine, but I have to admit I was a little perplexed at the fact that I booked direct with the hotel as I am a SPG member, the view was of an office building. My daughter however booked through an accommodation wholesaler & had a room on a higher floor with a view of Sydney Harbour and paid a lot less! Dinner at the hotel restaurant was very nice as was the breakfast, plenty on offer & nice atmosphere but very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Check what your rate includes”
Reviews.Author: michelleski
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton by default as it was school holidays and alot of other places were booked out. The stay was great, it was about $220 per night, beds are extremely comfortable, as are the pillows, it's in the CBD so it's walking distance to everywhere. Service was as to be expected, rooms are spotlessly clean. We didn't eat anything there as the breakfast was not included in our rate and they ask $40 for breakfast, so we went out into a city cafe and got a good breakfast for less than half of that amount. Parking was not included in our rate which was a bit annoying as it was just an extra expense. So make sure you check if breakfast and parking is included because if it isn't then you could potentiall by up for an extra approx $80 per day. We had overseas visitors who stayed in room with the park view, which is beatiful. My husband and I were on the city side and the views were just looking straight at another building, so if you want views then you need to book the park side of the building, which is obviously going to be more expensive. Overall, great experience, nothing to complain about, and everything expected in this level of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend getaway for a Sydney couple”
Reviews.Author: GrooveJunky
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend stayed here for one night on the same night that i celebrated my birthday with Friends in Surry Hills. I am a Sydneysider born and bred but this was the first time we stayed at the Sheraton. LOVED IT! I can't really fault this hotel. Nice lobby with easy street access, friendly staff, amazing room, great bathroom, awesome breakfast, great location......in one word, GREAT. Probably the only thing wrong with the whole hotel is the expensive internet ($25 for Wifi in a 5-star hotel? should be free!). However, i am happy to report that even on Level 21 where our room was, my Telstra Next G internet on my iphone worked perfectly. My Optus tablet (Motorola Xoom) on the other hand, could not even pick up a signal. Still, cant complain when you are that high up!

Reviews.Title: “Five Star - On request”
Reviews.Author: SamsonNIte
Reviews.Content: The arrival at the hotel is wonderful with the feel of a grand hotel experience. Busy, buzzing lobby with slick looking staff. Everything functions efficiently and the room is pretty average, what you would expect from a Sheraton or Marriott, but the bathrooms are a standout. The hotel service is a let down because there are many elements which should be provided as par for the course but you have to ask for. i.e. If you want a newspaper you have to hang a sign on the door, if you want your bed linen changed you have to put a piece of card on the bed, if you want new towels, you have to put them in the bath and turn down service did not happen during the stay. So if you don't take the time to read all the various pieces of card scattered around the room, you don't get full service. Maybe I'm a little old fashioned but when you pay $350.00 for a room you expect the basic five star services, otherwise I would go to a less expensive option.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and still the best 5 Star in Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: AllanCanberra
Reviews.Content: I have reviewed this property before but after recently having a not so good experience at another Sydney hotel I thought it was appropriate to review it after my stay this weekend. The single best world to describe Sheraton on the Park is CONSISTENCY. I booked a city view room special via the Sheraton web site for $199.00 and couldn't have been happier. The room was large, very well appointed and the bathroom fantastic. The Sheraton on the Park has always been consistently very good. Thank you Sheraton for a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: yeowon
Reviews.Content: Mum and I went for a 3 night getaway to Sydney. We have been many times and usually stay at the Sheraton. Shopped around on the web as prices were quite high as Sydney is full this weekend. Was going to try the Westin and had booked but then noticed three days out that SPG website price went down to $290 for twin room incl breakfast and late checkout. So we ended up at Sheraton. On checkin tried asking for Park upgrade, ended up costing us $40 per night but it is well worth it. The view of the park from 16th floor is glorious with the church there, also the room has a balcony for that extra bit of luxe. Anyway so glad we stayed here it is superb, luxurious rooms and fabulous buffet breakfast that usually costs $42pp. Other 5 star hotels are slightly off centre from the shopping even the Westin. I went to have a look and to be honest the Westin seemed huge to me. I like the more intimate feel of the Sheraton, even though the Sheraton has 500 rooms against Westin 400. My tips for the Sheraton are: Join SPG and check rates, they are moving all the time, SPG floors are very well kept. Join up if you need to. Use back entrance at Lobby area and go to Elizabeth St entrance of David Jones, the lower ground floor is the most wonderful food court. You can eat there as well or get gourmet takeout. Over at the Piccadilly Centre (same exit as above) across the road there is a Vodafone booth. I just got a 5gb prepaid sim card for my Ipad for $29, usuable for a month, as I find the $24 per day internet room charge here a bit high. BTW that might be a limited offer as it is usually only 2gb for $29. If you want to get a lot done in a short amount of time, the Sheraton is the centre of the universe for shopping Sydney. You will spend more time at other hotels getting to your location. Either that or the room won't be as big as what you get at the Sheraton. Sydney is a fabulous city and they have their act together as far as public transport goes, so I urge you to book that trip and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great everything.”
Reviews.Author: Evan B
Reviews.Content: Had a great time here. Comfy bed, nice shower, fast Internet, quiet, lots of gym equipment, plenty of seats around lobby to hang and surf the web on. Internet in room was $30ish, which is alot to me.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, quality service”
Reviews.Author: travelhappy15
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton on the Park is one of our favourite hotels in the CBD. No matter what type of room we stay in, it is always tastefully furnished, large and comfortable, with a luxury bathroom. From reception through to the staff on the floors, they are all friendly and happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “After all these years, I still think it's Sydney's best”
Reviews.Author: StevenBSydney
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times and always look forward to it. Front the grand lobby it just gives a good sense of style and the feeling you're staying in a special hotel. The rooms are great quality and appointed in 5 star style. The executive lounge is very nice and has great views over Hyde park. The location is a great base to explore the CBD, get down to the Quay or over the park to Museums and restaurants of Surrey Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Great all rounder”
Reviews.Author: roughrob
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when passing through for 3 days. I would highly recommend a suite as the space, beds and bathrooms are well worth the upgrade. Breakfast in this hotel surpassed my expectations, itâ€™s difficult to know where to begin with all of the options availableâ€¦ The service was genuine and friendly from front desk to housekeeping, we preferred the Sheraton staff and the general hotel ambience over the Four Seasons. The location is great â€“ itâ€™s immediately opposite the park and within easy walking distance of pretty much everything an eager tourist could want â€“ transfer times from the airport are about 20 mins. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are looking for a good base from which to explore Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Amber0002
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel just near the park and an easy walk to Cirqular Quay. Rooms are large and very grand! Nice staff - service with a smile!

Reviews.Title: “Terrace Suite room”
Reviews.Author: livelife990
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a terrace suite room for 2 nights. If staying at Sheraton on the Park i recommend this room, view is amazing. The best thing for me about this hotel was the view, so it would be great for a tourist visiting Sydney. If you like great room service food than this is "not" the hotel for you. If you are willing to eat out and wanting a great view (terrace view suite) than I highly recommend this hotel. Breakfast in the club lounge was very disappointing. In summary if standard of food is not an issue and you are willing to dine out, then this hotel is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Location is fantastic, but if you like really hot rooms then this is the hotel to stay at”
Reviews.Author: Peter_12325
Reviews.Content: Booked an executive club room which had great views of Hyde park and the club lounge is great. Only problem is that at night the change the temperature in the rooms and you end up waking up dehydrated in the middle of the night. Maintenance tried a number of times bit nothing changed. Offered to change the room on the last night at 1.30 am, but told us that we would have to pack everything up. Very dissapointed as we were there for nights of relaxation, and didn't get hardly any sleep. It was cheaper for me to stay at another 5 star hotel with heavenly beds and rooms that do have good temperature control. Don't think I will be staying here again. Hotel looking a bit tired now

Reviews.Title: “All time favourite Sydney hotel”
Reviews.Author: brie182
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton on the Park is my FAVOURITE hotel in the whole of Sydney, even in comparison to other beautiful 5 star hotels such as the Westin. The rooms are luxurious, the staff are so friendly, the breakfast is AMAZING and the view of Hyde Park is lovely. I especially love the grand staircase and everything about this property! It is absolutely perfect if you are planning an inner city shopping trip, rather than the tourist activities of Darling Harbour, due to it's location being right in the middle of the city rather than the harbour, but it is still so easy to get a quick taxi or a 10 minute walk. It suits absolutely everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton - maintaining the level”
Reviews.Author: geraldq
Reviews.Content: The outstanding reputation of the Sheraton Group is certainly enhanced by a stay at their hotel in Sydney, opposite Hyde Park. I was greeted by a trainee ar Reception who might have been a seasoned employee by the quality of her welcome and efficiency. Excellent room, spotlessly presented, large bathroom with great bath and separate shower meant that it was almost a home away from home. A beautifully presented breakfast, centred around the perfect omlette meant a great start to a business day!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: TessMoodie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the weekend, had the most awesome selection of food and desserts at the hotel's Botanica brassiere where every staff are helpful and warm. Will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: fasta
Reviews.Content: We stay here each year for a footy trip with a large group from Melbourne, we have tried a few others around Sydney but Sheraton on the Park seems to have become the favorite. Great breakfasts, cool bar and awesome location make it hard to beat. Rooms are recently refurbished and staff are very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: sbouret
Reviews.Content: After a bad experience with another hotel in Sydney (see my other review), I have booked 3 nights at the Sheraton on The Park. What a wonderful hotel and a great experience! I got a city king room and it was very spacious, modern, very well equipped and extremely comfortable. It also has a large walk in closet and marble bathroom. Service was also excellent. It is very well located, in the heart of CBD and close to major places.

Reviews.Title: “Step out the back door into the best shopping in Sydney....fantastic”
Reviews.Author: lee65
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Sheraton on the Park on & off for over 20 years. We have tried the Westin, Shangri-La, Marriot Sydney Harbour, Sofitel [never go back], Swissotel, Four Seasons, Amora Jamieson, InterContinental but we still keep coming back to the Sheraton. The location can not be beat - out the back door & cross the road to Market Street David Jones or walk to the corner & across the road into the impresssive Westfield. We always try to get the Park, Stay & Play deal [about $A240 including parking & breakfast]. The buffet breakfast would be one of the best in Sydney [probably only the Four Seasons is better] but it is the location that can not be beat. Unless you have to be down at Circular Quay, stay in the heart of the city where all the action is. Hyde park across the road leads you on down to the botantical gardens for one of the best walks in Sydney. Right from the greeting when you open your car door, to Reception, breakfast staff & checking-out, all staff is very professional, polite & genuinely friendly. The motel room is tastfully furnished, that black marble bathroom is still impressive after all these years & there is plenty of storage in the walk-in wardrobe for those shopping purchases. If I had to offer a criticism it would be the Bar on the 1st floor. After attending a function & driving back to the hotel, my husband & I thought we would indulge in a night-cap. At 10.30pm on a Friday, there was two people in this groovy bar overlooking Hyde Park. When looking at the price of drinks, we know why. A glass of Moet was $31 [you can buy a bottle at Dan Murphy's for $45!!!] and a Margarita $25. With so many bars now springing up in Sydney, it is one area the hotel could focus on. It is such a stunning location, but the prices are a definite turn off. We will be back, but not for a night-cap.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay and even better!”
Reviews.Author: JesskaTwo
Reviews.Content: Second time we've stayed in this property, still an amazing as the first time. Love the block out shutters. Love the bathroom, only minor complaint is I didn't like the shower head or the water pressure. Love the bed. Rate included breakfast, amazing selection (although it did boast waffles but I couldn't find any anywhere!), only another minor complaint is that the staff were very quick to jump on cleaning your table when you left to get more food, so my partner came back to no coffee or juice and had to go get more. Highly recommended property. Will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excruciatingly Bad”
Reviews.Author: roscoep1
Reviews.Content: No wonder the Australian Tourism industry is in trouble after trying to book a room at the Sydneyâ€™s Sheraton on the Park today on 30 August 2011. I telephone their switch and they answer and put you immediately on hold with a hideous and loud message advertising something to you that has no relevance whatsoever. You need to pull the phone away from your ear as it blasts away. You then hear a number of different sounds as if someone is trying to pick up the call but chooses not to and you remain on hold for about 3 minutes. Someone eventually picks up and asks you what you want and I says â€˜reservation pleaseâ€™. After another wait of about 4 minutes listening to more strange dial tones, you eventually get transferred to a central reservation operator it seems in a call centre in Singapore. You speak to a young lass in Singapore who has poor listening skills, doesnâ€™t really understand westernised English, articulates poorly and the delay in the exchange means you constantly interrupt each other. The line is not clear. It seems to take forever for the operator to understand my request. I decide that the Sheraton on the Park doesnâ€™t not deserve my business and terminate the call, If they cannot get a simple booking right, the rest of the service will be as frustrating and broken down. Never ever again at the Sheraton on the Park. Ross P Kennedy

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in Sydney, perfect location, good service and comfey rooms”
Reviews.Author: Andy and Jo G
Reviews.Content: Our last trip to Sydney was in 2008 when we stayed here at Sheraton on the Park for 2 nights. This time we were staying for 4 and plumped for this hotel again after a good search around â€œjust to make sureâ€�. We booked their "stay, park and play" package at 259AUD per night. This included breakfast (which normally costs 42AUD per person). The breakfast is great and there is extensive choice, including full English, continental, Thai, even a dedicated omelette chef. We booked a city side room (of course the views are not going to be as nice as park side). The rooms are spacious and have lovely plantation style shutters which can be angled up as you wish, there are also black out blinds. Large luxurious marble bathrooms too. The beds are just so comfey. We arrived early in the morning after a 22 hour flight from Heathrow. We were greeted by a lovely receptionist (who was friendly and professional). She was also able to book us into a room straight away. We try and fit in a daily swim and jacuzzi (usually pretty empty...guess the business travellers donâ€™t have time to swim!). There is a gym up there too but we havnâ€™t popped our heads round. We really believe that this hotel represents value for money. If we had one gripe, we would say that the bar is soul less. However, if you turn right outside of the hotel and walk for 1 minute you will find the fabulous Bambini wine room. Sheraton on the Park gives you the best location from which to explore Sydney. For example, turn right out of the hotel (concierge will give exact directions) and a 20 min walk will find you in Surry Hills (food lovers paradiseâ€¦.Billy Kwong, Assiette, Spice I am, Red Lantern to name a few places tried this time and loved) . Turn left and walk 20 mins and you are in the heart of iconic Sydneyâ€¦.opera house, circular key. Two streets behind the hotel you can catch the monorail to darling harbour. We really do recommend this hotel for its combination of comfey rooms, great location and friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Terrific Location”
Reviews.Author: MPCLDC
Reviews.Content: Sheraton on the Park is a truly wonderful hotel. Terrific location that is on the park and close to highway. The hotel is modern and very well decorated lobby. The rooms are small, and some on the back-side of the hotel have very poor views, request Park View. The breakfast is expensive, however very good with a very large selection.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: vpsharma
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Sheraton On-The-Park, Sydney on a business trip for 5 days. It is a good Hotel with spacious rooms and all amenities and good service. Located close to City's main Business District, it is ideally located for business travelers. The Park opposite the Hotel provides a nice and green area for morning / evening walks. The Hotel is costly though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Brillant Service”
Reviews.Author: Surfman35
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend and would recommend it for service location and staff. Only problem we had was that parking was an issue, but really could not blame the hotel. Woudl stay again, recommend a park view suite.

Reviews.Title: “Can't speak highly enough of this home away from home in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: PandSMadison
Reviews.Content: Great location, lovely decor, fantastic geust facilities - especially the Starwood lounge here. Room decor is great, reception services friendly and welcoming, business louge is fantastic and service spot on. The location in the middle of Sydney and near railway for travelling around makes this a great spot to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay - we love this place!”
Reviews.Author: bedoiunfamily
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here. The staff were fantastic-Very helpful and friendly. The rooms are great- lots of space and lovely bathrooms. Have stayed in many places in Sydney but this is the place I would back to first!

Reviews.Title: “not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Dahee
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very spacious, great bathroom, walk in robe, lounge, view etc etc. The thing that lets this property down is no Wi-Fi (or was that just me???) and the OUTRAGEOUS costs for food and beverage, particularly room service with the jaw-dropping $8 service charge per order... (i.e a heineken for $10 plus $8 fee) A caesar salad is close to AUD$45. There is no way that I would order room service despite charges going back to company. Service levels were ok, nothing spectacular. Would I recommend it? Yes, purely based on room size and location.

Reviews.Title: “Now I Know Why Rates are so High”
Reviews.Author: Trekkingtheglobe_10
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at most of the 5* hotels in Sydney through this point, and have become quite familiar with reg. rack rates at area hotels. I love the Starwood hotels, but I do not equate Sheratons with 5* ratings, much less upper 4* to 5* prices. This particular stay with my partner comprised of 3 hotels (1 in the Blue Mountains, the Fairmont -- if anything, I would advise against staying there -- & the other the Shangri-la), and a 3- or 4-night stay @ Sheraton on the Park. Overall, I was very pleased by the accommodations, facilities & presentation of the hotel and its staff. As a Starwood Preferred Member, I usually find that I am able to check-in once I arrive. I usually fly about 24 hours before I arrive in Sydney at 6:30AM & it's REALLY NICE to have a room to check into immediately. The 1 and only, slightly negative comparison I can make to another Starwood hotel, the Westin on Martin Place where I am always checked-in upon arrival, is that I had to wait a couple of hours before I was checked-in. Not the end of the world & got to check-in early anyway . From the start, I was impressed when handed my room key card, as I had asked for my luggage to be brought up. Apparently, it had already been placed in the closet for me. The rooms are a generous size with a very smart, practical layout. The placement of the bed, the work desk and small shaped seating area & table fit perfectly. Nothing was cramped. The walk-in closet provided more than ample space to hang clothing, position luggage and close doors. Directly across nicely-sized bathroom with separate shower and tub. The sink had ample space to place all I needed to and still manage to have a lot of space. The bathroom had black and white marble, which I dislike in general, but was extremely happy with the accommodations as they were. There were a number of windows all around my room. Even better, and a feature most hotels do not use, I had a nifty switch next to the bed which controlled motorized blackout shades and another switch for room lighting. Every member of the hotel staff was extremely professional and polite. Although there is an in-room fee for internet, you may use the internet for free on your own device in the lobby. The hotel is centrally located and guarantees for a great stay in Sydney, especially for those who intend on shopping! So, as I said: I now know why the rates are so high; the hotel is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: sydneysim
Reviews.Content: Though only able to stay for one night, I can honestly say this hotel provides the best service we have ever received in any hotel so far. The staff were welcoming and accommodating and willing to go that extra mile. This is a nice change from alot of other 5 star hotels we have stayed at. This the first time we have stayed at this Sheraton and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Really Outstanding 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: tylerat
Reviews.Content: I am a Western chain customer. In Sydney I have tried most, Four Seasons, Shangri-La, both Marriotts, Westin etc. Cannot comment on others but if you are loke me and want that secure feeling you get with Global chains make no doubt the Sheraton is your best bet. By far. Although a bit older the upkeep is fantastic. Feels great. Rooms are spacious and most bells and whistles (no wireless internet in rooms only caveat). Executive lounge rocks. Team there is very attentive and food spread is top notch. I always arrive very early and they make every atttempt possible to get me in room as fast as they can. Great location as well. Go wireless Sheraton please, but thanks for the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Nice inner city hotel”
Reviews.Author: bekky-boo
Reviews.Content: For a great night out in the city you cant go wrong. We got a deal for $269 that included accomodation in a park view room, parking and a full breakfast for 2. Compared to deals offered by similar hotels in this part of Sydney this place is a great deal (most will charge at least $30 for self parking). Our room was large and clean with a lovely outlook onto trees (rare in the city). Even though we were on the lowest floor we had very little street noise and did not feel like we were in one of the hotels "cheap" rooms. Location wise this place is around the corner from the the major Pitt St shopping mall and up the road from Martin place. Hyde park is accross the road as is Macquarie St which contains many of Sydneys historic buildings (and of course leads to the Opera House). A quick 20 min walk down to sydney harbour or across the road to the underground train station for a 5 min train ride anywhere in the CBD. The only negative I would say is the lack of restaurants for dinner in the direct area around the hotel, however a 25 min walk or 5 -10 min taxi will land you in Surry Hills or The Rocks, both which have many great dining options. All in all, a lovely hotel, fantastic location, friendly staff and tasty breakfast with parking right in the CBD, what is not to like?

Reviews.Title: “100% Recommend”
Reviews.Author: TLG4
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is absolutely beautiful. We stayed her for a weekend. It is handy to everything and is adjacent to the department store. Lovely room and service. Would definately recommend for any occasion and any length of stay. we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “My favourite Sydney hotel”
Reviews.Author: sdwylie
Reviews.Content: There are many reasons why the Sheraton on the Park in Sydney is one of my favourite regular hotels. The hotel has an impressively grand entrance and foyer, excellent and attentive service, and possibly the most diverse and comprehensive breakfast buffet offering I've ever seen. The rooms are clean and stylish, with modern art deco stylings, and the marble bathrooms and walk-in robes give every room the feeling of a suite. The rooms all have exceptionally large desks - often large enough to seat 2, which is great for business meetings (many of the rooms also have a lounge and coffee table). The work desk and chair is comfortable enough for a full day of work. The fitness centre, pool, spa, sauna, and day spa are all exceptional - including a balcony and floor-to-ceiling windows surrounding the pool, overlooking Hyde Park - it's a great inclusion. The room service menu has a good range, although expect to pay a premium. The mini bar can be paid for using Starwood Preferred Guest StarPoints, which is great for business travellers who are members. The option of using "Link @ Sheraton" in the foyer gives free computer/Internet access - although access in room is paid. I love the packages that the hotel often offers through its website, including one that often includes self-parking and buffet breakfast for around $50/night more than the cheapest room rate. This is excellent value, especially as the self-parking includes unlimited entry/exit over a 24 hour period. Great when you want to use the hotel as a base, but travel to and from several meetings. The hotel is also exceptionally consistent - I have stayed at least 10 times this year, and every stay has offered me exactly what I expected, or better - down to the room type, included amenities, and rate inclusions. This hotel has to exhibit one of the most successful combinations of style and opulence mixed with business travel conveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good!”
Reviews.Author: mrswilliamson
Reviews.Content: Booked a room on wotif.com for a king suite but when I arrived they could only give me a twin. I was told to "refer to the small print" when I queried this. Fine - but less attitude would have been good! Sheraton beds here have always been great. Close to all amenities and transport. Easy motorway access also so airport run is brilliant. Breakfast great and it sets you up for the day!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Experience”
Reviews.Author: russem007
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our wedding anniversary as we wanted to stay close to home as I was almost 30 weeks pregnant. When we arrived half an hour before check in we were told that our room was not ready so we checked our bags and made the short walk to Pitt st mall. Upon return we were given our room key and told that our bags were in our room. We had booked a park view room and had paid extra for the view. We were very surprised to walk into a room that faced directly into the building next door and our bags were no where to be seen. Needless to say we went straight back to check in to complain. We were told that the room was indeed a park view room! Who were they kidding, you had to press you face to the window and crane your neck to see the park! After some disagreement our room was changed and we walked into the room that we were expecting - one with a beautiful view over the park. On a whole we had a lovely time but I was disappointed with the service we were given when it came to the room. To argue over the view from a room with a guest is not really up to standard when you are paying this much for the hotel, especially when your guest is clearly pregnant.

Reviews.Title: “STILL ONE OF OUR FAVOURITES”
Reviews.Author: Champagne4everyone
Reviews.Content: My Partner Rob and I stayed at the SOTP for 3 nights this past weekend, we used points to upgrade to the Executive Lounge which truly is a wonderful place to chill out at the end of a day. We were allocated our favourite room which is not guaranteed but they certainly do the best to do what they can to make our stay enjoyable, even though this hotel is primarily a Business Hotel and they have a lot of regular customers, we always feel welcome back at this hotel. As Gold members of Starwood and this is our preferred choice when we travel we are used to having turn down service and bottled water, this is something in which I feel this hotel could improve with is providing turn down service and bottled water to sleep with. We did request it on check in and the Club Manager did add it to our profile and request it, it did happen on the first night but not on the second night, it's not a biggy but it is just annoying because these little things make the difference between a great stay and a good stay, The only other criticism I have is that the breakfast selection in the Club lounge is not extensive so if you wish to have a big breakfast, you are better off getting breakfast included in your stay and dining downstairs in the restaurant. On the positive the staff in the Executive Lounge are truly the best in the Country, Evan, Christy and team really make one feel welcome and special, they remember who you are, they remember your favourite drink and THIS is why we keep returning to Sheraton on the Park. Thanks to Brad and his team, we look forward to visiting again soon. Brad and Rob

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay. A Sydney experience.”
Reviews.Author: TuckerFiend
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is a lovely lady, she is a mature lovely lady. The entrance off the street is large and the staff quick to assist with the car and luggage. The large foyer says it all, huge columns and slabs of shining stone cladding and screaming opulence. Reception staff equalled the efficient concourse service and we were booked in, in minutes. My wife and I stayed here some considerable time ago and I had forgotten what a great hotel it is. Surprisingly rated at only four stars and showing some signs of use. In no way is it dilapidated but nicely giving a very homely feel. We were upgraded to a king room overlooking the park. It was large and tastefully appointed with quality fittings and decorator items. The Sheraton is very proud of its beds and there is a good reason, it was great. The room had a large marble bathroom with separate shower. The quantity of water that the shower produced can only be described as a deluge, almost enough to knock you off your feet and wash you down the plug hole. Great for those like me who tend to use the shower as a marker in the assessment of the hotel experience but bad news for the environment, if there is an environmental issue. If I am not mistaken in Sydney there is an environmental issue albeit not critical at the moment. Anyway hold on to something when you turn on the water, you may be surprised. This stay was only for only one night when and we had little choice but to take our car along. When in Sydney, I would avoid taking a car like the plague; the Sheraton is charging $49 for overnight valet parking. The Sheraton on the Park does things very well. We will not leave it so long before we are back.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time in Sheraton and still impressive”
Reviews.Author: MelbDude
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the 2nd time in Sheraton on the Park in June 2011. It was really really busy for the long holiday and they had a tour group which flooded the whole building, esp. the lobby. Nevertheless, the service was great regardless of the huge crowd. Breakfast is managed very very well. A little bit noisy sometimes at night from the tour group, but that's not really the hotel's fault. We came in around 1PM but the room wasn't ready until 3PM. They gave us an access to the club lounge which was a great place to rest. Location is great, services were friendly and professional, and the room and amenities were clean. A little bit of cons: concierge didn't come to help us (we brought many many bags and a stroller) until we approached him and asked for help, but that's just a small annoyance at the start. We booked a double king single but initially told it wasn't available (we booked 4 months in advance). Eventually, one was available so it's ok. And finally, they somehow charged me for minibar: vodka, beer, etc. but I don't drink alcohol. I called them and took 10 secs to redraw the charges. Again, it's a no biggie. Overall, the little problems won't prevent me to come back to the hotel as long as they keep the great customer services.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I had hoped for”
Reviews.Author: Tobeconfirmed
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on business and was, quite frankly, rather disappointed. The room was quite large and comfortable, but the decor was somewhat dated. The hotel is in a wonderful location and I had wanted to stay here for some time. My room had a window into the central atrium of the hotel building and it was very noisy. I suspect that the air-conditioning units were position in this area and I had a poor night's sleep as a result of the noise - from this and then bottles being collected on the street in the morning. Overall, just an average experience and I had certainly hoped and expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel overlooking Hyde Park”
Reviews.Author: KJC55
Reviews.Content: This is a first class hotel in a lovely location. The staff were all extremely helpful and the room was excellent. Breakfast in the main restaurant was a daily delight and the lobby bar was also great for coffee and light meals. Location was ideal - the main harbour was only 10 mins walk away and Darling harbour about 15 mins away. Sydney tower was just around the corner and the Park across the road leads to the Botanical gardens. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best Club room I have encountered”
Reviews.Author: Ericscott
Reviews.Content: The beautiful Sheraton on the Park is a true five star hotel, with a sumptuous marble lobby, extremely polite and helpful staff, and of course the best beds in the business. We stayed in a huge King room overlooking the park. There was a king sized bed, corner lounge unit, working desk with internet connection and 32â€� flat screen TV â€“ and complimentary morning newspaper. There was tea and coffee of every persuasion and the service was impeccable. We found a defective kettle in the room, rang customer service and it was replaced within five minutes. We were given access to the Executive Club and the health club. Up on the 22nd floor is a sparkling professional-sized gym with spa and sauna and a heated swimming pool plenty big enough for doing a few laps. It was very impressive. There was something exotic about a swimming pool at the top of the building. And the Executive Club on the 21st floor is one of the most comfortable and cosy rooms Iâ€™ve experienced anywhere in the world. There are armchairs, alcoves and in the centre a glass case containing flames, which wasnâ€™t hot, but added a wonderful ambience to the room. Hot snacks were there aplenty as the wine was top drawer. Pre dinner drinks went from 5-7.30 pm, which was perhaps a good job because it would be so easy to settle in for the night. In the Botanica Brasserie the breakfast buffet is all you can ask for â€“ and it served the best croissants Iâ€™ve ever eaten in any hotel! Over time I have become very fond of the Starwood Hotel Group quality and once again there was no let down. The Sheraton on the Park rooms can cost anything from $200 up a night on special internet deals. My deal was three nights for $460 on a â€œbuy two get one free deal. The hotel comes highly recommended. 161 Elizabeth Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2000. Phone: (61)(2) 9286 6000 Fax: (61)(2) 9286 6686

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service, great location, loved it”
Reviews.Author: stargazeypie
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located next to the park and close to the Harbour the Sheraton on the Park in Sydney offers outstanding service and comfort. I stayed for a week and then returned for a further two nights. Not only was I remembered by the staff I was given the same room. The rooms are spacious and the beds the most comfortable of any hotel I have stayed in. Delicious black marble enormous bathrooms. All mod cons. My only three criticisms being no wi fi in the rooms and breakfast in the restaurant resembles an overcrowded train station. Personally I like a bit of peace and quiet first thing in the morning and breakfast here is not for the faint hearted. Room service is very pricey indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room, but don't expect views from the low rise 'city view' room”
Reviews.Author: wmrl
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was beautifully appointed, large, very quiet, clean and comfortable. Room service was very fast ( under 30 minutes) and well presented. Not much an outlook in the 'city view' room with the only window looking into a dark and narrow corridor onto an second grade office building on the back street.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Icarus70
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed here just for a single night, we are locals to greater Sydney and wanted a night in the CBD. The Sheraton is a lovely hotel and gives a sense of opulence from the moment you drive up to the valet. Overall the hotel is nicely appointed but there are just some fine attentions to detail lacking (ie: hair dryers in the room which you would expect at a hotel of this class). The staff however are fantastic, friendly, helpful and always a warm welcoming smile from everyone. The breakfast as well is wonderful great selection of everything. Location is great for shopping and only a short stroll to the Quay, Rocks or Darling Harbour. Would certainly recommend this hotel to all travellers looking for a level of class from their accommodations

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere between average and good”
Reviews.Author: fresh_prince_perth
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights from 7th July to 11th July. The location of this hotel is hard to beat, affording easy access to the Eastern Suburbs and all that the Sydney CBD has to offer. We booked the 'Stay, park and play' package, which included a city side room, breakfast and self parking, which was pretty good value at $269 p/n Our room was quite good in general although there is clearly an issue with the air conditioners ability to adequately cool the room. If you like your bedroom cool when you sleep, it's likely you will be disappointed. The hotel sent an engineer to check the air con. There was a note in the room when we returned from our days outing saying that the fault was located and had been resolved but in reality, we found there was little to no difference after the air con was serviced by maintenance personnel which leads me to surmise that the air con cooling function is simply inadequate. We could also hear the guests in the next room each time they used their bathroom to shower or use the toilet, not to mention hearing just about every door on the 18th floor close or slam. Noise issues are not something I expect from a 5 star hotel. The breakfast at Botanica was quite good but would have been close to great if the staff were a) more welcoming, and b) willing to make eye contact so you don't have to do somersaults in order get there attention and then once you do, you feel like they are doing you a favour. IMO, breakfast sets the tone for the rest of the day and with the exception of one or two individuals, the breakfast shift staff looked generally disinterested and we found some staff to be quite rude including but not limited too, talking in a different language. The food and beverage manager walked around with his arms folded and on Sunday morning, he looked as though he had just woken up. The breakfast staff looked as though they would rather be elsewhere (with the exception of Linda who could always be seen with a smile). I would also like to know why 4 or 5 staff were continually congregating around the entrance to the breakfast area, while they should be looking to provide a better overall experience to guests that are seated? Basically the food was good but the service was very poor indeed. Overall the staff throughout the hotel were not overly personable or friendly but we were fortunate to have Vanessa check us in and check us out. She was very professional and appeared to actually like her job. As far as I am concerned, it would have to be an exceptionally good deal for us to stay at the Sheraton on the Park again. This once wonderful establishment, has gone downhill since my last stay some 8 yrs ago.

Reviews.Title: “slow service dirty and arogant about it”
Reviews.Author: Lechiffre1
Reviews.Content: I travel to Sydney regularly and I was most disapointed in the Sheraton on the Park. I do not normally complain about a property but in this case there were some real problems. I started well so pleased with the location and the initial impact was very impressive but it is a mirage. I started with my check in that was smooth and the it all went down hill. We went to eat at the Botanica well the food mostly overcooked and just not what we expected . We went to the suite and ordered room service it was timely taking under 1 hour but the food was worse. The worst steak full of gristle. Just ordinary meat I would hesitate feeding to my dogs We noted that the bathroom had a not so clean smell to it we wiped the wall with some damp tissues and it was dirty. we also found the foyer quite unclean. Perhaps my standards are too high but I detailed all the issues to the General manager 4 weeks ago and as of Today no response. Perhaps you can not defend the indefensible. By the way we never got the morning paper.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: Evianah
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely romantic week in Sydney and stayed at the Sheraton on the Park. Definitely the best Sheraton hotel I have stayed at and arguably the best hotel I have ever stayed at! I love the location (just across from the beautiful park) and also the room service breakfast was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Careful when you fill out the guest survey”
Reviews.Author: Vicol
Reviews.Content: After having a less than welcoming and relaxing time at The Sheraton on the Park recently we received a survey email from the Sheraton on the Park. We completed the survey honestly and indicated our concerns. We received a reply from the Hotel Manager indicating to us how well the hotel had managed the situation and " I believe we took every action to ensure the remainder of your stay was enjoyable for you both." Glad he thought so because we certainly didn't and we were the paying guests. We chose Sheraton on the Park to celebrate a special occasion and really were expecting a pleasant stay. However, we quickly realised this was not going to be as pleasant as we had hoped. We have stayed in plenty of 5 star accommodation throughout the world and have learnt that 5 star establishments also have rooms that are a 2 star standard and we asked at check-in on the standard of our room. We received the glib, all rooms at the Sheraton are very nice. All except the one we were allocated. It was in the bowels of the hotel and was so far from the elevator that you needed a map to find it. The outlook from the window was a claustrophobic wall of concrete which literally surrounded us. We knew that it was sunny outside but you couldn't tell from our window view. If you weren't depressed when you entered the room rest assured you would be by the time you left. An added insult was the adjoining room that had very noisy guests who kept us awake for most of the night. The next morning we requested a move and spoke with the front desk manager, who in the most dismissive tone and superior manner gave us a lecture, that was the room we had booked and were entitled to and not to book through the discount accommodation websites but to use their Starwood/ Sheraton sites. If you are going to be given inferior rooms as a consequence for booking on the discount sites, then this should be clearly indicated on the websites. This was early morning after breakfast and we were told that we would be moved later in the day even though we knew there were plenty of available rooms. So we came back later in the day to find that they had move us to a room directly behind the busy hotel 6 lifts. They must have had a great chuckle at our expense. Again down to request a change of room and finally we moved to a front facing room. The attitude was that we should feel grateful that they had moved us to a superior room, not that they were remorseful that we had wasted so much of our valuable holiday time on something that could have been fixed in a matter of seconds if they had genuinely given a hoot about their guests' concerns. Hint; If you don't enjoy your stay at the Sheraton on the Park don't fill out the guest survey unless you give the feedback they want to hear.There are much better hotels in a better location at Circular Quay such as The Hotel intercontinental (great food at Etch which is unfortunately something that Sheraton on the Park has a lack of) , Quay Grand Suites, Marriott Sydney Harbour and Sir Stamford at Circular Quay. As a previous guest has written " Wake up SOPS, read your reviews and listen to your long time guests!"

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: DCala
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a trip through Travelzoo (a company called "Down Under Adventures") and they selected this hotel for us. We had a great experience. The rooms were clean and nice, the hotel was in a wonderful location, and the breakfast buffet had a great spread (we got it included with our stay- otherwise it was around $40 per person). When we checked in after our 17 hour flight from the US it was really early in the morning (around 6:30am). Since they didn't have our room ready, they let us go up to the spa and shower there which probably saved our day of walking around. ;) Overall, I recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I always stay here”
Reviews.Author: frombrissy
Reviews.Content: I am very fussy. I love this hotel. I always stay here. The rooms are nice and a good size with large bathrooms including a shower and a bathtub. At night the rooms are silent and there are full blockout curtains. The view over the park (not from all rooms) is lovely. The location is perfect right on the park and around the corner from David Jones and the nicest shops. The breakfast is beautiful. The health club on the top floor is lovely. I just love it here. Complete opposite of the awful Hilton and much nicer than Intercontinental. Definitely choose this beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: ald59
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel 23 times but getting tired and for Spg members the Westin just a bit more central to the cbd for slightly more is a much classier hotel wit a much better lounge and room facilities .No wifi in rooms but only at checkout did they explain there are about 4 wifi modems if you ask. The hotel while advertising suites for sale tell you at check in there is no suites available for Spg platinum upgrades and this happens regularly. If you want to be closer to the cbd Westin a much better choice

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, very romantic”
Reviews.Author: 2gnomesinparis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our anniversary, very good position, close walk to all the shops, the harbour, the gardens. Lovely room, spacious, bright, beautifully furnished. The cafe downstairs was very slow in bringing our order, but staff were very apologetic afterwards and gave us a refund.

Reviews.Title: “Great Sydney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Burro12
Reviews.Content: When staying in Sydney my preference is always the Sheraton on the Park. Friendly service, very good rooms and centrally located in the CBD, across the road from Hyde Park. Can walk or take a short cab ride to all attractions in Sydney - business, restaurants, theater and shopping. Prices do fluctuate and depending on the time SOTP can be cheap, reasonable or expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Once Was Grand, Not Returning Again. Explore Other Options.”
Reviews.Author: PetermanCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I am late writing this but I will say that the hotel itself is not the problem, but a new management team mentioned again and again if you carefully read these reviews below have instituted changes that have made the extras such as automatic complimentary upgrades for SPG Platinum guests into payable items that are a struggle to come by. As those of us from far away (not local Australians) spend a great deal of time and money just to reach Sydney, having arguments, struggles and a "coin operated" mentality coming from the top down really turns what was once a delightful treat into work. Couple that with the uncertainty of not getting the room you want/have requested/have stayed in time and time again without paying extra, it is very easy to decide to stay elsewhere. Over the years there have been marked declines in every aspect of the property, from staff attitude to security issues, but you will not notice them if you didn't know what it was like 'before." If things keep going the way they are this will turn into a tour bus hotel from the very elegant refuge it previously was. If you are a luxury traveler I would say no longer consider this property. If this is a business trip I would also choose a different property. This is probably best for a couple coming into the "big city" from the outskirts, or second time visitors who want a base to explore away from Circular Quay. But as 'destination" it is past its prime.

Reviews.Title: “You can't really fault this place”
Reviews.Author: DadTravelOrganiser
Reviews.Content: As a business hotel in Sydney, this is my choice. For the price, the location, service, restaurant and rooms leave many other places in the shade. If you can get a room facing the park vs "city" it will be quieter.

Reviews.Title: “I could live here forever”
Reviews.Author: scooter2273
Reviews.Content: The staff are excellent. The position of the hotel is awesome overlooking Hyde Park and stroliing distance to some fantastic shopping. Was given a free upgrade to a Parkview room which was really lovely and sooooo clean. Had room service a couple of times which was of restaurant quality and delicious. Saw "Whispering Jack" here and he thought it was nice enough to stay. The cleanliness at this hotel was second to none and the bed and pillows are what dreams are made of. Ill be back for sure!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exellent location.”
Reviews.Author: haveaplan
