Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights when we went to see Mary Poppins.The location is excellent, just across the road from St James station and the airport train.Pitt St Mall is just around the corner for all the major shopping. Check in and out was very effecient, the staff friendly and helpful. We were upgraded to a park view room which was lovely, would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: margnmike
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and well appointed with a sitting area and a walk in wardrobe. The bathroom was big for a hotel room and the cleanest I have been in for a long time - it was spotless! The bed was very comfortable and a great assortment of pillows was provided. It was very difficult to get a coffee at the cafes in the middle of the morning and I eventually gave up on that idea. The buffet breakfast offered a good range but was expensive - you could probably eat just as well in a local cafe for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value and quality”
Reviews.Author: macca_au
Reviews.Content: First time stay - what a great property! We booked online (less than 24hrs before our stay) to be tourists in our own town for a night. Chose the $200/night king room with city views. Bell team were fantastic - let us park the car for 15min while checking-in without any hassle. Reception staff lacked a bit warmth and personality but this was made up for in their efficiency and being given a park facing room - nice touch. Hotel is in great condition with all expectations being met. The lobby is warm and comfortable. Lifts are quick and easy to use. Common areas are well fitted out and give you a sense of a well styled home. Great room size (we landed 613). Huge bathroom with good amenities. Towel size was a big positive - no postage stamps here. Good bed - comfortable but could use a pillow-top and some extra pillows - when im in a hotel i like to have too may pillows to know what to do with (4 on the bed was not enough). Great room fit-out with a proper lounge (finally!). Great size TV. Rome service prices looked scary (an im used to eating room service around the world) but the team was happy to bring us up a couple of buckets of ice for our drinks. Even on the sixth floor we had a quiet night. Pool is probably one of the best in the city for a hotel with this room price. Very clean and in a great environment - sensational views. Quick and efficient check out the following morning. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelersofOZ
Reviews.Content: This is one of our favourite hotels in Sydney. The staff are excellent. The position of the hotel is fantastic, loads of shopping nearby and overlooking Hyde Park. The bar area is lovely for a cocktail and breakfast was superb. For those who wish to do some retail theraphy this is the perfect hotel, shop drop shop drop ... so convenient and easy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Conference Venue”
Reviews.Author: CanberraTourist
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd or 4th time here for conferences at the Sheraton on the Park. This is probably one of the best conference venues in Sydney. Conference rooms were excellent. Modern, spacious and high tech. All the Sheraton staff supporting the conference were excellent and friendly. Excellent tea, coffee and desserts. Location is excellent, right opposite to the Hyde Park. Walking distance to Pitt Street Mall, Circular Quay, China Town, Central Station, Oxford Street and Darling Harbour. Room is clean, spacious and modern with large LCD and DVD player. Bathroom is large and modern. I just had 2 little disappointment but it is likely to be related to the long weekend and the hotel was fully booked and there were more than 100 people attending the conference plus other meetings going on on the same weekend. There wasn't valet parking and 4 pm late check up I used to get. I hope I will get those next time I return However, it's an enjoyable stay and it is one of the best hotels in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: rogerbairnsdale
Reviews.Content: The rooms were great, bed lovely, bathroom well appointed, Restaurant great, buffet the best I have seen and I am not a buffet person, you can choose A La Carte if you wish. The hotel is right opposite hyde park great location.

Reviews.Title: “QUITE LOVELY, WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE!!”
Reviews.Author: MIA1968
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 Saturday night only. My Husband and I were there to celebrate our 10 year Wedding Anniversary on our own (time out!!). I booked a package on their website for $309 (PARKVIEW KING ROOM, BREAKFAST FOR TWO & SELF PARKING). Seemed great value, as breaky is $42pp & parking $45. Booking was an easy transaction. We received an email straight away confirming our booking & also another email two days prior to the date to re-confirm our booking!! Wow this Hotel is on the ball!! We were not disappointed. Easy parking being guided by the Hotel Staff through the basement, then a quick lift to the Lobby/Reception. Check in was easy enough, and the lady that served us was very friendly even though she did have a very strong asian accent!! She asked were we here on hols or a special occassion and we told her about our Anniversary, so she handed us a written note from the Hotel to have a complimentary glass of wine each in the Conservatory Bar. - very nice touch!! When we opened the door to our room we were hit with a wonderful fresh citrus scent. Quite welcoming I think!! Our Room had a Park View from the small bay window. The other window was facing the Hotel, so I had to keep the curtains closed at all times, as I noticed that I could see clearly into the other rooms - and obviously they could do the same into our room!!! LOL.... The room itself was a little small I thought. Maybe because our bedroom at our home is twice the size, but I suppose its a little bigger than a standard main bedroom. I think the feeling of small was because it was quite congested. It had an L-shape couch, with an office table & large long buffet that had a small plasma & fridge attached. The furnishing was good quality, so it looked very beautiful. The bed was very confortable, and the pillows nice & luxurious. It would have been great if the tv was a little bigger, as we watched a midnight movie (and as ours at home is a 54") and I felt I needed to sit close to capture the movie!! The bathroom is really really beautiful. Love the all black!! Its quite glamorous!!!! Just a pity it didn't have a tv by the bath....that would have topped it off!!!!! I used the shampoo & conditioner - and they were quite good products. The shower was large & so too was the bath. The tea/coffee facility was fantastic. The variety of teas available was heaven!! I love my tea, and I love all types too - they had green tea, earl grey & english breakfast. Also there was decaf coffee - which my hubbie loves. There was even two Jarrah Choc sachets, consumed by us during our midnight movie!! Breakfast buffet was to die for!!!! I was in heaven!!!! The variety was endless!! From cereals, variety of yogurts, fresh cut fruit & fresh juices. Hot food included fried eggs, Eggs Benedict, sausages, hash browns, baked beans, baked tomatoes, sauteed mushrooms & lots lots lots more. It has an Omelette station - the chef makes your own to your taste!! The pastries were delicious, around 8 different varieties!! Lots of different breads to toast & rolls too. There was a mini freezer with two gelato flavours - the vanilla pod gelato was delicious with a pastry!! I ate like a Queen!!! There was even a fresh brewed coffee pot on our table when we arrived - very nice touch!! Or if you preferred, any type of tea or coffee (latte's, caps, macchiatos etc) available upon request & included. Botanica Brasserie Seafood Buffet never came close to the variety available for breakfast. And I do have to say (sorry Sheraton) but I don't rate it at all. We were so disappointed!! I wanted to know where was the Calamari, Octopus & more!! See my review on Botanica Brasserie. But as for the Hotel, its very charming, very clean, great service & lovely atmosphere. For travellers staying in Sydney, this is a great Hotel to stay, especially for location!!. Close to most of the tourist things to see & do in Sydney. Across from HYDE PARK. 2min walk to DAVID JONES. 4min walk to MYER & the new WESTFIELDS (must see - very nice - great food court upstairs). For the romantics only 4min walk to TIFFANY & CO!! 10min walk to THE ROCKS, 5-7min walk to OPERA HOUSE & CIRCULAR QUAY (where all the ferries are available). 1min walk to ST JAMES STATION. 15min walk to SYDNEY AQUARIUM & SYDNEY WILDLIFE PARK, & DARLING HAROUR!! Across from ST MARY'S CATHEDRAL, 15min walk to BOTANICAL GARDENS etc. Totally recommend this gorgeous hotel, quite charming & good value I say!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: blenheim72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for two nights with a breakfast and late check out package costing AUD$230 per night. Room was large, well appointed and well presented but had an unattractive close view of the next door office building. Staff were pleasant and helpful. The free computers/internet access in the lobby are useful although there is no WiFi available in the rooms. The location is great for both business and pleasure travel and the free CBD bus which stops more or less outside the hotel is a good way to get to Circular Quay and elsewhere. This is probably not a true five star hotel (no night turndowns etc) but is certainly a very good four and a half stars. Breakfast was excellent with an extensive buffet and a la carte items such as eggs benny and espresso coffees available in the price. However if you don't have breakfast included in your room rate, it costs AUD$42 per person. With the high Australian dollar that is about US$44 or close to 30 pounds. Sydney is a pretty expensive place right now!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms , What you would expect but don't always get !”
Reviews.Author: FatherDownUnder
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night between work events in the city . I have stayed at other Sheraton resorts (Gold coast / Port Douglas) but although the rooms here are smaller (the others are QLD resorts so expected) the quality is by far superior. My room had a beautiful Marble bathroom with separate bath & shower a King bed which was real comfy, Flat screen TV & a desk / work area which saw some real use in 1 day as an adequate mobile office & a pleasant view over Hyde park. Cleanliness was excellent . All round a 5 star experience , which sometimes you don't feel like you get at all 5 star hotels. I booked a last minute rate for a standard King Room - $280 which included multi access parking & breakfast. Parking alone in this area of the city is usually around $80 a day for single entry. Location is great easy walking access to martin place / pitt st mall / hyde park .

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: ShobhRams
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a one-week stay at Sheraton on the Park (SOTP). Overall, very good stay. Some salient pros and cons below : Pros : 1. Excellent location. Hyde Park is just opposite. The bus stop and train station are just across the road. The free CBD 555 shuttle esp was extremely useful, only downside being that it stopped 3:30PM. 5-10 mins by bus to Circular Quay. Also very near (5 mins walk) to the nearest David Jones dept Store and the large Pitt Street Mall (Westfield, Myers etc). We found David Jones (between the Market Street and Elizabeth Street stores) to have the best range of all types of clothes and products. For most places (like Darling Harbour, Taronga Zoo, Manly etc) you just need to take the free shuttle to Circular Quay and catch the ferry from there. The Pitt Street mall has an excellent food court as well (the Thai place is open until 7 PM and has yummy food). There are a few good eateries within 10 mins walk from the hotel - MacDonalds, a Turkish kebab place etc. 2. Lovely breakfast buffet. This was at the Botanica Brasserie. The Club Lounge breakfast (which we experienced just the first day) was very limited and continental. At Botanica Brasserie, the spread was awesome. Special mention to the lady chef at the egg station. Mouth-watering omelettes and sunny-side-ups. Nice fruit and yoghurt varieties. Good sausages, bacon, hash browns etc too. And some noodles and stuff. Overall an awesome spread. We enjoyed breakfast every single morning, and it filled us up nicely for the day ahead. We had got a breakfast inclusive rate of about 250 AUD, direct at the hotel website so opted for that. Cons: 1. Everything costs extra. We had the most expensive in room water bottles, 500 ml for AUD 6.00 !! And there were more expensive options at AUD 9 per bottle !! Most international hotels provide at least 2 free bottles of water, here, nothing. In room dining again expensive. We opted for it just the first night. 2. Room was good, but could have been a little better. In room housekeeping were sometimes sloppy, not replacing toiletteries etc always. We were 3 of us, my husband and me, and my 4 year old. So they could have provided extra toiletteries and towels but they did not until we asked them to. 3. The entertainment selection available on the television was rather poor. No international channels like HBO, Start, AXN,etc. were available. You have to watch either the local Aussie cannel 7 or buy movies - which for us one day did not work.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than last time”
Reviews.Author: tula2006
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the SOTP last November and wrote a review. At that stage I was not impressed with the delays in checking in and also the treatment I had at the restaurant in the evening. I did, however like the hotel and therefore stayed again in March of this year for three nights. I am happy to say that the service was improved and that check in and out was smooth. The rooms remain nice and the breakfast buffet lovely. The executive loung is a delight for those that have been in buisness meetings or conferences for the day as I was. I am due to stay there again later this week - this time with my family. I expect the SOTP will not disappoint. Many thanks to the staff for their care and service.

Reviews.Title: “Super Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: Loulee
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I had a night at the Sheraton on the Park as we wanted somewhere close to the city centres to enjoy a day of shopping. I booked a deal directly through the hotel that included breakfast and self parking. We were upgraded to a park view room which was great and the room was lovely and spacious but also a with a comfy atmosphere. Plus it was very quiet. The bathroom was enormous and luxurious. The buffet breakfast in the brasserie was one of the best I have encountered. Situated across from Hyde Park and walking distance to lots of attractions the hotel is also a few minutes around the corner is the central shopping district of Pitt Street Mall. We were able to park all night and all the following day - which was great value considering the cost of parking in central Sydney. We will definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “I think this is the best hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: A53
Reviews.Content: I stay relatively frequently at this hotel. On this occasion my wife and I had a room overlooking Hyde Park - the view was outstanding and the room itself was large, roomy, quiet and very comfortable. The location is very convenient to work in the CBD and also to tourist destinations such as the Art Gallery. Hyde Park is across the road, so there is easy access to sensational walks through the Park, the Domain and down to the Harbour and the Botanic Gardens. Breakfast was excellent, as usual, and included in the package. Car parking was also included in the rate, so the overall value was outstanding. I must single out the staff at the breakfast room - their service ethic has been invariably outstanding during my many stays.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable CBD option”
Reviews.Author: Missi0nary
Reviews.Content: A repeat visit to the Sheraton on the Park and it's still a class act. Comfortable, quiet rooms. Attentive and helpful service. Great CBD location and (if you pay the extra) views over the park. Massive buffet breakfast...but you pay for it! Very good fitness centre and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Very postive stay”
Reviews.Author: UKtog
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights en route home from NZ. Our arrival was a little chaotic and it was difficult to work out what was going on, however to be fair to the hotel we discovered a few hours later that a teenpop celebrity was staying in the hotel and was in the course of leaving for his evening gig when we arrived which would explain why the bell staff were very flustered. We had booked a city view room and found we had a room with a very city view, into the next door offices however this was not a reason for us to ask for a change as we now read others have done, we had not booked the room for a view and were delighted that this position meant we were in a very quiet room on 11th floor. The room was very spacious, lovely bathroom and well appointed. Did like the availability of the plug adaptor in the drawer, a big help! Room servicing was spotty - our nightwear was dumped on the desk one day and left on the sofa on another day and bins were not emptied one day - not a big deal, just contributes to why we give this hotel 4 not 5 stars this trip Our rate included breakfast and we thought the buffet offered an excellent choice, although there were issues with its temperature - one day we spotted the hotplates had not been switched on, the staff sorted this and removed all the cold food, however we could not wait as we had an excursion to join so did not enjoy hot food that day. That experience did not put us off eating in the hotel and we were very glad we had the dinner buffet on our last night when our feet were too tired to venture out. At $60 a head that might seem expensive until you realise this is Sydney where all costs are high and the range on this buffet is exceptional - lobsters, crabs legs, several hot dishes a speciality station and a very great array of desserts. We were very impressed by the way the maitre d handled our question about food content, based on the fact my husband has a nut allergy - the head chef came out and personally walked him round and discussed the content of all the dishes with him. That was excellent service well done! It was also nice next morning that the same chef spotted my husband at breakfast and asked for feedback on our buffet experience and also checked was my husband ok re breaksfast choices (he always is as he is a melon then bacon and eggs man) Bar prices were a little steep and on the first night we went for a bar snack - it was a Friday evening and the place was very noisy and it was difficult to get service, though once we did eventually get a server she was attentive but the delay in getting the cheese platter was way too long and she had to chase it 3 times. We asked the concierge questions from time to time on our trip and all queries were answered promptly and with what we felt were good answers. We were particularly happy with the airport shuttle they organised for us on our departure at a cost of $14 each which was prompt and very efficient. The location of the hotel is excellent, well served by buses and it was a great tip from the concierge re the 555 free bus - saved us quite a bit! Would we come back here again - yes provided the price is right!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel across from Hyde Park, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: mstifster11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Sheraton for 3 nights while vacation in Sydney. The hotel has good service, staff is nice and friendly. The lobby looks good, nice wooden staircase right at the entrance. We got the room w/ a parkview (nice to wake up to in the morning), quiet, rooms are nice and clean, bathroom is very spacious w/ black marble design. The location is good if you plan on using public transportation as it's across the street from St. James station (subway). We had breakfast here as well, the breakfast is GREAT if you like a lot of variety...from chow mein, fried dumplings to your typical western breakfast favorites and lots of fruits, sweets, and bread. They also have a chef that makes your special omelettes.

Reviews.Title: “Simply AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: avi882
Reviews.Content: I used the assistance of Trip Advisor before making my decision to stay here so I think it only fit that I leave my feedback for others.... From the moment we walked into the hotel lobby, it looked grand! I have stayed at several 5* hotels in Sydney and abroad and found the fittings and feel of this hotel outstanding! We were attending a play at Capitol Theater so we checked in around 11.00 am. We were told that our room was not ready but offered to hold on to our luggage. That was fine with us and we were expecting that. Cameron at the front desk was very nice and friendly and a pleasure to meet. On return, we got our keys and were told that our bags had been taken up which was a very nice touch! Again Steve, who I think may have been the manager on duty was very nice and a good first impression of the hotel. The room was simply sublime! The bathroom has to be the best bathroom I have ever seen in a standard room!! (we were on the 20th floor) The room was perfect! It was large and well fitted and was modern but still elegant and classy. At this point, there was nothing I could fault the hotel for, everything was to expectation. The only criticism would be assistance we received from the night customer service phone assistance ("Unhelpful girl on the phone"). Firstly her english was not the greatest, but that would be okay if she knew what she was talking about. Every question or request we had, she seemed to have to look it up in a manual or something, it was obvious that she had no idea off the top of her head. My two main complains were: At around 10.30 pm, I called to find out if music could be played in the bathrooms. We had noticed that there were speakers in the bathroom and a volume dial. When I called, she had no idea what I was talking about and you could clearly tell she was looking up some reference book (probably room features or something) and her final solution was that we turn up the sound on my iphone so we could hear the music in the bathroom. She completely ignored my inquiry as to what the volume nob was. I was not happy but couldn't be bothered to try and explain this to her. At around 11.30 pm, I realised that I had forgotten my contact lens solution and case to store my contacts overnight. I reluctantly called the assistance line again and was de-heartened when i got the unhelpful girl on the phone. I told her that I had not brought any contact solution with me and would need to store my lenses and asked whether the hotel had any. Again, she seemed to refer to some reference book and said that the hotel did not. That was it, no further prompts or ideas, just that the hotel didn't. While I think all hotels (at least the 5* ones) should have available contact lens solution as any wearer would know, if you don't have any, you can't store them, my annoyance isn't that the hotel didn't have any, but how unhelpful the girl was. I would have at least expected her to try and find out where I could get some, but she was totally unhelpful!!! I was very disappointed with her service and had I not brought my glasses with me , i would not have been able to drive home or function at all the next day as I had to throw out my contacts as I couldn't store them. But the reason I still highly recommend this hotel is that the all the other staff we dealt with were outstanding, They were all very friendly and helpful. My partner pointed out that she though every single female staff was very good looking as well!! (I thought it best not to comment to be on the safe side :P) Bottom line.... Very good hotel!!! I was looking at booking again for the 14th of May as I need to be in the city again but the price quoted is significantly higher then what I paid this time around. Unfortunately while I loved the hotel, the bad taste left in my mouth by the unhelpful girl on the phone will probably make me try another hotel, but I will wait to decide as I really did loved this hotel. Give it a try as you will not be disappointed!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I could live there.”
Reviews.Author: tim9999
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all. Stay kicked off to a great start with complimentary upgrade to a corner room and a couple of free drinks in acknowledgement of my birthday. Location fantastic within easy walk to all the high end shops. High quality furnishings, fittings and art work give a sense of refinement and class.

Reviews.Title: “good location, poor restaurant”
Reviews.Author: bethi
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Sheraton on the Park on our way to New Zealand. Initial impression of the building was very good as the hotel foyer is quite grand but there was a lack of help with the luggage. We had chosen a Club Room with a Hyde Park View, but the first room we were shown to only had a side view of the park so we asked if it was possible to change and were then offered a front facing room with a balcony. As this was not quite ready we had to wait for a while but a coffee in the Club Lounge soon passed the time and when we were shown to the room we were delighted. It was twin rather than a double but it was tasteflly furnished and the beds were very comfortable and we slept well both nights. The balcony had a beautiful view over the park and cathedral and out to the harbour; it had only one chair so we had to take one outside from within the room, strange when it is a double room! The first evening we went to the Club Lounge for drinks and the canapÃ©s were so extensive that we did not need an evening meal. It was very busy and there was a great atmosphere in the lounge. The next evening we decided to try the hotel restaurant (mistake!) There are two sittings for dinner and we chose the early one, the place was packed and the tables all in rows reminiscent of a very ordinary cafe. The food was good, but not outstanding, and we felt like we were in a production line. Not only did we find the experience less than satisfactory but it was also very expensive at $85.00 each and wine at $10 - $14 per glass. The hotel is in a very good position so taking that into account and the lovely room we would stay there again but we would not eat in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at this Beautiful Hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: bagwan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our second stay at the Sheraton on the Park in Sydney in March 2011. Our room was beautiful and spacious - love that walk-in closet for storage of suitcases and clothing! Great bathroom and super-comfy bed. Soothing decor in the room. I found the gym to be very well-equipped and state-of-the-art; not crowded at all late on a Sat afternoon. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet which provides all the choices you could ask for - hot and cold. We look forward to another stay when we return to Sydney. Thanks Sheraton!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kappara
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in a Park View room. I found all the staff from the moment I entered the hotel to checkout to be pleasant. The room was nice with a pleasant view of Hyde Park. The location of this hotel is great for shopping and seeing the sights. Buffet breakfast in Botanica Brasserie was of a high standard. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: ashish100
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night for a work event. Room was larger than expected, with a sofa, king bed, desk and lots of room. Nice decor. Quite a large bathroom, with a bath and a nice big shower. Not state of the art, but quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Be sure to go to the buffet”
Reviews.Author: oceanroad4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton for 2 nights for business and loved it. We had dinner each night at the buffet at Botanical ( be sure to book as it gets booked out quickly) as we were so tired after a day's walking around the Trade Fair we simply could not be bothered to venture away from the hotel, and why would we? The fare was varied and fresh ranging from a huge selection of seafood to roasted carvery plated by a chef as you waited. We really loved the dessert selection and enjoyed watching the adults revert to kids as they loaded their bowls with ice cream and lollies LOL The rooms were clean and well maintained and the service at checkin and valet was outstanding...go you will enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & good business facilities”
Reviews.Author: SunmeetChahal
Reviews.Content: A great location bang opposite Hyde Park in the very heart of Sydney. The rooms may not be the most modern but have all the comforts, staying in a club room provides extra benefits like access to the Club Lounge and also the Health Club. They have a great (but small) pool on the top floor, the spa was also great providing some great deals on services provided. If you are looking for a place which is conveniently located to the business centre and at the same time provides access to best of shopping in Sydney, would recommend you look no further. The only drawback being that the breakfast can certainly do with more variety.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Dawn N
Reviews.Content: I would go back to the Sheraton on the Park every time I am in Sydney. It's a beautiful hotel, our room was fantastic, and we thoroughly enjoyed our star.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: guestofhonour
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights at the Sheraton. On my arrival, I requested for my luggage to be brought to my room but after waiting for over 30 mins, I had to call the front desk to remind them. Needless to say, I brought my luggage down myself at check out. The service was pleasant and the concierge was helpful in pointing out places for me to sightsee. I had a room overlooking Sydney tower and the city. The room was smaller than expected but very clean and tidy. The tv only had a few foxtel channels which was disappointing. I would recommend the buffet dinner at the Botanica Brasserie (1st floor) which costs about $66. It had a wide selection of seafood and other dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Melbourne_Female
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really good value. One can normally find a room for under $300 if booking on one of the discount hotel websites. The bathrooms are very spacious with a deep bath and separate shower (hate shower over bath!) and the beds are really comfy. There is a desk and a sofa area which means if you have guests around, you don't have to perch on the edge of the bed like two teenagers! One of the better value, 5 star hotels in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Befle
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an executive suite after finding that our "Park view " room that we booked on www.lastminute.com had twin beds. we had requested a King bed so were really disappointed as the hotel was fully booked and our only option if we wanted a King bed was to pay an extra $150 to upgrade to an executive suite. We did this reluctantly but it was money well spent and the hotel did us a pretty good deal i think. Really spacious suite- wish i had been staying a week, not one night. Views over Hyde park and the cathedral. On arrival there was a beautiful fruit platter, chocolate basket and a bottle of red wine awaiting. We also had access to Level 21 for drinks and canapes from 5.30- 7.30 which was lovely. Also had a great breakfast on level one the following morning, which had an extensive range of yummy food. parking was expensive at $49.00

Reviews.Title: “they charged me the full mini bar!!”
Reviews.Author: Timesx2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sheriton on the park and they charged my credit card one week later with $91 for the total mini bar. I did not use anything from the mini bar. I called my credit card company to dispute and they advised to dispute with the hotel as they would never let me stay their again. I contacted the hotel and they disputed my claim. i am still waiting on a result. this is outrageous

Reviews.Title: “Collapsing service levels”
Reviews.Author: jaejaez
Reviews.Content: Sheraton on the Park Sydney (hereafter SPS) has been a hotel that I had always admired throughout the years of my stays. I love its location and the overall feel of the hotel never failed to inspire my stays. However this hotel had seen its better days in terms of service. It still is an efficient hotel where it meets my needs to eat, stay and playâ€¦ but I am left to feel like I am just a transit guest. This certainly was not the case in the past. SPS is located well, opposite the famed Hyde Park of Sydney and within walking distance to your favorite destinations like the Town Hall, QVB and a slightly longer stroll to the Darling Harbor and the Circular Quay. It surroundings are dotted with cafes and coffee shops and a quick bus ride away on a 333 will take you to the Bondi beach. Very convenient indeed! The hotel looks grandeur from the outside and is well appointed on the inside as well. The lobby is impressive with marble floors and its rooms are delicate. I often get the corner rooms and I always find them adequate for my stays, both in terms of size and amenities. The breakfast is sufficient too â€“ definitely a notch above that of its rivals for its variety of offerings. As an SPG Plat I also take advantage of the lounge, which does get very crowded at times but is still a great place to hang out. The gym is very well appointed too. I cannot comment on the pool as I have never used it. In summary the hard product of the hotel is intact and is very good. You will likely have no complaints with regards to these. In terms of service, the hotel has gone cold and careless. This used to be a property where each and everyone that you encountered greeted you and were interested in whether your stay is going well. The doormen opened doors for you not because they were made to, but because they were genuinely interested in caring for my comfort (or at least that is what it felt like). I still remember the time when I could approach anyone in the staff to strike up a friendly chat. Now, everyone looks busier, even when they are not really â€˜busyâ€™. They are always doing â€˜somethingâ€™ and no longer â€˜look upâ€™ at the guests. Just two examples: One would be the concierge. Good were the days when I could approach them and they would be more than happy to assist (i.e. go beyond expectations to help with directions etc). The last time I asked them to fetch my bags from the storage room (on my way to the airport), I was told to wait (he did not even look up at me) while he had to call someone. And so I waited, but as the wait continued for a minute or so, I gently told him that I had to get to the airport soon. To this he tersely put down the phone, swung into the storage room, showed up with my bag and swung it in front of meâ€¦ before stomping back to his desk to continue making the call. I stood there feeling rather stupid for what felt like a whole minute before moving on out. This is perhaps the only time that I was not even asked the very standard â€œdo you need a taxi to the airport?â€� This is but one example of the concierge team going downhill. The team has certainly turned much colder. Another quick example is the phone operator. They now sound like robots and the worst part is that this is now the only hotel that I have ever visited where the operator (or whoever is on the phone) hangs up on you with an abrupt â€˜Thank youâ€™ even before you are done talking. Where is the (again) very standard â€œis there anything else I can help you with?â€� before hanging up? It feels as if they want to minimize their level of interaction with the guests to the absolute minimum. Will I stay here again? No I wonâ€™t because I do not want to pay 5 star hotel prices for a hotel that is a 4 star. The fifth star is for the service and this has gone missing in my last two stays. I might give it one last chance but it is already off my list as a favorite place to stay in Sydney. I cannot believe that I am saying this now but I really think that the SPS can learn a thing or two from the Hilton or Mr. Zumsteinâ€™s team.

Reviews.Title: “From Chocolates to Boiled Lollies”
Reviews.Author: ctraveltheworld
Reviews.Content: I have been a regular guest here for many years. My stays have all been of the same high level and I have supported the Hotel and referred others to it. Whilst I am still enjoying many regular SPG Platinum benefits like a suite upgrade and use of the 21st Floor lounge, the character of the Hotel has noticeably changed in recent months. I no longer rate the Hotel 5/5 but 3.5/5. Simply put, the buzz has gone and the Hotel appears less friendly and more distant. Its a business after all but these intangible changes do get noticed. As an example, my checkin was nothing special...it was as if I was in a supermarket queue. My two night stay was at $349/night which included Parking and breakfast in Botanica. A dinner in Botanica was not pleasant as I noticed a fly swimming in my expensive glass of WA Red.I showed my server who did not know how to handle this. I merely signed my bill and left...clearly a training issue. Someone needs to tell her to get a new glass and offer me another glass of wine. Overall my stay was barely OK... The Hotel is no longer the best stay for business in Sydney...its charm has evaporated and the warmth and friendliness has gone. Try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again....”
Reviews.Author: COguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton on the Park - Sydney for a two day meeting in February of '11. I've been treated better at the Department of Motor Vehicles that I was at this hotel. The building itself is decent enough however the staff were far from accommodating. A 1:00 check-out request from a guest that is a member of a hotel's frequent traveler program is standard....NOT here....$50 for anything past noon! Added to that is the exorbitant internet fees (over $25 per day) and NO free lobby internet and you end up with an amazingly sub-standard hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: Drwish1079
Reviews.Content: Sheraton on the Park is situated in the heart of Sydney just a walk away from Darling harbor. Admist the picturesque Hyde park and just next to Sydney tower, the hotel has a beautiful ambiance and great service. I would specially like to congratulate the hotel on its superb staff especially the executive chef Brian Dean and his assistants esp Ms.Deepa. They were so helpful and considerate and have made my stay truly memorable.The Hotel is tastefully done and has spacious, clean and good rooms with all the perks.The Buffet lay for breakfast is great.overall a wonderful and fantastic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, but windows cannot be opened”
Reviews.Author: TravelSiMa
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in the Sheraton on the Park in December 2010. The hotel is located just across the street opposite Hyde Park. It is a 2 minutes walk from St. James Station connecting to the Airport, and a 15 minutes walk to Sydney Opera House. Staff was very friendly at any time. We had a park view room on the 14th floor. The room & bathroom was spacious, modern, very clean and provided all the comfort you can expect from a 5 star hotel. Beware that the windows cannot be opened in the whole hotel, so you cannot get any real fresh air into the room. Our room rate included the extraordinary and excellent buffet-style breakfast which was served from 6.30 to 10.30 at the Brasserie Botanica on the 1st floor. As we are vegetarians, we highly appreciated the great variety of warm and cold vegetarian dishes served there. The spa is nice, but as we wanted to use the pool it was more like a children's playground than a place to swim and relax, with a lot of screaming and noisy kids all around, so we left again immediately. Maybe they should restrict the time for small children to a limited period of time. If you have a car you can park in the hotel's own garage for 40 AUD per day. The hotel provides several computers with free internet access in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location for Tourists - Room Outlook Lacking”
Reviews.Author: bilbelseb
Reviews.Content: We (wife, three kids 15,13, and 11) stayed here in late January. The good - beds very comfy, free bus around town just 40 meters away, full breakfast buffet with ice cream(!). The gym was small but adequate, as was the pool. The not so good - room view(?) directly into an office block - seemed uncomfortably close, very small room with two single beds plus trundle - our king right next door (interconnecting) was much bigger, even though we paid the same for both rooms. The $75 for an average trundle bed also seemed steep. Breakfast (expensive unless included in room rate) was extra. I think the price (about $250 per room per night for the weekend) is quite high for a hotel that does not really have a wow factor.

Reviews.Title: “Great room & location”
Reviews.Author: Travel-Master-PhD
Reviews.Content: I have a good time (4 nights) at this hotel, the room is very nice with large black marble bathroom (the bathroom is great, the best ever). The location is excellent, close to every things. The Spa is less than normal. The breakfast is very good. We have a good deal in this hotel, 250 Australian Dollar p/n with breakfast. I recommend this hotel, for leisure and business.

Reviews.Title: “the best breakfast ever and very comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: frqntraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton during a visit to Australia for a wedding. We picked this as sort of a safe bet, and we were not disappointed. In fact, our stay was even more pleasant than we expected. Given that it was the first day / night after a long flight from North America, that was very much appreciated! The room was large enough and very well laid out with a separate walk-in closet/little room for our luggage. This was great because we could just put down our stuff and it didn't clutter up the main room. The bed was cozy and comfortable with nice clean linen. There was tea and coffee with a kettle in the room. The bathroom was also very generous in size with a separate large shower (with a proper shelf to hold your shampoo, soap, etc. something many hotels don't have) and bathtub. The hotel thought through the details and what travelers need for a comfortable stay. The service was attentive and efficient. If we needed something, it got brought up to our room right away. Our best surprise of the stay was the breakfast buffet. It was incredibly diverse in choice and everything was very fresh and tasty. I'm not much of the eggs and bacon type in the morning, but the sausages, eggs, and potato fritters here were the best ever! There were more fruits, cheeses, cakes, and other goodies than I could recount. It was a breakfast I would wish to have at every hotel. We could have stayed on through lunch! The only drawback of the hotel is the lack of light / view in some of the rooms. It was raining when we arrived and it felt quite gloomy inside. We asked to change the first room we got because it was very dark . Overall, we highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location - perfect for business or leisure”
Reviews.Author: bella_oes1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sheraton a few times over the past few years for business and leisure, but for some reason have never written a review... so time that was rectified. Stayed this week and must say the rooms which were refurbished some time back are still well maintained and looking clean, modern and wonderful. The standard rooms are quite a large size (even by Sydney standards), with a huge walk in cupboard - perfect if you are travelling with a lot of luggage. The bathroom which is black granite or marble is very large and the shower has a huge amount of power. Best one I have experienced in a hotel for quite a while. The gym facilities and swimming pool are of an excellent standard and the staff at the day spa were very friendly. All staff were experienced and friendly, with the exception of the check out process. Which took quite a long period (about 10 minutes) because one of the receptionists was tending to guests concierge needs, rather than directing them to the concierge and moving on to continue checking people out which was disappointing. The hotel is located right on Hyde Park, but if you don't want to pay for the park view, the other rooms have a nice city aspect. There is also an alternate entrance to the hotel which comes directly off one of the main shopping streets in Sydney. It is a perfect spot for all tourism or business activities in Sydney. I will definately stay again when I need a hotel in the Sydney CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel for Jersey Boys”
Reviews.Author: Mumofteens
Reviews.Content: Needed to book a hotel close to Jersey Boys as we wanted to walk to and from the theatre and this hotel was perfect - about a three minute pleasant walk. We booked a last minute stay, park and play package for $300 on a Friday night which included overnight accommodation in a city view room, buffet breakfast for 2 and self parking. Without hesitation I state this is the best value in Sydney and have already tried to book again for my husband's birthday in March but sadly that package is unavailable. The room (2111) was enormous - king bed (feather pillows), lounge (big enough to recline on and someone else to sit too), desk, walkin in robe and the largest marble bathroom I have ever encounted. Everything was spotless not a bit of dust anywhere - congratulations housekeeping. The bed was awesome and the feather pillows were excellent - all linen was immaculate. Fully stocked bar fridge and a big variety of tea, coffee, sugar etc and good quality stuff too not your usual hotel rubbish. Bathroom - where do you start - is it with the black marble, the timber, the polished fittings, the huge shower, the full bath, the plentiful plush fluffy towels or the toiletries and the fully functioning Vidal Sassoon hairdryer with attachments? Perhaps a walk in wardrobe tickles your fancy - it tickled mine with its fluffy bathrobes,huge room safe, iron and board and plenty of drawers and hanging space to store all your stuff AND your suitcases and then close the door on it. Wow!!! Breakfast was the best I have ever eaten at a hotel. Pricey at $42.00 per person usually but included in the room tariff. We were sat next to a window overlooking Hyde Park. Breakfast was all the usual stuff including an egg station cooking fresh eggs, actually everything was fresh and constantly refreshed - nothing was greasy and the fruit - to die for. My husband loved the pasties and I really appreciated the English Breakfast tea in a teapot that didn't leak!! Now how often do you find that? We also ordered room service - two perfectly prepared and steaming hot meals were delivered to our room and were delicious. Once again the presentation was A1 and included extras like a selection of bread rolls and butter/margarine and chilled water - which we idn't expect but really appreciated. My husband said the lamb shanks were the best he had eaten in a long time. I loved my chicken too. Staff right throughout the hotel from reception to floor staff to health club couldn't have been more helpful and were cheery and efficient. All were immaculately presented and attired and did the brand proud. Now the health club - indoor heated swimming pool and spa was incredible and the view over the harbour was so unexpected. What a wonderful place to hang out and take in the sunshine and fresh sea breezes - this we really appreciated during our stay as Sydney was experiencing one of the longest heat spells on record. And they provide the beach towels too have I mentioned that??!!! I didn't experience, this time, any spa treatments but the treatment rooms were very impressive. Now to give balance to this review (otherwise you might think that a staff employee was writing it) the self parking was great - if you could find a spot but we had to drive around a bit until we found space - parking is at a premium. Our room service while delicious did take longer than the 15 - 20 minutes quoted - more like 35 minutes and I had to ask for a pot of tea twice at breakfast but really I wouldn't usually worry about such trivial things but I want to give balance and I had to think hard for a criticism. Would I recommend this hotel - absolutely - the shopping within 1 minute's walk is without equal - DJ's, Myer, Westfield, Designer Labels, Pitt Street Mall, heaps of eateries and things to do. Did I mention the park opposite the Hotel with the beautiful fountain, gardens, wildlife and the cathedral and the domain - No???? But you get the idea I was mighterly impressed with the Sheraton On the Park and can't wait to go back. I forgot to mention the public areas and bars and restaurants with comfy chairs but you get the drift - you must go = trust me you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most beautiful hotel rooms I've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Solesister
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an absolute 5 star hotel, this is it. With all the facilities you would expect, a wonderful concierge (who got me a ticket to a show I thought was sold out) and very polite, professional staff The Sheraton on the Park is a relaxing, pleasant, tastefully decorated establishment. It's not as expensive as you may think ask about their 2 night stay package that includes breakfast which is huge and delicious in their restaurant that overlooks Hyde Park. Those who love a long breakfast reading the Sunday papers with the bonus of a beautiful view will love it. It is easy walking distance to all Sydney has to offer. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “PLEASANT SURPRISE...... MORE than surpassed our expectations!!”
Reviews.Author: wend0100
Reviews.Content: I had an overnight here with my husband on a Stay Park & Play special to celebrate my birthday.(My husband was involved in various aspects of the building of the hotel some 21/22 years ago and remembered bits of it during construction, but we have never actually stayed there!!) . Must admit I was a teensy bit apprehensive as had read some adverse comments on this site! However we were very pleasantly surprised and only have good things to say!! Upon arrival our check in was swift, efficient and friendly and we were informed we had been upgraded to a Park view room!! Also given a voucher for 2 x free glasses of bubbly in the bar/lounge. Our room was lovely, super comfy bed and great marble bathroom. The buffet breakfast was fantastic and one of the best we've ever experienced, here in Australia or overseas. I particularly appreciated the discreet way the breakfast staff cleared tables and covered dirty plates/cutlery when removing them for cleaning. Everything was done quickly and quietly ,making breakfast a very pleasant affair. ALL the staff we encountered met us with a smile and friendly greeting. Sadly due to time constrictions we did not get to use the pool/spa but will on our next visit as WE WILL BE BACK FOR SURE!! 5 stars for everything!! THANKYOU to all.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in so many ways”
Reviews.Author: Howard-CA
Reviews.Content: Well maintained with an excellent staff, great location. Everything about the hotel worked perfectly, especially upon arrival following a 14 hour plane trip. Across from the park, and adjacent to shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the stay but ....”
Reviews.Author: tula2006
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Sheraton in November having been at a conference. Loved the place and found the service, locations, room and executive lounge very good. Two issues - check in took ages as there was a trainee on the desk. I do understand it was a busy morning and there was a supervisor for the trainee but that poor person kept getting called away by another person doing check in. The poor trainee kept looking at me waiting but was unable to help me. Also, as there is no clear line up system I found that other travellers were going to the other desk and getting checked in before me. The staff had seen me waiting but did not invite me to the desk as the next waiting person. I did receive a "sorry" after the check in process from the trainee but it took more than 20 minutes. My second issue is that at 8.45pm I went to the restaurant and asked if I could have coffee and desert without a main meal. I was told that this was not possible until after 9.30pm. While I can understand that on a busy night, the restaurant was more than half empty - perhaps that could have been taken into account? I think the hotel is lovely and I would stay again. I realise it caters for a number of buisness travellers but other people should get the same service and attention.

Reviews.Title: “Solidly excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: 2lambstraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in an excellent location for leisure travelers. Right around the corner is the heart of the shopping district, a 10 minute walk away is Darling Harbour, and across the street is the subway station, which connects you to the airport. We found this location to be an excellent asset to the hotel. Inside of the hotel is also great -- our room on the 19th floor city view was very well done and extremely quiet. We had a free breakfast package for 2 people -- and it was the best breakfast on our entire 2 week vacation of Australia (and we had breakfast in every hotel we stayed). Definitely try to score a free breakfast package. If not, apparently its $42 AUD per person!!!! Do not forget to go to the pool area on the top floor. They have an outside deck area that faces out onto gorgeous Sydney!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dissillusioned”
Reviews.Author: pinky333
Reviews.Content: Son and girlfriend stayed Thursday and Friday nights via gift voucher with specified a park view room. The kids didn't get this and being 20 and 21 year olds, they didn't think to pursue it when checking in. On leaving they found they had left a new CD in the stereo and called approximately 30 minutes after they left the room. They were advised the room had not been cleaned yet and the stereo would be checked and a staff member would call back. No call was forthcoming by the following Wednesday and son's girlfriend called. She was advised that there was nothing noted about anything left behind by housekeeping and that there was now someone else in the room. One would think considering the price of the rooms a lousy $30 compensation for the CD would be forthcoming...considering they didn't even get the room which was paid for in the beginning.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eduardate
Reviews.Content: I went to Sydney for New Years Eve and stayed in Sheraton. The price was very hight (570 aud) each day, but included the breakfast wich was marvellous. The the full buffet breakfast is 42Aud per person. I stayed in an stardard room with city view. There was no view but the room was very nice. The barhroom is very big, with a good shower and the bed and pillows was very nice. The hotel is very well locatade in front of Hyde Park, one block from Sydney Tower and neq Westfield mall (wonderfull). From the hotel you take around 15 minuts walking to Circular Quay and Opera House and 15 to Darling Harbour. I came back in the end of the trip to the same hotel and it was 200 aud per night, but the breakfast 42 per person. There is free internet in the lobby and free computers with internet access as well.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Stay”
Reviews.Author: kevinp1959
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here just before Christmas and had a fantastic time. The staff were excellent and high standards were maintained throughout our stay. We booked our room on-line and received one of there inclusive offers which included a fabulous breakfast and proved to be good value for money. The quality is reflected in the price you pay but is worth every penny when you consider the alternatives around Sydney. This was located across from Hyde Park which is exactly where I wanted us to be and provided the level of luxury I was looking for, the Sheraton did not disappoint on either count.

Reviews.Title: “Not Perfect, but Very Solid and Perfectly Located”
Reviews.Author: RobinLloyd
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Sheraton on the Park several times in recent years and it is an excellent choice among upscale options in Sydney. The peaceful, parkside location is easy walking distance to Circular Quay, the Botanic Gardens, Darling Harbour and many museums. Rooms are decently sized, and those with small sitting areas and corner sectionals are particularly comfortable. Beds are very comfortable and the bathrooms are spacious and well-designed with plenty of marble and wood. Not the most contemporary or luxurious styling when compared with the generation of hipster palaces, but a very good experience overall. Book a room with Executive Club privileges or free breakfast, as the paid breakfasts are varied and delicious but outrageously priced. The Executive Club is particularly nice at this property, with expansive views and a very refined, generous cocktail hour. They also have free wi-fi in the Club, so it's quite a valuable add-on. Service in the Executive Club is outstanding; service in the public areas and restaurants is decent, but not extraordinarily attentive the way you'd find in a true five-star property. The pool is small and usually a bit crowded with kids, but suitable for a splash between your day of exploring the city and happy hour. We will continue to rely on SOTP as our go-to hotel in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: lukmi
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, elegant and grand. The room we were given was a little pricier than other 5* in Sydney and not as big as we were hoping. The dinner at the buffet was well worth $60. Great food and heaps of choice. I personally like the location, close to Surry Hills and in a great side of the city, minutes from Circular Quay. I personally prefer the Hilton overall and style-wise but I think it's a matter of personal taste.

Reviews.Title: “Good but could improve in a few areas”
Reviews.Author: Sylvester1975
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in late December 2010. We had a park view room overlooking Hyde Park. The good: bathroom is spacious, close to the CBD, service responsive. The not so good - bed was pretty ordinary as was the room service food. We ordered two hamburgers which took a bit too long to arrive and were not what you'd expect from a 5 star hotel. Overall god but needs improvement.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent business hotel- upper class”
Reviews.Author: Frankieandcharl
Reviews.Content: I like the Sheraton : it is the definition of what a business hotel should be these days: The rooms are modern and trendy (but only Australian plugs!), the service is efficient, bar food is served until a late hour, the bar is cosy, the breaksfast executive lounge is very nice, the location is very central. I would definetely stay there next time on business.

Reviews.Title: “FIRST AND LAST IMPRESSIONS COUNT”
Reviews.Author: GOLDCOASTGURU
Reviews.Content: As an SPG Gold Member I at least expected the style of room I booked and in this case it was non smoking. Instead I was given a room where I'm sure Sydney's last Cigar Convention was held. It stank, the carpets,curtains,towels and especially the bed and pillows. Reception staff didnt care and where in fact offensive in their attitude. A great shame that these precious front office people didnt have the service skills of the porters and club room staff who where wonderful. First and last impressions count and the Reception staff at this hotel are the worst I have incountered in many years of travel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Class With Service To Match”
Reviews.Author: AussieTom85
Reviews.Content: My wife booked and organised this holiday as a birthday present for myself (and we traveled with our 6 month old daughter) - and we had the most wonderful experience with the Sheraton On The Park. From the moment we arrived (with the staff offering to help lift the pram up the steps - so we didn't have to take it up the ramp), to the moment we left, I can say without a doubt, that the staff at the Sheraton made us feel the most welcomed we have ever felt while traveling. The room was fantastic (with a nice view over hyde park), and the cleaning team once again going the extra mile, by even folding our daughters rug that we had brought each day). It really was the little things that just made our stay. The buffet was fantastic each morning and staff were always dropping by to offer us tea or watermelon juice for breakfast (the only thing I can fault is that they failed to bring our tea one morning - but no big deal). Food was excellent, and my wife enjoyed the 'made to order' omelette. We decided to try room-service for dinner one night and loved it (the fold out table was a nice touch). Overall our experience was excellent, and while the hotel was amazing - it really was the attitude of the staff that made our time there unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Sydney_RD
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sheraton on the Park for the second time, it's been a few years since we first stayed there. Th ehotel is in a great location, right opposite Hyde Park, and just a short walk from the sipping district, and also to Darling Harbour for a great range of restaurants. We loved the room, the black out blinds made it seem like the middle of the night for a long sleep in. The bed was super comfortable, one of the best I've slept in. The included buffet breakfast was superb. Got a great deal from wotif.com, included parking and breakfast. A city room means you don't have a view, other than on the side of another neighbouring building, but it was what we suspected. It does cost more to upgrade to a park view room.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel with friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: hoopkat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the New Year period and really liked the hotel. We arrived a good few hours too early before our check in time and went to check in anyway. We were told that the room wasn't ready yet as we expected but that if we wanted a shower we could go up to the health club straight away. The staff at the health club seemed to be expecting us and guided us to the male and female changing rooms where we could get a shower, use the steam room and sauna and get dressed etc. After we'd done this, we went back down to reception and our room was already ready for us to check in....much earlier than we expected! The staff were helpful with information when we needed it for NYE etc. All in all, great service, staff and hotel. Would definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Tes
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights over Christmas. The Hotel was full & staff stretched to the max. We had a cleaning towel left in our vanity sink one day & another day one of our used bath towels was left in the corner. The breakfast was feral, way too crowded & after lining up for everything the selection was mediocre, they ran out of room & had to overflow guests into a freezing conference room with a limited buffet. Location great but very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Average Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: cielopictures
Reviews.Content: This is a well kept hotel - typical of the Sheraton chain. Be aware aware that the "City" rooms have a view of an office building across the street. Terribly slow service in the lounge and restaurant (check your bill in the lounge - they tried twice to charge for drinks we didn't order). The hotel is located right across from Hyde Park and a 15 minute walk to the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: Glynis031
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal: "Stay, Park and Play" for $209, including a king city view room, self-parking and breakfast. The room was spacious and spotless; likewise for the bathroom. The bed was exceptionally comfortable, and seating included a lounge with cushions, and 2 chairs. There was no noise from the corridor or from the street (we were on the 19th floor). A walk-in wardrobe with luggage rack was a bonus. The only problem was the location of the safe, low down to the floor. The swimming pool on the 22nd floor was great, obviously newly refurbished, and with great views of the city and harbour. All staff - reception, cleaning, breakfast - were terrific - friendly and smiling. Breakfast was excellent, with a bounty of healthy (and not so healthy) choices, and 2 chefs cooking eggs to order. My cheese omelette was yummy. There was a wonderful array of fruit, including sliced mangoes, cherries and passion fruit, which are rare finds in Australian hotels. Even the coffee wasn't too bad! We stayed at the Intercontinental in Sydney a couple of weeks ago and had a dreadful experience. Sheraton on the Park might not be one block from the harbour, but on every other criterion, is far superior to the Intercontinental. (Incidentally, the cost there for a city view room, breakfast and parking was $464). We will be back, especially if the Sheraton continues to offer great deals.

Reviews.Title: “No Customer service, locks guest out of room, awful overpriced food Pay your bill and LEAVE!”
Reviews.Author: BangkokRyan
Reviews.Content: My first stay at the SOTP years ago should have been an indicator.. I flew into Sydney from Dubai, first class, arrived in a limo to the hotel (looking a bit out of whack from the flight) upon arrival at the front desk the agent threatened to call the police on me, and yelled at me to leave. Experience number one. This was a mistake, but nonetheless not the way to treat a customer at a five star property. Since then I stayed a few times, and they were ok. I enoy the executive lounge, as some of the staff there are top notch. Recently things have been another story. I stayed in October of this year. When I checked in I was sure to register my girlfriend who was working, and arriving later. When she arrived the staff were rude to her, did not offer her a key and shoved her away from the desk so they can accept the louis vuitton luggage carrying customer behind her. Management did not care about this and had no excuse at all.. I came back in December trying to give them another try for my girlfriend's birthday. She slept most the day as I was in the city taking care of business etc.. I came back to find that she has a skin reaction to the bedsheets. Someting was wrong with them. We were asked to pack up and change rooms. We did this what a hassle. I wanted a birthday cake for her, and turned to ordering a $48 cake. Now I suprise her with this cake to find that it was stale (hard inside) and well equivilent to what you would pay $1 for on walmart's expired food shelf. Lets move on to the next morning. Breakfast We wanted the booth so we can sit together, asked for this infront of the General Manager. Was denied and thrown in the back room where they were setting up for lunch. A few minutes later I saw the GM taking up one of the booths with a hotel employee. Mind you this booth was free when we were taken to our table. We try and enjoy the mediocre overpriced breakfast. Now that morning I sent off my pressing with the room attendent (I Get 2 Comped as a platinum, and I also booked the executive level too) I sent off a few shirts, as I needed them pressed for work the next day. When I returned to my room they were left on the bed in a bag, not completed. I checked out, and the girl at the front desk didn't care at all. I needed these pressed. I told her that she was to take them and get it done. She wasn't too happy with this (I ended up buying a shirt at Myer) Now the kicker on the stay. We were moving into an apartment which wasn't ready till'10pm. I asked to extend my key for the executive lounge (Mind you I paid with points for the executive lounge, and I am a platinum member) The girl said in a cold manner absolutly not. Now I spend about 300+ nights in hotels, all high end, and no where I was denied lounge access after checking out.. She didn't care, wouldn't get me a manager nothing. Luckily We followed someone up to the floor and a employee who knows me took care of us.. But it seems the girl at the desk found out and tried to send me a bill.. We had a couple drinks in the lounge (making up for the fact that we weren't able to take advantage due to the illness brought on by the bed the night before) I told them I would stay another night, and proceeded to leave the hotel, and not return. This hotel is poorly managed, the management could care less for the end consumer. Any problems will not be fixed, nor compensated. Between the bedbugs (or whatnot) the stale $48 cake, not doing my laundry needed for work etc. They still managed to give me a big F U as I walked out. I won't waste my time complaining as I know they won't care. This hotel is overpriced, everything is mediocre. The staff doesn't care for the customers. There are plenty great hotels in Sydney. Hotels that will take care of you.. If you just want an overpriced bed that may have a good view go ahead and stay at the Sheraton on the Park. But as someone who knows hotels in and out I can say go elsewhere, if you want a friendly worry free stay.

Reviews.Title: “This is the only place I will ever stay in Sydney...”
Reviews.Author: memojen
Reviews.Content: Nearly every single thing about our stay at this hotel exceeded my expectations. I was a little uncertain when I booked it, as I know that typically a 4 star hotel overseas means a 3 star hotel in US standards, and I know that Sheratons in the US are rarely truly 5 stars. Quite simply, this is the single best hotel experience we've ever had. Check-in was flawless.. we had a flight that arrived early in the morning, and although they weren't able to check us in right away, they were able to have a room ready after we ate breakfast and went on a short walk. The room itself was huge and beautiful. It had a gigantic soaking tub that my 6'2" husband could easily stretch out in. The bathrooms were black marble.. so pretty. The closet was gigantic!! Practically a walk-in with a huge bench inside of it that was big enough so you could lay your suitcases out on it! The bed was very very comfortable. The location is perfect, and I feel it's even a better location than Darling Harbour.. it was easy walking distance to everywhere and was practically right on top of a metro station. It was also easy walking distance to the opera house, and circular quay is right near the opera house so you can hop onto a ferry quite easily. The staff at the hotel was great.. SO friendly. When I asked for late checkout because of a late flight, they were happy to help me out. I can be a really picky individual when it comes to hotels, and I literally cannot think of one complaint. This is absolutely going to be my home base whenever I visit Sydney. :-)

Reviews.Title: “great rooms, great location.”
Reviews.Author: geenes
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on Saturday 11th December for 1 night as a birthday celebration in room 719. We had booked a park view room, which is a higher rate than ciry view rooms. Hot buffet breakfast was included. We had requested a high level floor, king bed and late check out. I advised them it was for birthday celebrations. Check in was after 3pm, it was quiet when I arrived so the check in process was very smooth. Reception was friendly enough. I had to remind them of our request for late check out, they advised they could do to 12 (normal check out is 11am) and after 12 will be a charge. This is usually standard practice across hotels like this, so I was happy with that. Room was on the 7th floor, so not high at all (the room type we had booked start on 6th floor) so didn't manage to get a high room as per request. The view was also not what I would consider a park view room and didn't warrant the higher charge (see pics for the actual view from the room). Because of the shape of the building you're actually looking in on other rooms and if on low floors other rooms can look down into yours, and the only park view you had was if you twisted your head and peeked out the side of the windows. The room was lovely and spacious. What you would expect from a 4 star hotel, large entrace way with bathroom off to the right. Full mirror opposite. The bathroom was very large, all marble, seperate bath and shower. Only thing I would mention is the doors to the bathroom were two sliding doors that didn't meet in the middle, so if you're looking for privacy/quiet when doing your business in the bathroom, you won't find it here! Also beware the shower door, it didn't close completely and was easily flooded. A towel shoved against the door seemed to stop any overflow though and we didn't flood the carpets (as had obviously happened in the past, due to the water stains flowing from the bathroom all the way into the room!!). The decor was pleasant, nice touches such as the framed art and lightbox, chess table and cosy couch in the corner made it feel a little warmer than some of your standard big chain hotels. Fridge in room which is always a bonus. Bed was king size and very comfortable - nice selection of pillows (hard or soft) and great that it was an acutal king size bed too, not the two singles put together which often happen. I called guest services on arrival to ask for more towels to be delivered to the room, which were delivered very efficiently with a smile, so impressed with service - also service in the breakfast room was great the next morning. Free newspaper outside room as expected with a 4 -5 star hotel. Express check out made it super easy to leave the next day, just drop the form and keys in the box near elevators and you're done. Common areas were clean, spacious and comfortable - the restaurant for the buffet breakfast wasn't too crowded at 8.30 on a Sunday morning, which was good. The food was slightly above average hotel buffet food, however would have liked to see the food in covered dishes instead of constantly exposed. Location is a HUGE plus for this hotel, located directly next to hyde park in Sydney with David Jones, Westfield, Myer literally around the corner. This is the premier shopping district for Sydney city, so it was super easy to get around - spend way too much shopping and drop the bags back at the hotel before heading out for the night - perfect! If you are a tourist in Sydney wanting to experience more cultural/tourist attractions you may prefer a hotel in the Circular Quay or Rocks area, however as I'm a local and know the city well, the location was perfect for my weekend of shopping, dining, shows, etc. It's also directly across from the St James station, so very easy to get around via train. Over all a great comfortable experience, what I would expect from this quality of hotel. Nothing above and beyond though, but the location and ease of my stay means I would certainly consider this again. If the room was on a higher floor and had an actual view of the park and they had offered something for the birthday celebrations (honeymooners get a comp bottle of wine) it would have probably been a more special stay, but can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Some issues”
Reviews.Author: TravellingLuv
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton on the Park is an okay hotel. Not excellent but good. There were several small issues that taken on their own would have been okay, it just that there were multiple small issues. First of all the hotel is in a great location. Very central in the city and close to a lot of shopping and food. The rooms are spacious and clean. Housekeeping was prompt. Here are some of the issues I encountered. When I checked in, the bell desk took my bag and said they would take it up to my room. After I went to my room, it took 2 phone calls and 45 minutes to finally get my bag to me. The shower in my room was not working 100% as some of the holes of the shower head were blocked. Room service menu is not very comprehensive, and when we ordered a pizza and a bowl of chips at about 11pm, the chips were dehydrated and the pizza was soggy. I don't mind paying for room service, but if you are going to charge 5 star hotel prices for in room dining, the food should also be up to that standard. I don't think stale chips are quite acceptable. The hotel beds are a little too soft, but that's more a personal preference I guess and not an issue per se. Check out is also an issue. It is disorganised. There is no queue system because the check in/check out area stretches across the entire right wall. I was waiting in line behind another guest checking out and when it got to my turn, the lady serving behind the desk went over to the far end of the counter from me to get some paperwork and got hijacked by another person checking out. I was queue jumped by 2 people in the check out process. Having said that, the staff are actually quite friendly. All in all it was just an okay experience, I was a little underwhelmed. As I said, if I had experienced any one of these issues in isolation, I would be a bit more forgiving in my review, but when they happen all in the space of 48 hours, it doesn't make for a 100% happy customer. Would I stay here again? Maybe. I'd still pay a little more and stay at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: michael_portz
Reviews.Content: Excellent rooms and the best business center I've seen. The bar is nice and open with a nice terrace towards the park.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mundo61
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton on the Park for two nights recently. The hotel can be justifiably proud of its service, cleanliness and amenities. Check in was fast and easy and the room large and well appointed. A complimentary newspaper delivered to the room each morning was great. The hotel is close to train stations and as the name suggests right accross the road from Hyde Park. The staff sere friendly, helpful and knowledgeable and the place is absolutely spotless. a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: ILuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: I booked an Executive Suite plus a standard room. I have MS and 5 of us were travelling to Sydney for a medical procedure. I phoned the hotel many weeks before and gave them our arrival details to ensure that our room was ready. Our arrival time was 2pm which is official check-in time, so were weren't asking for any favours there. I also requested a high floor. Upon arrival, the very disinterested receptionist told us our room would be ready in half an hour. A bit annoying, but acceptable I guess. Our room was on the 7th floor (not a high floor). We headed to the business lounge on level 21 (included in our room rate) and my husband spoke to the lovely staff there.
