They told us that our room would not be ready until 6pm because the guest wasn't checking out until 4pm! We were horrified! It was only 2pm and I needed my room desperately. The original receptionist should have informed us of this instead of exagerring! When we asked the original receptionist if there was another room we could have, she said they were full. We also asked if the standard room with 2 single beds we had booked could be changed to a King bed, she said there were none available. She just didn't care. Funnily enough, the lounge staff promptly found us exactly what we wanted. They said there were plenty of rooms! They gave us some full buffet breakfast vouchers which was generous. We were unable to use the 5 vouchers each morning because of the visits to hospital etc. so they were wasted. Each voucher had a date on it. On our last morning 4 of us turned up to breakfast. We only had 3 vouchers as my mother accidentally took the others home! But we also offered them the 5 vouchers for the next day. We certainly weren't trying to get anything free! The young man at the buffet was SO RUDE! He ummed and aaghed whith a smug look on his face. My husband politely said that we weren't trying to get a free breakfast and that we could just head up to the executive lounge and have the continental breakfast included in our room rate. Another few minutes passed while he tried to decide what to do. It was embarressing! A female staff member walked up and said "of course you can stay!" He was just being difficult. Another staff member stood out at the dinner buffet. When we booked our table we were advised that in-house guests were $60 intead of the usual $100. Of course our bill said $100 each! When we queried the bill, the staff member (an Asian gentleman) looked angry with us. He was short with us and couldn't wait to escort us out! It was unbelievable. The dinner buffet is an absolute circus! It was packed and the staff were obviously busy and stressed. The hotel location is very good for shopping. But when staying in Sydney I believe that Harbour views are the way to go. The rooms are modern and nicely decorated. Cleanliness was good, plenty of towells and toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “A good Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: Maritime_Historian
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice Sheraton. It is pleasant to stay here for business as it is located within an easy walk of almost every major part of town while also being comfortable and welcoming. The staff are friendy and efficient. Standard rooms are nicely decorated with an art deco flair (though stricty not an art deco hotel there are hints of the style in some of the finishes). The restaurant at the hotel is pleasant with good food.

Reviews.Title: “excellent for business & shopping”
Reviews.Author: lindaruthe
Reviews.Content: excellent for business & shopping The 21st floor executive lounge is ideal for chatting with business associates and checking on email. With its quick service for breakfast and pre-dinner drinks and snacks, there are no worries about getting off schedule. On the other hand, if you wish to relax for a few hours there, you are left in peace. Private "board rooms" are available for rent. It is a 20 to 25 minute walk through the business district to the main harbor and the Opera House or a $10 taxi ride. For tourists with limited time, you could wish for a location slightly closer to Circular Quay, since so many tourists excursions leave from there. We stayed 9 days and felt at home and comfortable. The best view available is of Hyde Park, and is pleasant, but not all that remarkable.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the City”
Reviews.Author: cookingAust
Reviews.Content: We return to this hotel each year for an annual weekend to Sydney. The location is excellent. Opposite Hyde Park the park view rooms are lovely. You have the option of walking through the park or shopping just minutes away. The David Jones Food Hall out the back of the hotel is also a bonus. The service at the hotel is always friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Average-to-Good Sheraton Experience”
Reviews.Author: A_Travel_Opinion
Reviews.Content: You pretty much always know what you'll get at a Sheraton, or any of the major international chain hotels--usually dependable and a good standard. At the Sydney Sheraton, the upgraded park view room was disappointing for the price (think we needed to be much higher). Room was on the small side. Good staff and maid service. The roof top enclosed pool was cool. Good location. If there was a "good" category I'd pick it, instead of having to choose between average and very good.

Reviews.Title: “Average at Best”
Reviews.Author: dgvictor
Reviews.Content: Great Location of the Shearton in Sydney. Had booked a Park View Room and was advised at check in I was to be upgraded, however when I got to the room I am not sure (level 7) what was the upgrade. All I could see from my Room was leafs from the tress in the park. The Room Service is very expensive and there is additional $8 charge per order. Breakfast Buffet is average considering the price. There are much better hotels in Sydney at around the same price, I would reccoemnd The Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Most Comfortable beds and great location -Recommended”
Reviews.Author: dlam8808
Reviews.Content: I booked with expedia.com and they had a speical deal which "stay 4 nights get 1 night for free" deal, make sure you always check for deals with this hotel and save money. The hotel is located in the heart of Sydney. Less than 5 minutes walk to QVB and Pitt Streets. It is located next to the park, so we can enjoy some peaceful nights without the noise from the busy George st. The St. James train station is opposite to the hotel, which will bring you to Circular Quay in less than 5 minutes, so we can catch the Ferry to Manly, or visit The Rocks and the Opera House. There is also a bus stop within 1 block which can also bring you to Circular Quay for free (bus 555), or bring you back. The hotel staffs are professional and the service is awesome. Great Attitude and always willing to help. The hotel has 6 brand new computer for guest to use, high speed internet. You can also bring you laptop to enjoy the free wifi. The room has internet too but you need to pay for it. Most importantly, we got upgraded to a king size bedroom. The room is huge, with a tub and a shower, and the most comfortable king size bed. This is important because after long day, the bed can actually help you get ready for the next day. The bed is huge for 2 and the pillows are soft too. There is also a couch in the room and It is quite comfortable too, I nap on it for hours! Overall, it is a great deal for so many good things! The great location and the comfotable bed will help you, so book it now!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly bad service, noisy & expensive”
Reviews.Author: simonlazenby
Reviews.Content: Sheraton OTP I arrived late, after a long day and intense workshop. Check-in was very slow, the room a good size but OVERLY scented with air/carpet freshener... so much so, that it caused my eyes to stream. I'm 6ft4 so having two single beds was pretty impractical. I called the front desk and was told I would be called back immediately... 20mins later still no call( at 11.30 on a week night). Returning to the lobby and explaining my situation I was told, there were no rooms spare and no one had ever complained about the room scent previously - there was nothing I could do unless I upgraded myself to premium suite. Despite a booking which clearly showed KING SIZE I was too tired to checkout and begrudgingly went back to my room taking two antihistamine, vowing to Tripadvisor my experience. Disappointingly, two of my colleagues who stayed in the hotel that night also had poor service after complaining about the room standards - perhaps not unique. I wouldn't recommend this hotel and certainly won't be back to stay...

Reviews.Title: “nothing special but the park”
Reviews.Author: fritzrudolf
Reviews.Content: sheraton standard more or less as expected, large rooms but certainly not an unforgettable hotel, the location next to the park is nice and everything including the opera house is in walking distance, quite good breakfast buffet, the restaurant has a great view on the park, strongly recommend to opt for an upper floor, some rooms hardly have daylight

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: Kwil11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very pleasant surprise. The GM does an amazing job with the staff - polite and efficient.. Taxi ride from airport is way better then the bus.. You can walk everywhere and the park is beautiful. Rooms are spacious and clean. Buffet was great and shopping/sightseeing is very simple. Love it! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel with exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: ILikeLuxury87
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this lovely hotel for 3 nights during the October long weekend. There are 550 rooms in the hotel and during our stay the place was pretty much booked to capacity. One would expect the level of service to drop during such a busy weekend however this was certainly not the case. The service was exceptional & probably the best overall service we have experienced from any 5 star hotel. House-keeping staff were wonderful (always smiling & pleasant), as were the porters, concierge & front desk staff. The hotel lobby is beautiful & sets the standard for the entire hotel. We had a room with nice views of Hyde Park. The room was large & beautifully furnished. The bed was very comfortable & overall it was a lovely room. Our rate included access to the the Club Lounge & this was definitely a highlight of our stay. The Club Lounge at Sheraton On The Park is the best Executive Lounge we have ever encountered. It's situated on level 21 & offers wonderful views. The decor is gorgeous, very opulent but also warm & inviting. The quality of food available in the Lounge is 1st class as is the service. We received an upgrade to breakfast daily in the restaurant (instead of the Club Lounge). Breakfast is buffet style and the choice of options & quality of food was amazing. Definitely the best buffet we've ever experienced. Overall our stay at the Sharaton was very enjoyable. We were treated like valued guests & the staff bent over backwards to exceed expectations. Don't be put off by the hotels size, the service is personalized & definitely deserving of its 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Room Servive”
Reviews.Author: LoveTravel89
Reviews.Content: The room was good. Very clean, nicely decorated (not fabulously decorated), large enough. Location, location, location... The hotel was located at the center of the city (almost all of you need in sydney, including tourist attraction spots are within walking distance). The staffs were extremely helpful. There is one quality that I have to emphasize. The room service. Since it was a world cup season when I stay there, naturally we will need midnight snacks or drinks. Regardless of what time we ordered foods or drinks (either it's 3 am or 5 am), those always come really fast. Our wines or ice buckets came within 5 minutes. The taste? My hubby ordered the chicken curry at 5 am, it came really fast and taste amazing. I will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Everthing is perfect. We stayed for 2...”
Reviews.Author: bylife
Reviews.Content: Everthing is perfect. We stayed for 2 night and enjoyed this hotel. We will stay here for next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for Sydney”
Reviews.Author: carkeekpark
Reviews.Content: We got a very good rate for this hotel and were very pleased with our experience. Its location was good (although a little far from the Circula Quay, Sydney Opera House and the Rocks. The staff was friendly and professional, the room was large and comfortable We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic beds”
Reviews.Author: Chinny26
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the hotel, i travel a lot for work and found this to be one of the best hotels we have stayed at. Service from the staff was great, even told us the best places to go drink. But best feature of the hotel is the beds, best sleep i have ever had and now want to get one of those beds.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Central City Location”
Reviews.Author: NZ09
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Sheraton on the Park. The staff are a real asset to the hotel - all being friendly and helpful. The hotel is located beside the Sydney Tower and is a very easy walk down to the Opera House area.

Reviews.Title: “restfull, beautiful pool, internet provided”
Reviews.Author: WaterviewSeeker
Reviews.Content: We had a problem with expedia and the hotel made ammends for their mistake. Our room over looked the park (even though it was not on a high floor) and it was quiet. Our bed was very comfortable, bathroom very nice. I loved the beautiful heated pool on top floor. We enjoyed the complimentary use of their computors in the business center. The loop bus was just around the corner; otherwise it was a longer walk to tourist sights. We walked to the "sights" and rode the bus. This hotel deserves it's 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice updated Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Glenco1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on points, we were upgraded to a smoking suite. It was a lovely room, bit of a smell of smoke but nothing major. We were facing the park. The room was nice, updated, very nice bathroom and bed. The lounge at this hotel is fantastic, beautfiul breakfast and evening cocktails/snacks. Since we used points I can't comment on the price, however compared to the many other Sheratons I've stayed at, this one was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “exCellent”
Reviews.Author: oiaf
Reviews.Content: a great stay For greAt value great location great service make me a pleasant stay in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “great stay and even better concierge”
Reviews.Author: gl0ryb0y
Reviews.Content: thankyou to alex for all his hard work during our stay. this hotel always delivers and is one of my favourites around the world even though a little dated. sean and his team always strive for customer excelence and the food and beverage department never faulter from their always high standards. keep up the good work guys..

Reviews.Title: “excellent, wonderful views, great club lounge, nice upgraded suite”
Reviews.Author: travelwellallthetime
Reviews.Content: classic sheraton business type hotel with all the service and facilities you would expect. great view over the park. room was upgraded to a suite which was very nice, tons of room but not sure how good the standard rooms are but would def stay there again. really nice club lounge on the top floor with great views and loads of space for breakfast and snacks during the day or just to relax in. wonderful place will stay again thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, fine service.”
Reviews.Author: pasha08
Reviews.Content: Were very happy with the hotel; the concierge could not have been more helpful, the rooms were good-sized and the bathrooms were fine. Everyone was very helpful. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: TheFergie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for ten days last month. As usual clean, reasonably quiet, good service. If you are bothered by traffic avoid a low level park view.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect city stay”
Reviews.Author: Tannalee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I often stay in the city for one or two nights, usually in the Darling Harbour or Rocks area. This time we decided on a change of scenery and loved it! The staff were friendly, efficient and helpful. Our room was spotlessly clean with amazing views (room 1430), breakfast was crowded but delicious. The pool was striking in its position and I actually thought it was warm enough to have a leisurely swim. This was a nice surprise as I am a real sook with cold water and didnâ€™t think it would be warm enough in winter. The room service menu was expensive. The only problem I had with this hotel was the sound of sirens late at night that kept on waking me up; this went on until I put my earplugs in about 1am. I couldn't hear cars or pedestrians and I assume the sirens were worse because it was a Saturday night? Having said that, it wouldnâ€™t stop us staying here again as all the positives outweighed the noise. I personally like a nice view so I wouldnâ€™t stay here if I didnâ€™t have a park view ; the city view really just looked straight at buildings across the road. Management and staff are to be congratulated on a beautiful hotel that is maintained and run to the highest standard, thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful as it sounds”
Reviews.Author: littlemisshungry
Reviews.Content: As a person whose highlight of the trip is always the quality of accommodation, I would not hesitate to recommend Sheraton on the Park to anybody. The pictures posted on the official Sheraton website are what you actually get. We have previously stayed at Palazzo Versace but would say that the Sheraton is just as good, if not better because the rooms are much more spacious. Huge bathrooms in the room, very comfortable king bed, complimentary use of the health club on the 22nd floor. Having a spa and heated pool on the top floor where there are great views is a wonderful feeling. At night when you walk into the lobby there is often live jazz piano coming from the bar upstairs which gives the hotel a lovely atmosphere. The hotel itself is very central and you can walk to anywhere in the city. Staff were nice and friendly without being overbearing. The Sheraton on the Park is everything you would expect from a 5 star hotel, with all the right touches and everything just as it should be. Would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: LillyDC
Reviews.Content: Outstanding in all areas. The staff were very knowledgeable and friendly and the location was central. Our room was very spacious and beautifully appointed, Walk in robe and l-shaped couch. Large bathroom with separate shower.Great view from roof top pool. Room service was a bit overpriced even for an Australian 5*.

Reviews.Title: “The best location in sydney!”
Reviews.Author: MarilynFukuoka
Reviews.Content: There're a lot of nice shops, restaurants and the park near the hotel. It's was very wonderful for me to use the lounge on the 21th floor. I ate breakfast in the morning, and I had tea and cakes in the afternoon, and I drunk champagne before dinner for free. That's only for guests who stay 3 nights or more. It's the most gorgeous hotel that I've ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FayMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: Just back from a trip to Sydney. The hotel was everything the reviewers have said. We got a cheap rate and based on the price we paid, assume we got the worst room in the hotel. If this is the worst, I cannot imagine what the best one is like. The room was huge, and the bathroom almost as big. Our room was clean and well maintained. Not a single complaint. I would have liked free internet in the room, but it was free in the lobby, both on my computer, and one of the computers they had for free use. Location was perfect-we did not use public transportation at all-walked everywhere. Take the train to/from the airport to St. James station, right across the street. Sydney tips - If you are a coffee drinker like I am, skip the coffee shops. The 7/11 stores there have espresso machines with great coffee for $1.00. It was just as good as the $4.00 coffee from a coffee shop - Don't miss the bats in the botanical garden. They hang from the trees by day, and fly out by night. They are flying fox bats, and can have wingspans of 3-6 feet. - Buy your souviner t-shirts etc from Paddy Market near China town. The same stuff they sell in town at a fraction of the price. Go on on weekday (open Thursday to Sunday, and maybe Wed now also) as it is packed on weekends. -Visit the Oak Barrel bottle shop (wine store) down the street- on Elizabeth just past Liverpool if you are a wine drinker. Great selection of Australian wines and knowledgeable staff. If you like wine, it is worth the stop just to learn about the wines.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: rpitton
Reviews.Content: In the middle of the CBD shopping area and still close to the opera house and harbour bridge which can be reached walking in 10-15min. Try the pool and gym on the top floor. Probably the one with the best views in town

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good service”
Reviews.Author: JamieDH
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in July 2010, with my wife and two young kids (1 and 3). We arrived at the airport in Sydney very early in the day (7am) after a long overnight flight with tired kids. Went straight to the hotel and they gave us our room right away! This meant so much to be able to crash for a few hours right from the plane. Service was fantastic the entire time. Room was very clean, spacious and well-appointed. The cleaning service was good (but not great). Spa and pool area very nice, but not really suited for kids (no kids pool and water too cold for young kids). Location was great - walked to most of what we wanted to see in Sydney. Overall hotel experience was very good. Unfortunately we left Sydney on a sour note when our cab (arranged by the hotel) charged us over $80 to the airport, partly due to charging us for waiting as we were a few minutes late from the scheduled departure time coming down from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good location but poor service”
Reviews.Author: London-Lourson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Hotel for our trip to Sydney in January 2009. The location of this hotel is very good, situated opposite Hyde Park and behind the shopping area. The monorail station is nearby with Darling Harbour and The Opera House a stoneâ€™s throw away. The rooms are a bit outdated but clean and spacious. Our room had a balcony with delightful views of the park. However, this park cannot be compared with the Hyde Park in London nor can this Sheraton be compared to the London Park Tower Sheraton. To conclude, this is a nice hotel with very average service. The hotel is rated as a five star but in my opinion the service is only worth three stars. The service is slow and at times non-existent. In addition, the hotel restaurants didnâ€™t seem up to standard so we opted to eat out. We recommend the following restaurants in Sydney: Tetsuyaâ€™s, Icebergs, Wildfire or you can try the seafood in China Town.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: Lillaludd
Reviews.Content: Stayed for thee nights with one small child. Ok sized room, and very nicely furnished, lovely bathroom with both shower and tub. On the down side, the doors to the bathroom couldnÂ´t be fully closed or locked, so not for the shy ones. Good location with near access to busses and subway. Also easy to walk in a few minutes to several departmentstores.

Reviews.Title: “Love Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: BillTong80
Reviews.Content: I stay here at this hotel and very happy with everything. i hope anyone can stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect. Impeccable service. Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: figs10
Reviews.Content: I came home from our stay at the sheraton last night, and it was so good I had to get on the computer to write a review straight away! We arrived, had our bags immediately taken from us, we checked in straight away, and as soon as we had gotten into our room our bags were upstairs already. We were lucky enough to have access to the Club Lounge. This I would definitely recommend, it is well worth your money, the views are spectacular, and the service impeccable. We were treated like Kings and Queens, definitely the part which made staying at the Sheraton well worth it. The lounge gave us pre dinner drinks and canapes, which were really great, and just added a little something extra to our night. It offered us breakfast with toasts, three hot meals, fruit, cereal and yoghurts, as well as free internet access and coffee throughout the day. We did go down to the Continental breakfast one morning as it is complimentary with the lounge if you are down before 7, however I would say sleep in and go to the lounge instead, the service in the lounge is much better and the selection downstairs wasn't that exciting anyways. The only thing I would say that could improve the lounge would be the times for pre dinner drinks. It is open from 5 till 7.30, however till 8 or 8.30 would be more appropriate, and allows you more time to relax and get ready after your day out. The lounge closes at 9, which I think is way too early, and it's always nice to come back from dinner or wherever at night and be able to use the internet, relax and have a coffee. The rooms are great, with beautiful bathrooms which have a separate large glass shower, and a big bath tub. We chose a City Side room in the end, as it was slightly cheaper and figured we wouldn't be in the room much anyways, but after staying there, I would say spend a little bit more and get a park view room, the views from the City Side really weren't that flash, but considering we did have the lounge we didn't find this to be a problem. The fitness centre is great, much better than ones in other hotels I have been to, and all brand new. The pool was absolutely amazing. We went there at night the first time, and the lights in the pool along with the atmosphere were incredible with great views. There is a spa as well which is always relaxing, as well as a sauna and steam room. The only complaint I would have is that when we checked in the lady took my credit card, and told me she only needed it for security reasons, however she failed to tell me that there would be a $500 block on the card. Sure for many this is not a problem, and most would never even realise that it's gone as it does not show up on any transaction history, but for those who are students, like myself, $500 is a noticeable amount of money, and as I had no record of anything going out, I thought I had spent a lot more money than I really had! I was not happy with this, and for the future, people should be told where their money is going! Other than that, everything was perfect. Their is even a DVD machine in the room which worked out very handy for a relaxing afternoon of some True Blood! Great hotel, and from someone who has researched all hotels in Sydney very thoroughly, the Sheraton is the hotel with the most positive reviews, so to make it easy for you and to save you the hassle as it did me, the Sheraton is definitely the best pick for your stay in Sydney :) If you do get a chance during your stay, take a trip to the Shangri-La Bar on the 36th floor. Voted best bar 2010, it will not let you down. I have never seen such amazing views and the cocktails were to die for!

Reviews.Title: “Super location, one of the best Sheraton's I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: memberWestLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this Sheraton. It is not your typical Sheraton hotel ( by U.S. standards). It is a huge hotel with an impressive lobby and it was around Thanksgiving time so it was decorated beautifully with Christmas trees and lights. I stayed here two separate times during my trip, at the beginning and at the end. The first time I was put in a regular room, the second time up on the higher floors on the Starwood preferred members room (thanks to my friend who graciously used her points for my room(s)!). CHECK IN/OUT: I did not have any problems, I had a red eye so I arrived early in the morning (around 9:00 am or so) and my room was ready to my relief. My friend arrived about two hours later but her room was not available for a couple more hours...but that is her review to tell. ROOMS: The first room I had was spacious, love the bathroom-double sink, walk in glass shower with separate tub, lots of toiletries which were replaced daily. Overall very clean. The rest of the room was spacious (especially since I had it to myself). The second room I had during the end of my trip was on the Starwood floor and the room was a little bit nicer. Had a padded bench area across from the bathroom for my luggage which the first room did not have. It seemed a little bit more clean/updated and well kept. Both rooms had refrigerator's with flat screen t.v.'s. SERVICE: maid service was daily and effecient. On my last day I was fortunate to have a late check out and after that was able to store my luggage before my late flight out. Concierge was helpful but often times on the phone heping other customers so sometimes you had to wait a while. FOOD: did not eat in the hotel but I did have a cup of Max Brenner hot chocolate (YUM!) for $8 a cup..... LOCATION: could not be beat. Central shopping district and within walking distance to restaurants and stores to pick up food, water, snacks. Great stay in a great city and would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “sleep wasn't good”
Reviews.Author: michiruo
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is good till bedtime. No big complaints but just wanna share my experience. Spent 4 nights at sheraton and was given a room on the low 6th floor facing hyde park and the bus stop. If U are a light sleeper with the traffic, it could be a disturbance especially to my husband. I tried to change to higher floor but all rooms are full and the only available room is on the 9th floor or the suite (too expensive). And since both side of the hotel is facing the street, there will definitely be some noise. With only 3 floors up, I thought there will be no difference any way. However, my next door neighbour was another additional noise pollution. I believe there are at least 2 girls or more in a group staying on the same floor. For consecutive 3 mornings, they woke up at 6plus with the merry morning greetings which could be heard clearly through the connecting doors. For the next 15 mins or so, alot of dins and dongs going on with a nice ending of a loud slamming of the room door. To be fair, the slamming is not their fault cos usually when we leave the room, the room door will close on its own. However, the door always close with a loud thud. Unfortunately, incident like this happens to us. If not, our stay could have been fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you can expect from a 5star Luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: LorieNakasenh
Reviews.Content: Wow Wow Wow not what I expected. When I worked in the city (sydney) I use to walk pass this place and think wow so posh and thought it was cold. But I was wrong. Me and my partner decided to have a getaway for our 9 year anniversary December 19 2009. We chose this hotel because we knew the Sheraton brand had great reputation and for the 5 star rating. I had went online checked the website and got a deal called "Suite for a room" which was $399. When we walked in, we were greeted by a very warm genuine concierge and they had the Christmas decorations up which made the place feel like you walked into a palace decked out with christmas lights and trees. The check in staff were so pleasant and helpful. Check in was quick and efficient. When we arrived in our room 1717 I was surprise that we had gotten the room which was in the centre of the hotel and the views were absolutely great. The sitting area for the suite was very spacious and the bed was king size and very very comfortable. The cleanliness of the room was perfect. It has a big marble bathroom. Back to the views, you could see Hyde Park, Eastern Sydney Suburbs, Water Views towards Rose Bay. The room had two great size plasma and superb TV reception. We also used the spa and fitness facilities and the staff there were absolutely great, my partner had a massage and told me that the massage room had great city views. while he was having a massage I treated myself for a swim. Sheraton On the Park by far has the best location for indoor heated pool, being it is on the very top floor of the hotel and has glass windows to see the city skyline. Also has a balcony area for you to sunbake. The location is great, close to pit street mall, hyde park (across the road) Botannical gardens, circular quay, centrepoint tower and also many other boutiques, bars and restaurant. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great location for sydney shopping & nightlife”
Reviews.Author: sydneyfamily123
Reviews.Content: just stayed here on the weekend as we had a function in the city. lovely hotel easy check in, great rooms & wonderful buffet breakfast. Didnt get a room with a view as we werent going to be spending much time in the room so this wasnt a problem. so nice to just walk around the corner from a day of shopping and relax. Also after a night on the town no long cab ride home. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, miss the Mariott benefits though”
Reviews.Author: Mobile_Road_Warrior
Reviews.Content: I have been checked in since Monday and will be here for another 3 weeks. So far I have been impressed with this hotel, the rooms are beautiful the staff friendly and efficient. I flew in from LAX at 6:30 in the morning and they allowed me an early checkin. The room is very nice sized and the bathroom is beautiful, large and well maintained. The location of the hotel is excellent, all of my work is in Chatswood, which I reach by a 20 minute train ride from Town Hall station only a few blocks away. The only bad thing that has happened is a drunk in the room next door was singing loudly until past midnight. He finally stopped before I went to bed so I never called to complain. But obviously that is not the hotels fault. The only other issue I have is with the internet speed, in your rooms they charge 70+ dollars for 3 nights (I get mine free because of my company). For that price I would expect decent speed. But I get less than 1MBs, and during peak hours well below that. I am an engineer, and am always pulling documents from my servers in the US so this is very annoying. They have free WiFi in the lobby, but I haven't had occasion to use that. I am a SPG Gold member, my company was recently acquired and my travel choices are now defined by my new company. Previously I tried to stay in Marriotts and was a Platinum member with them. Last year alone I spent 192 nights in Marriotts, and was always treated very well for my status. Even when I was a gold member I would get room upgrades and welcome gifts. So, while this hotel is very nice I am thinking of moving to a Marriott nearby where my Platinum status will get me a better room and access to the club. I would highly recommend this hotel for most people. Robert

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room. No view, but very spacious”
Reviews.Author: GeelongCat
Reviews.Content: The room was fabulous! Very spacious, neat & clean. Bathroom was large. Our room looked out to nowhere. Bed was comfortable. Got the breakfast, parking deal. Very good value for money. Right near the city centre for shopping. Restaurant was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: djjaguar
Reviews.Content: We checked in and were given a room with a huge stain on the rug and bathroom that smelled like puke. We booked the Club Access Room with a one night free rate. We were too jet lagged to move as we had unpacked everything but did advise the hotel about the odour. The hotels location is excellent. The fitness center was adequate and so was the large pool and jacuzzi. The lounge was great, breakfast wonderful, and so was the lounge staff. The free internet is only accessible in the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. Unbeatable Location. Flawless Service.”
Reviews.Author: girlish_sista
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights in their basic city view king room. I was very impressed. So much so that I am writing this review whilst enjoying their breakfast buffet and looking out at St James and Hyde Park. Firstly, their location is great. 2 minute walk to George St and Pitt St Mall for amazing shopping, as well as the QVB 5 mins away. Darling Harbour is 10 minutes walk away! The room was spacious and even had a lounge, walk in wardrobe and a seperate bath and shower, which is very important to me. Views are not awesome but most aren't in the middle of the city. The room was cleaned very well each day and all my requests were accommodated with a smile. I ordered room service on 2 occasions and the food, though a little expensive was served promptly, and was hot and very tasty. Overall, I was very happy. I would have no problems reccommending this hotel for friends or family travelling for business or leisure. I hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Executive Club out and about”
Reviews.Author: KatSalnPea
Reviews.Content: We stayed at their City View Executive Club room for 2 nights over the long weekend, in general - reasonably satisfied but not impressed. Let's start with the good things, - Superb location, across the road from Hyde Park, next door to David Jones and the boutique stores, as well as St James train station (although if you have a pram, you need to be very strong to carry down the stairs). - Friendly staff, both the reception desk and the executive club lounge staff are very helpful, check-in, check-out very smoothly. Even thought we were only there for 2 days, on the second day staff at the breakfast service already remembered our coffee/tea preference. - Beautiful indoor swimming pool at the top floor with glass ceiling, child friendly. - Room is spacious and clean. Now the disappointing factors, - Most of the other hotel's executive clubs are available all day, Sheraton's executive club offers breakfast 7-10 (10:30am on weekends and public holidays), 2pm-4pm afternoon tea (very limited menu), 5pm-7pm for pre-dinner cocktail, after 7:30pm you'll have to pay for the drinks, and it shuts at 9pm. We found this rather restricted. - When we made the booking, we requested for a cot in the room, but when checking-in at 7pm on the day, there was no cot in the room. After phoning customer service, it was delivered to us within 15mins. I just don't expect Sheraton would make mistakes like this. - The room seems a bit tired, bathroom doors don't shut completely, one of the window shutters was broken. - Housekeeping didn't refill the mouth wash and vanity pack after cleaning the room - The hotel has one ramp entrance for disabled and pram access, but it's on the far side of the hotel. When I push the pram down the 4-5 steps, none of the concierge came to help, although a few times there were a couple of them at the front door, that was a bit poor form. So in all, the hotel has it's advantages and disadvantages, maybe I expected too much from Sheraton, it didn't stand the test for me.

Reviews.Title: “On The Park .. Sydney Style ..”
Reviews.Author: Pedro3012
Reviews.Content: I stayed from Sunday - Wednesday. Very nice hotel. Rooms are in great condition. I had a room at the corner of the building which although was a city view room did have some glimpses of Sydney Harbour. Excellent location to walk to Oxford Street for shopping and of course all the city stores (David Jones etc). New bar above lobby level is also nicely decorated. Link @ Sheraton is a nice touch with free internet access - perfect for the holiday traveller who simply wants to quickly connect back to the real world without having to incurr a daily internet charge in the room. One mistake was made with my billing but was fixed with a single email after departure.

Reviews.Title: “Spoil yourself!! I DID”
Reviews.Author: Garryuktraveller
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place to stay. The rooms are amazing, staff friendly & the room top pool is the best. Centrally located near David Jones Shopping Centre and to all the major points of interest in town. The marble bathrooms are a treat also. The gym adquate for morning jog. Will return on our next trip to sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Not great for twin travellers”
Reviews.Author: D4T4
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very nice - bar and dining areas were nice. The buffet breakfast thats included is very good and will set you up for the day. The concierge desk was efficient, helpful and friendly (more than can be said for the receptionish on our arrival). The location - it is a good 10-15 minute walk to the sights of harbour bridge and the opera house. The problems for me and a friend started at check in where we were told although we had booked a twin room - we could'nt have one! After 20 minutes of arguing - they offered to put us in a smoking twin room (neither of us being smokers) which we had no choice but to accept. The other thing they did suggest is that we pay extra for a rollaway in a NS room which we felt was a bit cheeky and perhaps a little bit of a money making exercise. Onto the room; clean with a really nice bathroom but it was small and the twin beds may have well been pushed together for all the space that was between them! Used the bar which was OK prices although completely empty when we had a few drinks. All in all, I would try elsewhere if I returned to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in this class in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: KTJMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Sure - this doesn't have the harbour views - but its a great hotel in a great location, and beats the likes of the shangri-la, four seasons, and intercontinental hands down. Great hotel - great service - will come here again when I stay on business.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaYoohoo
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Sheration on the Park on a recent but brief business trip with my wife for one night on 24th May. This is our first time at a Sheraton property however the stay at the hotel has greatly exceeded our expectations especially the exceptional staff service. The staff we have encountered at the hotel from the concierge, bell desk, housekeeping, restaurant and check in, was none less than a five-star experience. â€¢Upon arriving at our destination, the bell desk staff greeted us with smiles and offered valet parking to us without any hassle. â€¢One of the staff even suggested to us to call concierge 15 minutes prior to departure so that they could bring up the car and it would be ready for us when we went down to the lobby. â€¢We asked for driving directions to a very important business meeting on the 25th May and the concierge staff went out of their way to photocopy the map and provide us with very detailed instructions so that we would not get lost on our way. â€¢In another occasion we asked the concierge staff for directions to the Broadway shopping centre and again they were very patient in giving directions to us. â€¢It was raining on the afternoon on 25th May and the concierge staff gladly offered us an umbrella with a smile. â€¢The housekeeping staff who attended to our room did an excellent job by making up our room on the day of 25th May, without us prompting them to do so. This wonderful staff experience is very surprising yet delightful as we were made to feel very welcome and at home. This is very different to many of the world class hotels where we stayed in which the staff attitude was rude and treated as low class people in comparison to the high roller business travellers. We will no doubt choose the Sheration as the preferred hotel of our choice everytime we visit Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Devil's in the detail”
Reviews.Author: mrvoegler
Reviews.Content: If you can put this on the Corporate credit card... Go for it. Expensive, but great. Although, took an hour or so each morning to bring my car up.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, gorgeous, gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: JaniPK
Reviews.Content: One of my favourite hotels in the world. Clean, beautiful, amazing food (room service and restaurant), excellent service, not too stuffy or 'proper' that you feel uncomfortable, baths you could spend all night in (I haven't used any of the amenities as the room service tray balances nicely over the bath so I just spend my evening in there...), great location - next to the shopping district & Darling Harbour but 10 mins walk from Circular Quay. I will live here when I win the lottery.

Reviews.Title: “A Great spot and an amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: butterscotchy
Reviews.Content: It was just one night, i wish i had checked in at 2pm. a true 5 star. i was out on a night with the boys. there wasn't anything that was too much trouble. and a great location too

Reviews.Title: “One of the best business hotels in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Schmidtlock
Reviews.Content: This is the best AUD 200-250 deal that I ever got in Sydney (and I stayed in 15 or so hotels there over the past year). Spacious rooms and very clean and quiet. It is difficult to understand how some other hotels in Sydney get away with charging you the same and offereing less than half of what this hotel does.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Thousandeurist
Reviews.Content: It is located half-way from almost everywhere. From Sydney Harbour to old town Across from Hyde Park (please donâ€™t think in nothing similar to his cousin back in London, but still a pleasant place to have a short walk) and close to the best shopping in town (everything from high street, department stores or upmarket stores). A subway station is 5 minutes walk. Well-appointed, clean rooms, although bit dated. Great bed. A good night of sleep almost guarantees. Huge marble bathroom, still with the sense that it was decorated 15 years ago and not updated since. Fine toiletries. Best? Enjoy a relaxant bath in the tub (bathroom sports both tub and shower, that I found very convenient) Bar and common areas quite old-fashion and not very lively. Attentive and professional staff. Both check-in and check-out were done quickly and fine. Flawless. There is lots of opportunities for breakfast if not including in your room rate. Starbucks is on Elisabeth St., 200 yards down the main entrance. Dead on Sundays, as shopping and offices are closed, take the opportunity to have a stroll down towards Paddington area. Avoid Oxford St. I don't still understand why the travel guides recommend going there. It is like the dirty version of the wrong London Soho adresses'. Great value for money deal.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favourite hotels”
Reviews.Author: DougoOz
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in town and whenever we do, we like to spoil ourselves with a great hotel such as the Sheraton. After finding a great rate, we booked the Sheraton on the Park and looked forward to our stay, having stayed there last about 2 -3 years ago. The Sheraton is ideally situated, across from Hyde Park in Elizabeth St, very close to St James Stn, and shoppers heaven nearby - all the high end shops in Castlreagh St - what more could you want? We weren't disappointed. We arrived early and our room was ready and offered to us without us asking. We experienced excellent customer service at the Reception, elegant ambiance in the foyer and other parts of the hotel, a beautifully appointed room and huge marble bathroom (I wish mine was like this at home!!), a very comfortable bed and pillows and a long soak in a bath, what's not to love? We had complimentary breakfast the next morning where we found a large assortment of breakfast items, perhaps not as many to select from compared to our first visit a couple of years ago, but still quite a large selection and if you can't find anything to eat at this buffet, then I'd be surprised. Anything and everything from cold cuts, cheeses, fresh fruit, juices, cereals, porridge, small pancakes / pikelets, Bircher muesli, nuts, dried fruit, pastries and breads, and plenty of hot items from Miso soup to eggs cooked to order or choose from the Bain Marie. We asked for a late check out because we were not able to take our car out of the garage until after the ANZAC DAY march concluded. Our request was graciously met and we were able to enjoy our room and all that the Sheraton had to offer for a few more hours. All in all a great stay...thanks Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Right next to all the shopping!”
Reviews.Author: MsTravelHag
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for a total of 6 nights and our room rate included the breakfast buffet and free parking (which we did not use). I can't say enough about the location! As mentioned this property is walking distance to Pitt St , George St., and Hermes my favorite store. Plus the St. James station is right across the street and the free CBD bus (555) and stop is right down the street as well. Rooms do vary in size however, our first 4 nights we were in a standard sized room (however bigger than most hotel rooms in France, etc) with a view of Sydney Tower, however on our last 2 nights, we had a huge room with a partial park view. The beds are uber comfortable and the AC worked very well. The bathroom was also very roomy, but I did not care too much about the standard ammenities. Turndown service is on request, but there are no "freebies" such as bottled waters, chocolates, or slippers. We thought the breakfast buffet was a great deal (food is pretty pricey in Sydney) and the quality of food was above the norm and they staff did a great job keeping food stations full and clean. We had a great server Vincent, who attended to our needs and recommended items that were not on the buffet, such as eggs benedict made to order and espresso based drinks. The restaurant, Aria gets very busy in the morning so I recommend that you get there between 6:30am-7:30am. The hotel also provides free newspapers everyday, free wireless internet in the lobby and 3 computers for public use. The hotel is not an intimate property at all - it's very busy, but I would recommend this property with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: bigtommy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for just one night before flying out, and it was a lovely hotel. Nice room, great bathroom and generally well laid out. Some great touches. Only issues were that the internet was supposed to be included, but it showed up on the final bill. Didn't have the time or energy to dispute it upon checking out. I also feel that I must have annoyed the person checking us in as our room has a lovely view of an air-conditioning unit. Park views are a premium price, but one always hopes for a view of something. As we were there for just one night, I didn't worry about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms,Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nukenriles
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel,rooms were good size, pool and spa area are really nice.You can walk or take the free bus any place in Sydney. Easy transfers to airport by train to St.James station directly across the street.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced”
Reviews.Author: ganotrill
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights in this hotel while meeting with business associates. Room was OK. Staff were impersonal and a little arrogant. Valet Parking was a train wreck, took 30 minutes to get my car on checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and good quality 5* in the heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: kevinpng
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Sheraton on the Park in late March 2010. The hotel is in a great location - accessible to the CBD. Staff were excellent and very efficient at check-in. Upgraded to Park View room - great view over Hyde Park to the Harbour. Room was spotless and very well maintained. Fantastic bathroom. Highly recommend - got a great deal at sheraton.com

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay at in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: wishicudtravelmore
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Sydney, and we absolutely loved this hotel. The hotel staff was excellent and very attentive to our needs. The room was set up very tastefully, and offered a nice view of the Hyde Park and St. Mary's Cathedral. The black marble bathroom was superb, and so were the bathroom supplies. When we made our reservations at this hotel, we didn't have a very good idea about the map of Sydney and the relative location of the hotel. Being to Sydney and staying at this hotel, we now know how brilliant of a location it has. All the great attractions of Sydney were amazingly close - we walked to the Botanical Gardens, the Opera House, the Harbour Bridge, Darling Harbour, the Sydney Fish Market, Kings Cross (the Coca Cola sign), and the Town Hall. And of course Hyde Park is just beside the hotel. The only thing at the hotel that might be a little better was the concierge service. While they were always very eager to make reservations for us at restaurants, I expected them to be more knowledgeable about the places of interest around Sydney. Again, it might just be the specific folks that I talked to at the concierge desk... but that was the only non-positive thing about our entire stay. Overall, highly recommended.... great location, great staff and services, great rooms and comfortable beds... what else can you ask for? :-)

Reviews.Title: “excellent room & location; very average service.”
Reviews.Author: KizoLove
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights around the first week of Jan mainly to do some shopping and to see old friends. The location of this hotel is quite ideal for shopping (if that's what's on your mind) - the back entrance of the hotel in particular will lead you straight to castlereigh street, and right across the road is the David Jones department store for men. Go through the arcade across the road from the hotel's back entrance and you'll end up on george street where Queen Victoria Building (QVB) shopping centre is. (tip: once you come out of george street, turn left and onto HSBC to get your money changed for a good rate; they use travelex but it beats the other currency exchange place closer to the hotel). and their rates are available online. The monorail stop in Galleries Victoria is also accessible via castlereigh street (walk out the back entrance and turn left, it'll be to your right just have to cross the road). The rooms of the hotel are well appointed as what the other reviewers have said and are quite generous in size. the decor is really pleasant and i really liked the wooden blinds touch - much better than your average heavy curtain pull. The bed was big and very comfortable. The bathrooms are large and stocked well with the little amenities that you find in most 3-5 star hotels. Although I didn't like the fact that there wasn't a plug for my blowdryer inside the bathroom (so had to use the mirror outside of the bathroom), but they did provide a good blowdryer for guests to use, none of that really weak/poor-excuse-for-a-blowdryer stuff. The only thing I would fault this hotel for was their average service. We checked in pretty late around 10pm and when the taxi pulled up in front there wasn't a bellhop to help with our luggage and I had to go inside the hotel and actually ask for help with our luggage. The receptionist was very cold and didn't give off a friendly vibe,although I may be knit-picking here since I'm very spoiled with the service we get in asian hotels. I guess it's just the difference in culture? The business centre in the lobby is very useful for those who want to do some quick facebook/email checking and printing (for free), and the breakfast is good (not great). But make sure to come down early coz the restaurant is not that big and gets full really fast (but maybe that also depends on the season).

Reviews.Title: “Bargain, and treated like royality despite being scruffy backpackers”
Reviews.Author: fimonkey
Reviews.Content: My bf and I were backpacking and living cheaply but with all the rain in Sydney over the Xmas holiday there wasn't much to do and all the indoor amenities (aquarium, museums etc) were jam packed with huge queues to access them. We went onto the wotif.com website to see if we could find a cheap hotel with a spa we could use for the day and the Sheraton on the Park came up at $130 for what should have been a $650 room! This was on the 27th Dec.. We booked it at 10am that morning, got there at 11am and although wotif hasn't yet faxed through our booking the staff were superb. .. We got a room straight away, and depsite looking scruffy were treated with respect and friendliness. The receptionist even joked that she couldn't get a room there that cheaply! (That rate excluded breakfast so can't comment on that). The concierge was great at giving us vouchers for mnoey off at attractions (15% of featherdale wildlife park etc) and the staff who took out bags did not hang around as though waiting for a tip (which has been the case when I've stayed in lovely hotels for business purposes). The covered rooftop pool and spa were a dream, the bed was super comfortable and the TV and bathroom were both enormous! Plus free wifi in the comfortable reception helped save us some money and catch up with emails etc. Overall a great hotel and if we'd have paid full price we'd have still been happy with the cleanliness and service. A great way to spend a rainy day in Sydney when all other attractions are full.

Reviews.Title: “Central, well appointed, great experience”
Reviews.Author: DoesNotGetOutMuch
Reviews.Content: Lacks a harbor view but right near Hyde Park, Museums, good walk through gardens to Harbour and close to shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a city break”
Reviews.Author: princess3016
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in January this year. The hotel location is right in the heart of the CBD overlooking the park and a two minute walk from the train station. Very central and easy to get around. The hotel itself was of a high standard, the rooms were a good size and the bathrooms were large for a city hotel. I also liked the fact that in the room the large wardrobe area was big enough to hold open suitcases and hand luggage so the room itself did not get cluttered. The room we had was very quiet which was surprising considering its location. There was no view to speak of, but this was a city hotel so expected and not a problem. The morning breakfasts were of a high standard, there was a wide range of choice from the full english breakfast, through to continental choices, there was a lot of fruit which was a bonus and even ice cream which we saw people enjoying. Service was good by all staff and the rooms were kept very clean. Overall, the hotel stay was not cheap, however, we have been caught out in sydney hotels before so I would rather pay the bit extra and be assured of the quality. If you are someone who is not too fussy and just wants a bed for a night or two, you would find a cheaper option elsewhere, Given the great standard of rooms and breakfast, I will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Snooty hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_from_the_uk
Reviews.Content: I only stayed at this hotel for one night as i could not stand the snooty and fake atmosphere of the hotel. I informed the hotel prior that i would be arriving at 9am. Upon arrival, i was kept waiting till 3pm to be checked in, despite the staff telling me that my room would be ready in one hour, then 15 mins, then half and hour and so on and additionally other people checking in before me. Maybe because i was dressed in my scruff, i should of showed them my bank balance and Baleciaga bag first (i am sure i would of got a better reception). The room was nothing spectacular for a 5 star hotel, the entrance of the hotel was grand though. The spa staff were very friendly, they showed me around the hotel, the spa facilities and even allowed me to freshen up after my long flight, prior to checking in (reception staff - take note). Once i was dressed in my "glad rags", full make up, hair done and showing my diamonds, I was looked upon differently. Unfriendly and unprofessional staff, drinks over priced - breakfast - nothing fantastic. I was made to feel like a piece of s*** upon arrival of a long flight, they even bunged me in a room at the end of the corridoor. Do not arrive at this hotel in your scruff, you will receive unwelcome glares.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Christo99
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton has a fantastic location opposite Hyde Park (St James Station). We caught the train from the airport and it was a breeze. The hotel is only a block from David Jones / Myer / Pitt Street Mall. The only negative is that there aren't a huge number of restaurants within easy walking distance. The room was lovely and spotlessly clean. We were lucky to get a 10am check-in, and a room on the 19th floor. The windows had wooden louvres which couldn't be pulled back to get a good view (well at least I couldn't open them!) But they did have electric black-out blinds operated from the bedside - very cool. I did notice the banging of room doors in the corridor, but this is fairly common in hotels. Excellent bathroom, although the bath flooded thru the floor waste when emptied. Not a major problem though. Lovely walk-in shower. The bathroom had a pair of sliding doors that were quite noisy when you're trying not to wake the other half in the middle of the night. Service excellent from everyone we encountered during our stay. There is a well appointed gym, sauna and steam room plus rooftop swimming pool, which was very refreshing after an extremely hot day (38 C). Breakfast had the usual selection, and was very nicely presented, however I thought a bit pricey at AU$42. Would definitely go back. A real oasis in the city. Make sure you walk through Hyde Park then the Botanic Gardens down to the waterfront, and follow it round to the Opera House. I always do this when in Sydney - it's just beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing and overpriced - appalling service for a 5*”
Reviews.Author: Magpiesnest
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights as our preferred Sydney Hotel (Shangri La) was full. We first encountered a queue at reception which whilst not long didnâ€™t seem to move at all â€“ we were not told at the booking stage that there was a separate check in for the Exec Club. The room and bathroom were quite nice as expected for a 5 star hotel. Our first and subsequent visits to the Exec lounge were crowded and noisy with young families and limited food services. For example there was one slow 4 piece toaster for the entire lounge. On the second night we had room service which was fairly quick and the butter chicken and accompaniments were nice and tasty On checking out I found that the Exec Club didnâ€™t include internet in the room and it was only free whilst in the actual Exec Lounge and I was charged for two nights ($60 total) I pointed out the â€˜benefitsâ€™ sheet Iâ€™d been given gave the distinct impression that the Internet was free and didnâ€™t stipulate in Exec Club Lounge only. I was then told all the benefits of the Exec Club were â€œwhilst in the Exec lounge onlyâ€� â€“ I then looked at the list which included access to the Health Club and was advised â€œwell thatâ€™s different of courseâ€� I then pointed out the free pressing of two garments on the first day and asked whether they had to be handed in whilst in the Exec Club and was told â€œwell thatâ€™s different as wellâ€�. There were others that clearly couldnâ€™t have been restricted to the Exec Club but I gave up at that point as the Receptionist was clearly not interested. We then moved to the exit to get a taxi for the Airport and I pointed out to the Porter that our two suitcases were too big for a saloon taxi and could he get the estate car for us which was third in line (there were two other guests without bags waiting so no one would be concerned). He ignored me and called the next taxi driver in line. There followed a comical situation where bags were loaded and then unloaded by the Porter and despite the taxi drivers protestations the Porter attempted to close the boot on bags that were clearly well over the loading line. He eventually gave up and squeezed one large suitcase in the front of the taxi (after hitting the driverâ€™s door on the way in). I noticed the wheels on the bag made a significant dent in the passenger (leather) seat. Needless to say the taxi driver was not too happy. Next time Iâ€™m in Sydney Iâ€™ll make sure I book the Shangri La as early as possible. If you have to stay at the Sheraton I would save your money on the noisy and busy Exec Club â€“ itâ€™s neither special nor Executive. Overall a poor experience for a supposedly five star hotel priced at over $600.00 per night room only before food and Internet..

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and spacious, close to city amenities”
Reviews.Author: vivi0000
Reviews.Content: This review is a little late but better late than never. I stayed here for 2 nights in November 2009. I got a bargain of a deal of $160 per night. This offer was advertised for only 3 days so I grabbed this opportunity to stay at this hotel. I arrived late in the evening and check in was fast and friendly. As I am a Starwood Preferred Guest (spg.com) member I got a room on a higher floor. Higher floors are dedicated to spg members. This meant less noise from the floors below. I was also given a room in the corner of the floor and it was very quiet. The bed was very comfortable with top quality bedding sheets and doonas etc. Everything was spotless when I arrived. The bathroom was also big enough to move around in. The shower is a walk in one - the only thing I would say is be careful when taking a shower. Your bath mat may get soaked by the time you finish and the floor will be very wet. You are provided with Sheraton's own brand shampoo, conditioner, body lotion and soaps. There was a hairdryer in the closer / luggage storage compartment. The beauty of this hotel was that there was an ironing board and iron... with plenty of space to do any ironing. The minibar is small but items were expensive - you are better off going to a 7-Eleven or a supermarket and buying your own drinks and putting them in the fridge yourself to cool. Downstairs towards the back of the foyer, there is free internet available for 1 hour. The foyer is grand and very big, especially with the staircases. I will say that the food (breakfast at around $35AUD - cold items only) is pretty steep for what you get. I'm sure you can get breakfast around town for less than this. Nonetheless, it has an excellent view over the park. Buffet breakfast is served in the Botanica Restaurant and consisted of platters of fruit, pastries, breads, cereal. If you want the hot items (like eggs, bacon etc) I think this breakfast was $40-42AUD roughly. Location is excellent - across the road is the park and also St James train station. It was convenient getting from the airport at night when I arrived. A train ride from the domestic airport was $15 by train. Whilst it was an excellent hotel to stay at, it wasn't a "wow" experience for me hence is would be a 4 out of 5 for me. I would stay here again only if there was another great deal being offered.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, dont purchase the romance pkg!”
Reviews.Author: Chantelle87
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying this is a very nice hotel, spacious bedrooms, marble bathrooms, large tv and blackout blinds amd comfy bed. I found the staff friendly and helpful and both dinner and breakfast was fantastic. The only negatives were that we stayed for valentines day and purchased the romance pkg, i reccomend not doing this for the extra money. First it took them over an hour to bring the wine to our room when the staff member ensured us it will be up within 15 min, normally this wouldnt be such a big deal, but because we brought with us some cheeses and pate that we would of liked to enjoy a few hours before going to dinner. By the time the wine arrived it was well after 5.20 we cheked in at 3.30pm, so it was to late to eat the cheeses. The sparkling wine was disgusting, couldnt even finish my glass it was that bad and the chocolate and fruit platter well.... there was no chocolate and it consisted of two red apples two green apples a peach and 5 cherries, the fruit was just plonked on their whole without even a knife to cut it up with..

Reviews.Title: “A perfect base for exploring one of the Great Cities of the World.”
Reviews.Author: TheoJones
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sheraton on the Park for Christmas and New Years Eve 2009 - we decided to treat ourselves to a little luxury, and it did not disappoint. Reception was professional, but friendly and warm - the room was just perfection. A bed that was one of the best I have ever slept in, and proper 100% blackout shutters for that lazy snooze in the morning. There is a health facility and pool on the roof, which are well equipped and excellent - everything about the hotel is luxurious: the public areas, the restaurant and bars. The location is perfect for travellers, as the main trainline from the airport stops at St James, straight across the road - hyde park is amazing for walks, and all of the key sights are a short 10 minute walk away. The staff were excellent, even arranging car hire at short notice (on the 27th of December no less!!!). We spent a wonderful evening drinking cocktails, chatting to the bar staff, listening to someone playing the piano in the foyer. Truly magical. Room service was fast, delicious and delivered with some real class - the restaurant was out of this world. We ate there on xmas day, then again a couple more times. It was consistently amongst the best food I have had in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel..loved it”
Reviews.Author: traveller666
Reviews.Content: We flew in from Canada and after travelling for 28 hours it was wonderful that our room was available for an early check in. As others have said lovely large room, bathroom with lots of towels and large closet with free safe. I had made several changes to our reservation prior to our arrival and the customer service staff were excellent. The location to the harbour was a bit of a walk but the bus was right outside the door. We really liked the free WIFI in the lobby. Our package included breakfast and the hotel has one of the best buffets however if not included it would have been $42. There was lots of coffee and tea in the room. We really enjoyed our stay here and found the staff very courteous and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Busy Hotel but Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Hotel-Hobo
Reviews.Content: * Good rooms * Excellent & helpful staff * Good City location * Excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Convenient location. Better still if the service catches up.”
Reviews.Author: maizebb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a week when attending a conference held at Darling Harbour Exhibition Center. The room's very spacious, with big closet and a huge bathroom. The room's beautifully decorated, extremely clean, and better still overlooking the Hyde Park. It's conveniently located in the city center, walking distance to both Circular Quay or Darling Harbour though I usually take the monorail. Plenty of eating/shopping places in the vicinity, got both higher end Italian dining place or food court. The only thing to complain's their staff, no matter the one who checked me in/out or the one who couldn't find my dress which's supposed to be for express laundry but ended up being returned later than ordinary laundry.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest hotel we have EVER stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: purplehair59
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Sydney for Australia Day & stayed 3 nights. We'd just been in Canberra & the Blue Mountains, so arrived quite tired & a bit frazzled. Pulled into the front entrance and an angel appeared, spirited our bags up to our room, put the car to bed, and everything just got better after that. The hotel is beautful, sparkling clean, the bed comfy, no noise from neighbors, large shower with excellent pressure & temperature. The concierge was amazing - he knew all the restaurants to recommend without having to consult directories (usually someone throws a book of menus at us), he knew the buses & trains, he knew the popular tour schedules. He even lent us an umbrella the night it threatened rain (his suggestion). The location is excellent - easy walks to Darling Harbour, Circular Quay, the opera house, Mrs. MacQuarie's Chair, The Rocks. It's right on Hyde Park. It was easy for us to get to all those areas for the varied activities on Aus Day. Also perfect location for bus to Bondi Beach & train to airport. Our last day, we left our luggage with the concierge & when we returned at 4 pm, they sent us up to the fitness center to get washed up & changed. Internet is expensive - $30/day, but worked very well.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel, Please note - no children in Executive Lounge after 5pm”
Reviews.Author: 4familySanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over New Years. We found it to be a good location near Hyde Park . It's an easy walk to Circular Quay, many of the larger Sydney companies, and the Opera House as well as to Darling Harbour. We stayed in a suite, which we picked as a good option for a family compared to two connecting rooms. It was advertised as including access to the Executive Floor that serves breakfast and cocktails. The room was comfortable with a king size bed and separate living room. There is an extra charge for a roll away bed. The executive club food service was much better than expected for breakfast with luxuries like smoked salmon and cappuccinos. It also included several hot options like scrambled eggs and sausage. The lounge had two computers that we could use with complimentary internet. We were disappointed to learn though that children are not ever allowed in the executive lounge after 5pm. Guests are not allowed to take food or drink out of the Executive Lounge and they had staff posted to make sure that guests understood that rule. We learned about these rules in the lounge but later checked on the website. It's clearly posted on the hotel website so we wanted to point it out here as we had missed it. The hotel tells me that they are looking into ways to make guests aware of this rule. Apparently guests complained about children and they made this rule to accomodate business travel. I am certain that the rule makes it easier for business travelers but a challenge for those of us that are on vacation travel or a weekend visit. The in room coffee was nicer than expected as well with french press coffee and a variety of teas - all complimentary. The health club is large and has a lot of equipment and there is an indoor pool. We were pleasantly surprised that we could see the midnight New Year's fireworks over Woolloomooloo Bay from our room on the park side as we had been told we wouldn't see them. We had watched the 9pm fireworks as guests at the Opera House event but came home with our son before midnight. Higher floor Park side rooms have some water view and it's a lovely view of the city. I would return to this hotel on business travel. We had a few minor issues with service but we did visit this hotel over a very busy time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Festival First Night”
Reviews.Author: GreenStarfish
Reviews.Content: My parents and I stayed here for 4 nights and we loved it. Free wireless in the lobby and the beds are wonderfully comfortable. The shampoo/conditioner provided is not brand name though. This location is perfect if you're in Sydney during the Sydney Festival's First Night. My room was huge and the bathtub was great - I rarely take baths and this tub was too inviting to pass up. The shower is also very large and spacious. The pool has a great view too since it's on the 22nd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast buffet is the best”
Reviews.Author: AussieDad63
Reviews.Content: If you are travelling to Sydney don't hesitate to book the Sheraton if you can get a good price. We enjoyed the breakfast and dinner buffets which were excellent. The rooms have a quality fit out with marble bathroom and large flat panel TV. There are no harbour views of the Bridge or the Opera House but the city location is ideal for a shopping trip. Our four year old son loved the enclosed rooftop pool on the 22nd floor. On the pool level there is an outdoor area facing Hyde Park with great views that is ideal for taking photos. It is very easy to catch a train from the Airport to St. James station which is short walk across the road from the front of the Sheraton. A taxi to the airport should cost approx $30.

Reviews.Title: “The club level is worth it all”
Reviews.Author: TravelguyNYC75
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the hotel twice for 3 nights in mid and the end of Dec. Location is inferior to Darling Harbor /Circular Quay but still very central and well connected with public transportation. BTW, though public transportation is easy to SYD airport, a taxi ride to the airport is fairly priced. Rooms at the Sheraton on the Park Sydney are spacious. The kind of spacious most same standard US city hotels would call studio suites. But, space is not the only added value at the Sheraton. The Bathrooms are huge and have separate bath and shower. . . . The club, the club here is the real deal. Breakfast, though called continental+, is really a full breakfast and pre-dinner canapes can easily make for a mini dinner. The drinks (including premium alcohol) are free of additional charge and the service is warm, friendly and none-the-less professional. If a good work out is in your travel needs then the Sheraton has an excellent gym. It is not a full gym but is certainly extensive in comparison to a hotel gym and will allow a full body work out in a gym away from your home gym. Though this is a full thumbs up review, there is one major draw back at this property: The restaurants and bars are outrageously priced (about 30% more than same quality in NYC).

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: bazcalUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton over the new year period and we were very impressed with the staffs ability to cope with the busiest time of year. Breakfast was a "sell out" every morning and they managed to provide top quality food in a reasonable time despite the numbers of guests. I have read some reviews that have rated the staff as poor, I can only speak as we found and that is to say we enjoyed top service in a top hotel. Join the Starwood prefered guest scheme. We did and were automaticly upgraded to one of the Starwood floors, I think perhaps the rooms were a little better than standard, we had a desk and sofa etc, plus giant king size bed. The hotel is perfectly situated for exploring the city, just a short walk to the ferry terminal etc. From a personal point of view, having visited Sydney twice now over the last 12 years or so I do feel the need to return as there are so many other places in the world I want to see, Of you have never been to Sydney it is a must visit city but has limited appeal, after 5 days I was happy to escape to the Blue mountains.

Reviews.Title: “A real treat”
Reviews.Author: Loubyloutraveller
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very modern and luxurious and the service was excellent. The only problem with this hotel is that it is positioned on a very busy street. Elizabeth Street to the front and Castlereagh Streets to the rear are both major thoroughfares but if you don't mind the hustle and bustle of the city it's an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another fantastic stay at the Sheraton on the Park Sydney”
Reviews.Author: OzTraveller20
