Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton on the Park for one night on 1 January 2010. This was the second visit to the hotel. I booked the â€œSurpriseâ€� package online on the hotelâ€™s website which offered free parking and buffet breakfast. The room was great â€“ super huge with remote control blinds, lovely air conditioning and a marble bathroom. The breakfast buffet was top notch. Check-in involved a bit of waiting due to many guests checking out late as the night before had been New Yearâ€™s Eve. Staff were a bit frazzled dealing with the queuing guests but this is understandable on what is the busiest night of the year in Sydney. The hotel offers free wifi for guests with laptops in an area adjacent to the lobby â€“ this is much appreciated and welcomed. The same area also contained about 5 computers free of charge for the use of guests. This number of computers was woefully inadequate for the size of the hotel. As I was one of the many guests who had brought their own laptop I myself was ok but the hotel needs to double the number of hotel-owned computers in the area for the use of guests. The hotel is in a great location adjacent to the Pitt Street Mall area of Sydney which is the main shopping centre of the city. There is a high quality delicatessen/upmarket grocery store underneath the David Jones Market Street store which is great for a snack or if you feel hungry within 50 metres of the hotel. The hotel is an easy 10 minute stroll from the Opera House and Circular Quay area in a very safe section of the city adjacent to Hyde Park. Regarding things to do in Sydney, I highly recommend taking a Seaplane ride around Sydney Harbour. These leave from Rose Bay which is a 12 minute cab ride from the hotel and the flight costs about $130. This is an unforgettable experience â€“ make sure you take the package that flies over Bondi Beach as well. You can also have lunch in Rose Bay at a stunning waterfront restaurant called Catalina before or after your seaplane ride â€“ it is right next to where the seaplanes take off. Both the food and the views are fabulous at this restaurant. Also highly recommended is lunch or dinner at Doyles restaurant Watsonâ€™s Bay - fantastic views and food. Bondi Beach is an absolute must but stay away from the Icebergâ€™s restaurant â€“ the food is awful despite the restaurantâ€™s great views of Bondi Beach. Make sure you do whatâ€™s known locally as the â€œBondi to Bronte walkâ€�. This is a lovely scenic walk from Bondi Beach to Bronte beach which takes in lovely coastal views. Allow half an hour there and half an hour back. Once you reach the Bronte end there are some cafes you can sit and have a coffee at before heading back. You can also admire some pricey real estate along the way. For shopping make sure you go to the Westfield Bondi Junction, accessible directly by train from the Sydney CBD or also by Cab â€“ about a 15 minute drive max from the Sydney CBD or 12 minutes by train. This is arguably the best shopping mall in Australia and is where the locals shop with everything you could possibly wish for under one roof including a plethora or restaurants and eating outlets. Also visitors to Sydney should make sure they go on a Captain Cook cruise (they leave from Circular Quay) â€“ I went on a Cocktail cruise that left at 5pm and this is highly recommended but they have cruises leaving all day long. Make sure you stop at the Guylian CafÃ© at Circular Quay for a light sandwich and top quality cakes with recipes derived from Belgian bakers. Itâ€™s a few minutes walk from the Opera House. Other musts are Cockle Bay Wharf and King Street Wharf â€“ donâ€™t bother going to the Harbourside shopping mall at Darling Harbour, it is just a giant tourist trap full of downmarket stores, good for souvenir shopping but nothing else. It is solely a tourist mall, no Sydneysider would be caught dead shopping there. For real shopping go to the Westfield Bondi Junction. The Lindt CafÃ© at Cockle Bay Wharf has amazing light meals and cakes, yes itâ€™s owned by the famous Swiss chocolate company Lindt and they have another branch at Martin Place in the CBD which is also good. Another must is the Wharf at Woolloomoolloo which is a 5 minute cab ride from the CBD â€“ there is a string of upmarket waterfront restaurants there frequented by locals. Dinner at Ottoâ€™s is great (a reservation is required). One final tip - ladies don't even think of stepping out in Sydney without a high SPF sunscreen on your face underneath your makeup and make sure you put sunscreen on your shoulders and arms. Bring a hat with you too. Many tourists grossly underestimate the strength of the Australian sun even the exposure you get from just walking around all day. One final note - when I checked my credit card statement online two weeks after my stay I discovered that the hotel had charged me twice for the room by mistake. A second charge appeared 6 days after I checked out. A quick call to the hotel and the matter was swifty fixed. So check your credit card statements lest it happen to you. Note that the hotel politely and apologetically fixed the problem. Sydney is a wonderful city and the Sheraton on the Park is a great hotel which puts you smack bang in the heart of everything in a safe and upmarket location. Itâ€™s a great base from which to explore Sydney. I would stay here again and recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Another happy stay”
Reviews.Author: CanberraC
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel a few times and it is always nice, although some of the rooms have a very ordinary few of the back of another building. Other than that, the location is perfect, the beds are comfortable, the rooms are well appointed and the breakfast is great.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MINDLE22
Reviews.Content: A great position with all the facilties one would expect of a 5* hotel. Stayed over New Year and the staff were amazing in helping us get fixed up with New Year' Eve arrangements. Sammy the concierge booked us at "Quay" which gave us an incredible view of the fireworks not to mention a superb meal. We were told to expect a hotel a "little dated" but it was nothing of the sort. The entrance and all public aras are extremely impressive and our room had a spectacular view. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Establishment except for one thing.....”
Reviews.Author: MissT78
Reviews.Content: This really is an amazing hotel. Total opulence and the rooms were huge! The decor was gorgeous and there was not a speck of dust in sight. The service by all the staff was second to none and the food we had, either in the restaurant or via room service, was also gorgeous. I have to admit that the $8.50 tray service fee was a little expensive though. The one complaint I had was on check in. I was not advised at the time that they would be taking a bond or holding fee for the room of $300. So, when I checked my account 5 days later, $300 is missing and no explanation as to why. I placed a call to the hotel and although the lady was extremely helpful, I still felt put out that I had to place an interstate call to resolve this issue. Overall, I do rate this hotel extremely high.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: shepherdieu
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel around 10 times in 2009 and am due back there next week - really like it which keeps me coming back. Rooms are comfortable and have a nice feel. Bed is nice and big. TV - 42 inch with cable. Bathroom is large. Gym is fantastic. Pool is adequate. Executive Club on the top level is a nice touch and a great after work wind down or quick breakfast. The full breakfast buffet in the morning I recommend - at $50 odd it's WAY overpriced but still worth a shot. If not - go next door to Bambini Trust which has a great breakfast. Concierge are generally great, getting cabs etc - always nice and easy. Only thing that ALWAYS gets me going is how cold the front desk service is on check in. I always seem to be checking in after a long day and always feel like checking me in is a chore - and I'm Gold SPG but it never seems to matter. I always have to ask if there's park rooms available, and ask for my free internet (part of my work package) otherwise there not include. The next day when I check out I'm generally charged for the Internet and have to reverse/revise the invoice. Now - here's the rub. I stayed at the Hilton in November due to work not being able to get an adequate rate from Sheraton due to avails and the front desk service was far superior. Very welcoming. And this was the first time I'd stayed at a Hilton for yonks and I'm not a member of their loyalty scheme. I can't rave enough about the Sheraton as it's so comfortable, but front desk needs a lot of improvement with small touches to reward frequent custom. I say this with a lot of experience to make the claim on.

Reviews.Title: “5* in all aspects, bravo!”
Reviews.Author: Dipshamps
Reviews.Content: Decided to take advantage of some attractive deals being offered by sydney hotels after the new year madness on prices. Having had a little think and a look at the options, for $200/night i found myself going for the Seraton, deciding that if the only previous negative info on TA was about the recption staff, I could be sure of an otherwise excellent stay. I actually found booking in staff both helpful (they allowed me to get in the room at 11.30 rather than 2) and fast. The room was exceptional - only 'city view' but it was a corner plot on the ninth floor and vast! superbly appointed room, huge comfy bed, loads of room and shutters on the windows which added a touch of class. (fully automatic electronic black out blinds added to the feeling of comfort) Great staff, free internet (minor complaint being the number (or lack of) terminals, 4 is not enough for several thousand people, and the age of them, but thats picking) and gym was top drawer - pool had nice views and the other amenities where as you would expect in a five star hotel. Had food one night in the room (decided the charges were excessive for me) and was very impressed - excellent standard. All in all, cant knock it.

Reviews.Title: “Just "Ok" - Frequent Travel”
Reviews.Author: Wintera
Reviews.Content: Hi there! Happy to respond again to a hotel. I am in hotels for good 80% of nights in a given year and I really know my way around. What I like about this hotel is the location at the park. It just gives it a nice touch to it. The atmosphere at check in/out is professionally cool and albeit being SPG Gold Member it recognition isn't that great. The room is very nice and spacey. The bed is to soft (not a problem of the hotel probably) and wasn't comfortably to me. They offered my daughter a roll in bed, but we settled for the sofa in the room. My daughter was ok sleeping there. However, in taking a look at the sofa and pulling up the pillows we found a room key card, paper, and other staff in there, which the cleaning girl did not see from a prior guest. At our late arrival we wanted to eat in the coffee shop and the checkin said we should try it at the bar and if there is no one go to McDonalds ("sometimes they close early"). Ok we could have tried room service, but settled for McD and had in the lobby - like many, many other people. The rooms - while nice and large - are loud though. On one night I wanted to go the gym and as it was close, they offered to have a security person open it up for me. I did that and I appreciate the effort. For the New Years Eve dinner went to the hotel buffet. That food was really not good and I highly not recommend eating in. Taste, Selection, and Quality was really below standard. My complaint has not been answered on that day, but I specifially had to mention it during check out after which I got an email cc;ed to 10 people with the question what was so bad (well check the written feedback I gave on the day) ... No offer of, hey next time you ll have free coffees etc ... If you get a killer deal - stay there, but have low expectations. The hotel will not cancel on a pre-paid offer - so be sure you know what you are doing! If you have choice, I stayed at the ShangriLa and its a great hotel and also recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: rebeccat83
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine, but for the price you expect more. The computers in the lobby were good, plenty of them to use at any time. The food was average. Our group were overcharged for breakfast and after a few emails with the hotel the extra charges were eventually refunded to our credit cards. We were supposed to stay two nights, but found a better rate at a nicer 5 star hotel so we checked out of the Sheraton. I am going to Sydney in March and will consider staying here if I find a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “We're frequent travellers and still shocked with how heartless this hotel is”
Reviews.Author: MKHH101
Reviews.Content: Actually we never got to stay at the Sheraton on the Park for new year's eve 2009, and we had to give away our fully prepaid stay: the reason was an immediate family member was diagnosed with stage 4 cancer just 2 weeks before our holiday. We wrote politely to the hotel to ask if there could be any flexibility with its cancellation policy (like allowing us a credit on the hotel for a future visit), and the reply was cold from the reservation manager, effectively saying 'we're sorry you know someone who's dying, there's nothing we'll do about our cancellation policy and you'll have to forfeit the full ~A$2,000 but we do welcome you back with us on another fully paid for stay when your family member miraculously doesn't have cancer anymore.' We wrote again to both the hotel reservation manager, and the hotel general manager via the Starwood worldwide guest service. Both refused to address our question and concerns anymore and to them it was the end of communication. Eventually. someone from the Starwood worldwide guest service wrote back and told us 'the case is closed and sorry if you disagree with our decision'. The day before our stay was supposed to begin, we found the pastor of an uncle in Australia who would be interested in a short holiday in Sydney. He sensibly called the hotel to double-check on our reservation before he embarked from Canberra, but the hotel said there was no record of our booking (our reservation vanished on SPG.com too, the Starwood website where we booked). So of course the pastor didn't leave Canberra that day, and one night stay was totally wasted before the hotel finally got back to us to say the reservation was good and 'sorry about the earlier confusion'. We never cancelled our reservation, so how come the hotel and Starwood group's reservation systems seem to be in such disarray? I understand a hotel's operations pretty well from my line of work. I understand hotel room nights are perishable goods, and the fact that the Sheraton on the Park was offering cut-price rates on Expedia 10 days before new year's eve would suggest the hotel was not fully sold out and hence it was keen to hold on to the A$2,000 revenue we were made to forfeit. I could read the cancellation policy myself and technically one can say the hotel was just doing everything by the book and there was nothing wrong with that. However, was that even a human response? Did the hotel think the trade-off of A$2,000 RevPAR right now, against the potential business from two frequent travellers for the entire Starwood group of properties for the next 40-50 years is a good trade? There are more than enough 5-star hotel groups in any city we'll be travelling to, and I hope the Starwood managers do understand that simple fact. We also wrote to the Sydney Opera House to explore re-selling our confirmed new year's eve midnight party tickets, explaining our predicament. The Sydney Opera House almost replied right away and said it was willing to make an exception, and gave us a full refund. It didn't have to do that but it won a lot of goodwill with us as a result. Brand equity is a fickle commodity and easily destroyed; by behaving the way it did, the Sheraton on the Park management just managed to destroy any brand equity it has with us, for the entire Starwood group. That's cheap negative advertising it just had, for a mere A$2,000. It was just shocking how the management team there perceived its guest relationship. We would never want to return to any Starwood property anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location”
Reviews.Author: clueles
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here very much. The location of the hotel is unbeatable. Most of the things on people to do list is either a 10 min walk/drive away. We were happy with the service, the breakky spread was good and also I was glad there was free internet in the lobby. We also used the gym and spa facilities - all excellent. We weren't left wanting for anything.. Will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well appointed and roomy.”
Reviews.Author: IdRatherBeAtHome
Reviews.Content: Great room, breakfast and location. Some front counter staff need to insert a smile and the business centre printing facility was not working, but apart from that the hotel was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: h0ls247
Reviews.Content: I had always wanted to stay in this hotel when I was a backpacker over 10 years ago! So when I finally got the chance to go back to Sydney, I had no hesitation booking the Sheraton on the Park. We got a really good deal on an executive club room, 4 nights for the price of 3 plus an additional 10% off using the Sheraton's best rate guarantee. The room was very specious with a fabulous bathroom. We took full advantage of the executive club, the choice of canapÃ©s was very good, as was the sparkling wine! The Sheraton on the Park is in a great location for touring the city. St. James station is just across the road which is handy for Circular Quay (although you can walk it!) and the airport. We had a fantastic stay which lived up to my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but beware of reception desk!”
Reviews.Author: liamuk2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in November 2009 for the first time. I'd contacted the hotel in advance to request an early checkin which was not honoured on arrival by the unfriendly checkin agent until I suggested I would cancel my reservation and checkin at the Marriott. Miraculously a room was then found (after he had previously "promised" that no rooms were available). The room itself was quite nice and spacious - small walk in closet, large room and a comfortable bed made the place nice to relax in. The bathroom was also large and contained both a walk in shower and a bath. Incidentally both of the rooms I saw had a shower door which doesn't shut completely causing water to leak. Room service was mediocre and expensive (I've yet to find a hotel where it isn't!) but was perfectly edible. The location is good for downtown and the park but if you're in town for tourism purposes maybe a hotel by Circular Quay or darling harbour might be more appropriate. Checkout tried to charge me for somebody else's breakfast consumed in the restaurant which took quite a bit of sorting (turned out they didn't have the other person's signature on the check in the end). No bill had been put under my door the night before so it was lucky I checked. All in all a reasonable hotel but I'd definitely stay at the Circular Quay Marriott next time.

Reviews.Title: “Inflated Reputation”
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an inflated reputation which I fear often sees it mistaken as competing with the very best of Sydney hotels. Whilst still five star standard, it is a second or third tier five star hotel in this city. Where I think it falls down is the care within which service is provided. Whilst efficient, my experience was that it was largely short, sharp and lacking any warmth - except for staff in the pool/gym, and maintenance. Other assessments - pool has a nice view but lacks space for your stuff. Bar really lacks atmosphere and staff are cold almost to the point of rudeness. Location is great for shopping and nice opposite the park. Although if you want to close to a nicer green space, and to Circular Quay, consider the Intercontinental, Sir Stamford or Quay Grand. Rooms are satisfactory but if you choose to book here go for a view of the park rather than noise, equipment and sub-standard rooms at the rear. If you want to stay somewhere nice in Sydney there are better options available so have a good look around before booking. Consider too the outrageous $8.00 delivery charge for room service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: kareny13
Reviews.Content: Hotel faces Hyde Park and is in the middle of the CBD district. Great location. Concierge VERY helpful; Front desk well needs help (had a late check out; OK'ed 3 times and on day of - kept calling me to get out!). More luxiourius than what I expect for a Sheraton. Gym/Spa - excellent; if not using the facilities - go up there for the balcony for graet views of the city. Rooms are very well sized; had a separate sofa from the desk and flat screen TV. The CBD and Shopping Arcades shut down at night (6pm-ish) so the restuarants in the aera tend to be more expensive and less of a choice - during the day - go to the many food courts in the shopping arcades. There are a lot of Convenience Stores and a Woolworths (wth a maket) a block away which is good to stock up on water, snacks and even meals if you want. Thoroughly enjoyable

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT VALET PARK HERE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GetAroundGirly
Reviews.Content: I am a return guest of approx 20 business stays with this hotel, this year, always taking advantage of the Valet parking service. Valet parking, parked my car in a side wall position where someone clearly had reversed into the rear driver side panel ( not a position you would normally be hit in a normal car park). A towball imprint on my newer mercedes clearly visable, it even had left the grease around it. Management took photos and "claimed" they would investigate only to inform me that security cameras were not present in all areas of the carpark, they therefore were not responsible because they had no evidence that they in fact they had caused the accident and offered the excuse that it was probably another guest. Talk about passing the buck.... So next time you pay $49 for Valet Parking here, remember this does not include ANY insurance for your car if they damage it. You would be better to self park and be safe. P.S. If you times the amount of stays (20ish) this year by the Valet Parking charge $49, I have paid $980 for parking. Probably the same amount it would have cost to repair my car! Clearly upper management has issues if this is the way repeat return guests are treated. Very Dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Xenon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great hotel. The rooms are very pleasantly decorated and the bathrooms extremely well equipped. The amenities especially the fitness center and swimming pool are very good.

Reviews.Title: “Location is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: mrsdime
Reviews.Content: I have always stayed on either Darling Harbour or Circular Quay before, being reluctant to stray away from the most obvious tourist locations. However, I am so glad to have found this hotel. Its location on Hyde Park is so much better! The hotel's restaurants simply did not appeal to me, but that did not matter as there were lots of cheap restaurants on its doorstep. The trains, buses and monorail are all right by the hotel too. We used the 555 free circular route bus (thanks to another review for that tip!) to get down to Circular Quay, and it's only a 10 minute walk to Darling Harbour. We stayed on the Club floor, which represented excellent value. Sometimes Club floors are a bit of a con - with minimal services and refreshments, but this was not one of those. The buffet breakfast was kept fresh for the entire 2.5 hours of service, as were the hot and cold canapes in an evening. The staff made sure you were never without drinks and were without exception polite and courteous (another first for a Sydney hotel, in my experience). If I had one downside, it would be the restaurants (as mentioned briefly earlier). There is the bar and the brasserie, and neither had appealing menus for me. However, I would definitely hope to be able to use the hotel again on my next trip and, if this is representative of the Sheraton brand, will look for Sheratons on all future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Barmag
Reviews.Content: This has restored our faith in Sheratons. We have tended to regard them as an unexciting safe bet for business people with a decent, but not lavish, expense account. This one though is something else. Smart, but not forbidding, up-to-date decor, but not over the top. We got a great rate for a 3 night stay over a weekend, and did not at all get the feeling that we were rattling around a half-full business hotel. The room was clean and spacious. A Park view would have been worth the extra perhaps, but how much time do you spend gazing out of the window in a place like Sydney? The location of the hotel is excellent - busy, but not too noisy, and in walking distance of just about anything a tourist would want to see. The breakfasts were huge and excellent, and worth including in the rate if you can as they're quite pricey as a separate item. There was a small problem with our door lock, which housekeeping thought was defective, though it seemed OK to us. The cheery guy from maintenance worked tirelessly to get it right, apologising all the while. Although reception wanted to move us, they accepted our decision to stay put whilst the door was fixed (it was raining outside, so we had nothing better to do). Once the job was finished and we did go out, we returned later in the day to find a bottle of waiting for us, with the compliments of the hotel for the "inconvenience" we had suffered. As further evidence of the human touch (yes, at a Sheraton!), during the previous evening at dinner, we mentioned whilst chatting to our server that it was our wedding anniversary. Nothing more was said, until after refusing dessert, we were presented with a small gateau with Happy Anniversary written on a label of white chocolate - and the coffee was free! "Fair Dinkum" - as our Aussie friends say. Don't hesitate if you can get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Mix up with room booking spoiled the stay”
Reviews.Author: scroober
Reviews.Content: Despite having specified a double room on the booking my wife and I were shoved into a room with two single beds. We only found out about the mistake when we got to our room. I indicated the error to the reception staff and to guest relations but was fobbed off with the usual "we're full" and therefore are unable to move you to another room. There was no offer to compensate for this mistake on the hotel's part. I found their attitude in dealing with my complaint rather arrogant and dismissive. Curiously for a room with two single beds the hotel helpfully supplies condoms in the mini bar. Presumably for the more flexible guests! Ignoring the issue with the beds, which was very difficult to do, it was a pleasant enough room. The bathroom was a good size with a marble style floor seperate bath and a shower as powerful as a watercannon. I know this is a business hotel and we chose it principally for its location but does that mean it needs to be so utterly soul-less? There is plenty of competition in Sydney at this end of the market - I would consider the alternatives before staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, nice stay”
Reviews.Author: aimlesstraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights during our recent trip to Sydney. It was either this or the Westin because we booked based on points. Maybe would've been better off with the Westin. We chose this because it had a higher rating on tripadvisor. Location was superb. Right off the park, right in the middle of the city. 15 minute walk to Circular Quay, likewise to Chinatown/Aquarium. If you don't feel like walking, we found out from the concierge that there is a free bus (the green 555) that runs a loop which goes up to Circular Quay and down to Central station near Chinatown. We couldn't quite figure out the operating hours of the bus, but when it ran, it came close to every 7-10 minutes. Back to the hotel. It was also right across the street from the St James train station. The only complaint I have is that we put out our do not disturb sign everyday and it was ignored for 3 of those days. I've never had this happen before anywhere I've gone. They must've REALLY wanted to clean rooms. We also got a lower floor which I disliked. They did have Link@Sheraton in the lobby which was 3 computers with internet for free use. I believe also, free wireless is the lobby as I saw many laptops down there. Go up to the gym. It was one of the nicest hotel gyms I've seen. It is right at the top of the hotel and you can also go out on the balconies for a view. I would stay here again. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: cookingAust
Reviews.Content: We have just spent our second weekend at the Sheraton on Hyde Park. We returned due to its great central location and beautiful park aspect. It is a great starting point for walks to many tourist areas and a short stroll to city restaurants and shops. David Jones Food Hall a few steps out side the back door - what more could you want!

Reviews.Title: “Last resort”
Reviews.Author: traveller_in_oz
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here because the Ibis on Shelley St and the Westin were both booked out. I stayed in a Club room and had access to gym, nice bed, etc. However, when I went to order a continental breakfast from room service I was told by the person on the other end of the phone "don't treat me like a slave" when I asked for watermelon juice. Customer service training appears definitely in order!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: tmg123Melbourne
Reviews.Content: The room we booked over the Internet had a very cheap rate so we weren't all that surprised to find it was rather small. The bathroom was at least half the size of the room! However, all amenities were first class and the bed was extremely comfortable. Breakfast was excellent and the staff helpful and friendly. Service in the Lobby Bar was a little on the slow side - but that was the only criticism we had. The hotel is in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: BrianTMcginty
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, great location. Fantastic gym/spa. Staff was accommodating to every need and the concierge was very knowledgeable about a lot of activities to do. I would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: nrrox
Reviews.Content: Perfect location; the staff was great and the rooms and perfectly appointed. The hotel is conveniently located on Hyde Park and within walking distance of trains, buses, Darling & Sydney harbors.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, central location, get Club upgrade”
Reviews.Author: yeowon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sheraton on the Park 5 times now. I think it is the best hotel in Sydney. Itâ€™s in a great, central location in the hub of all the shopping and also close to all the transport. It is equi distant to Circular Quay and Chinatown both a 10-15 min walk downhill which is good! Also very close to the monorail which can take you to Darling Harbour. We booked on Expedia which had a deal that was third night stay free which meant we got the room rate down to $213 per night which wasnâ€™t bad, I had to hunt around wotif etc and Expedia.co.nz seemed to be the only one running that special. David Jones food court, just over the road from the Castlereagh St exit has great variety of food to light dinners, fruit etc. We used some of my husbandâ€™s Starwood points to upgrade to Club Class (normally $50 per person per day)and it was well worth itYou get access to the club lounge, a light breakfast and also the canapÃ©s and drinks, as mentioned by other reviewers. The view is spectacular and the lounge very clubby and luxurious to be in. . (Although I would recommend getting Club lounge upgrade for some of your stay and make one day where you eat in the Brasserie as the breakfast buffet there is truly spectacular, albeit expensive at $40.) The things I like the most about the Sheraton on the Park are: Central location to shops and transport Extra large rooms and luxury fit out Great service, we have always been treated very well as SPG members Great bed, the Sheraton sweet sleeper, with beautiful cotton sheets Great buffet in the evening, the crÃ¨me brulee is to die for. Club lounge option Free internet in the lobby, though hotel computers are occupied a lot Even the lighting in the mirrors in the bathrooms are very flattering and make you feel very glamorous ï�Š One thing I did notice for the area is that the Westfield juggernaut is in action building a huge shopping mall which is around the Centrepoint tower. It is apparently going to take 3 years and theyâ€™re 1.5 years into it. I heard it would have an airport connection. You canâ€™t notice any of the building going on from the hotel but I just canâ€™t help but hope it doesnâ€™t jeopardise some of the wonderful streets of shops and arcades around the Sheraton area, it would be such a shame. I find those Westfields all so much the same. Anyway thatâ€™s just an aside. Go for the Sheraton on the Park itâ€™s great.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: KateF20
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I spent the last week of May in Sydney for our honeymoon and had a fantastic time! We stayed at the Sheraton on the Park, which was beautiful, and spent our first day exploring the city. We recommend taking a Harbor cruise. The restaurants along the Harbor are expensive but worth a splurge. We went on a Hunter Valley vineyard tour that made for a lovely day. Finally, we took a day trip to the breathtaking Blue Mountains. It was a phenomenal, romantic trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and convenience.”
Reviews.Author: purplepiscean
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton on the Park for a week, and found it very comfortable, breakfast and dinner buffets were excellent (if expensive), but quality of room service food was not as good as expected. My room was spacious, and I loved the extra space of a dressing room. For a week long stay, this was great as it kept suitcases etc well out of sight. The hotel is very convenient for shopping, being practically next door to the fabulous shopping that Sydney has to offer. Staff are friendly, helpful and professional. GIven it is in the heart of the city, the rooms were very quiet. My only gripe with this hotel is the cost of internet to the room... far too expensive. This should be free as it is in many UK hotels. Overall, would recommend for comfort and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: AgaveArizona
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were stranded in Sydney for one night due to an airline delay, and we made a quick choice to stay at Sheraton on the Park due to its location and reviews on TripAdvisor. We both really enjoyed our stay and would stay there again. It was very easy to get to via the train (just a 1-2 minute walk from the St. James station). The hotel and our room was beautiful, everything was very clean, and the staff was very very friendly. Plus it was a quick 10-15 minute walk down to the Opera House and the Bridge.. We had a great evening checking out the city, having drinks and dinner, and catching some live music. The hotel made for a really great night being "stranded"!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Experience”
Reviews.Author: Marylexus
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Sheraton on the Park for 3 nights in September to attend a family wedding in Sydney and it was a wonderful experience. The Staff were extremely friendly and efficient and simply could not have been more helpful. My room was very large with a super king bed and walk in dressing room. There was no view but it was not expected at the price I paid. The food in the bar and dining room was excellent. Check in and check out could not have been more efficient. the concierge organised a hair appointment in a flash( I could not get one the previous day). The Location is perfect, opposite Hyde Park beside David Jones and within walking distance of the Opera House

Reviews.Title: “Potentially Ruined Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: KitWill
Reviews.Content: I recently booked my parents (who are in their 70's) a short trip to Sydney from Adelaide, they don't get away very often at all and my Mum recently had to cut short a trip to Melbourne to see my brother and his children when a neighbour back home died, so they needed a bit of a treat. The hotel was all paid for, but I called the hotel beforehand to firstly, check that they had the booking and secondly, to inform them that my parents wouldn't have a credit card at all when checking in, would that be a problem? No, that wouldn't be a problem at all, everything was fine. I spoke to my parents earlier today to see if they had arrived safely and was everything OK. My Mum said they everything was great, the room was lovely, both very happy....except that there was a bit of a problem when they were checking in that left her a bit flabbergasted. On arrival at the hotel my parents were asked for their credit card, when they explained they didn't have one, they were asked for a cash deposit of $300 per night for 3 nights, $900 AUD in total. Basically everything they had on them to enjoy the next three days. When they explained that they didn't really have that kind of money to spare, that they could give them $300 for that night and then try and work something out, they were told that was hotel policy, nothing they could do, they needed $900 AUD asap, deal with it basically. My poor parents have had to call my sister in Adelaide, who had to spend the next hour, running around scanning credit cards and photo ID to fax to the extremely unhelpful girl, Catherine, at reception to secure their booking, as they wouldn't take my sister's credit card details over the phone. I feel so sorry for my parents that this was the start of their little trip away, they tried not to let it bother them, but they were so embarrassed by the whole situation. They just weren't expecting that reception, especially since I had told them that I had called the hotel, checked everything, and they were good to go. My sister and brother-in-law even organised a special car to pick them up from the airport, it was meant to be a real treat. I have since called the hotel to sort the situation out and to thank them so much for making my parents welcome to Sydney so memorable for all the wrong reasons. My Mum even asked me not to call the hotel to complain because she was mortified, that they would try and sort it out. Why? Why when I rang the hotel to check this very fact was I not told that a cash deposit would be required, a cash deposit of $300 AUD no less, per night, a ridiculous amount of money, more than I think I paid for the room!!! May I recommend that hotel staff may be do some retraining on dealing with people that aren't on business trips; that aren't regular travellers; that don't have credit cards and learn how to treat their GUESTS with humanity and respect. Carl, the duty manager I spoke to was most helpful in sorting everything out, and strangely enough, was able to take my credit card details over the phone as security, after all my sister's running around scanning and having to go to the post office to fax her details! The rest were as good as useless by the sound of things. The deposit my parents paid was returned to them whilst they were in their room, I was hoping they may also have had the courtesy and compassion to bring them a bottle of wine or something by way of apology and to get their trip back on track, but no. My husband and I now live in London and both work in television, news and current affairs, maybe I should have mentioned that! I don't care how central this hotel is or how lovely the rooms are, I would never recommend a hotel that treated two people this way.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Victoria5
Reviews.Content: While staying in Sydney, our family encounter a few bumps in the road -- lost luggage and an inconsistency with our room rate. The hotel was fabulous in helping us resolve both problems. They couldn't have been any nicer! We really enjoyed our time here. Our family had two connecting rooms, which provided ample space for all of us. We frequently used the free computers in business center to plan our daily outings. The pool/gym has to die for views of the city and the location can't be beat. You are across the street from a beautiful park and can walk all the way down to the Circular Quay through parks. My children are still talking about the breakfast buffet. Our rate included breakfast and I would definitely recommend booking that package. We filled up on all sorts of freshly made goodies that kept us full throughout the day.

Reviews.Title: “The Night Before the Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Lark01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my friend, who was getting married the next day, and her teenage step-daughter. My friend had a suite with terrace and I had a city room - zero view but large and comfortable with a great walk-in dressing room. We held a drinks party in the bar for a number of girlfriends which seemed to bemuse the staff initially but eventually they got into the swing and looked after us well. The hotel provides everything you would expect from the brand and from a five star property and of course you can be as anonymous as you like. Hotels like this are not meant to have character and charm; they are there to provide comfort and efficiency. On this basis, the Sheraton on the Park doesn't disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to be in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: ashida_alain
Reviews.Content: We stayed only 1 night in this hotel. The rooms are very comfortable and spacious. The hotel is well positioned in the city to be able to move around easily and have access to restaurants and great tourist spots. Breakfast food was absolutely nice with a great variety and food quality that can be qualified as premium.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: Sydney2for2
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Sheraton for a birthday treat. As always, the staff and facilities were excellent. Stayed in room 2101 which is a City View room - not much to see except the office blocks across the street but still the room itself is very comfortable and modern. Breakfast was included, and as with our last stay, hot, fresh and plentiful. make sure you include brekky in your stay - defineately worth the extra $$. Cant wait till our next time :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: bansorge4
Reviews.Content: We were really pleased with this hotel & the concierge was extremely knowledgeable. We enjoyed the restaurants and nightlife that he suggested & were also happy with the room service. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to expectations..”
Reviews.Author: Charlie1745
Reviews.Content: I was quite disappointed when i arrived at the Sheraton in Sydney but this may have been because i had arrived from Hong Kong where i stayed at the Island Shangri-La which is a great Hotel and a high standard to live up to. There is nothing particularly bad about this hotel, it is just that there is nothing particularly great either. It is centrally located in Sydney which is good for getting around but if you want to spend time down by the Opera House or the Bridge it is probably better to stay somewhere near Circular key or the Rocks. The hotel felt a little old fashioned for my tastes, although the business suite has recently been refurbished and was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, well appointed hotel room with beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: HolidayLover006
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton on the Park for 1 night. We booked 'a suite for a room' on expedia.com which included the use of the Executive Lounge on 21st floor. The hotel room was fabulous, very spacious, with desk area, large lounge area, then thru double doors to large bedroom with very comfy king size bed. Then thru more doors to dressing area, then the lovely bathroom. Great room, very happy, only complaint - the carpet was quite marked, obviously had a spill of red wine or something and didn't come clean. The carpet did downgrade the room a little. We did call Room Service for some ice on our return at about 11pm and then again at 11.30pm to remind them. It finally turned up at 11.50pm. I would definitely include the Executive Lounge again in a package. We had drinks and canapes from 5 till 7.15pm when we left to go to the concert. Then, breakfast next morning, newspapers, proper coffee, etc and the view was magnificent overlooking the Park, then the city and the Harbour - beautiful !! The parking was a bit expensive - $50, but I suppose it is Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in central Sydney”
Reviews.Author: DCBLEGAL
Reviews.Content: Staff are excellent - arrived early morning flight from HKG and room made available asap. Airport transfer booked via concierge very smooth. Connecting rooms are limited so if staying with young kids, prebook (as we did). Good size rooms. Valet parking bit steep price (A$49). Breakfast buffet very good. Health club pool and chaning rooms a bit cold and extra to pay if not for example SPG Gold member.

Reviews.Title: “Great locattion and service”
Reviews.Author: peeam
Reviews.Content: Its location at the edge of business district and in front of Hyde Park, is as central as it can get in Sydney. Both Darling Harbor and Circular Quay are walkable distance and Pitt street shopping is just behind the hotel. The room was very comfortable (wife wants to buy it for retirement) and the service, including the lounge, was excellent. Get a room high up and the view of the Hyde Park and the harbor is terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: Travel159549
Reviews.Content: Wow, this was the best hotel we stayed in while in Australia, which included more than three different hotels in Sydney and three others in the Cairns area. This is a well-deserved five star hotel, and can sometimes be had for AUD180 (which for this quality of a hotel is very good). If the price goes higher, the hotel must be compared against other cheaper options that, while not as nice, are respectfully close enough to not justify the cost difference. The rooms are very impressive, and we didn't even have a park view (we looked across at a nearby office building, which had construction starting at about 8am). Nonetheless, the room was spotless, included lots of large mirrors (which made it seem even bigger), and the expensive looking woodwork had a very 'rich' feel. There is free internet on three computers in the lobby (a nice bonus), automatic night shades to block the sun, wide open and very impressive bathroom, and excellent service. Unfortunately we only stayed one night as the prices for the other nights exceeded AUD200. We would definitely stay again, if within our budget! The location is great, directly across the street from the St. James train stop and the lovely Hyde Park. The fitness center was an extra fee.

Reviews.Title: “After 15 years still the best & most consistent 5 Star in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: AllanCanberra
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Sheraton on the Park on many occassions and in my opinion it is Sydney most consistent 5 Star hotel. Regardless if you are staying in Park View or City View room they are all a generous size and feature comfortable beds, black marble bathrooms, ergonomic work chairs and desks, walk-in-robes and plasma televisions. Also be sure to try the buffett breakfast at least once, it has the best variety of any hotel I know of. Sheraton on the Park is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous room with heating issues”
Reviews.Author: marigo173
Reviews.Content: Overall, a great hotel in a beautiful location, facing Hyde Park in the heart of Sydney. Sydney's major museums are just a few minutes walk and there's good transportation links to the harbour. Room rates and hotel restaurants are quite pricey but it's well worth it if you want to enjoy staying in a nice estate. Unfortunately, my room had a major heating problem that maintenance didn't manage to restore fully during my stay. I left a notice on the review form and the manager of the hotel wrote to me offering a complimentary upgrade to club level for my next stay. Besides that, the room was sheer pleasure with a divine bed, a nice large desk and a luxurious huge marble bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Executive green scrambled eggs!”
Reviews.Author: Britboyscott
Reviews.Content: I am at the end of a 4 night Executive Club City side room. First time back at this hotel for years, and I spend alot of time in Sydney. Rooms are comfortable, but certainly shadowed by a close office tower (and I am on the 16th of 21 floors).I wouldn't choose a city side again for this reason (no light) and have booked an Executive Park room for next week (non refundable or I would probably not return) Few faults with the room - bathroom sliding doors do not close (one of the double doors doesn't move), shower head has only one strength (not strong) and is either boiling hot or cold, also leaks to the floor and the systern doesn't settle. Club staff are generally very good, apart from one very loud female staff member (morning, you're welcome, morning, your welcome etc etc etc etc) who likes to replenish cutlery, drinks and food when people are standing in front of the specific area This morning at breakfast the buffet was boasting green (mouldy looking) scrambled eggs. No apology, just bewilderment! I don't think I can eat eggs again!

Reviews.Title: “I keep going back again and again!”
Reviews.Author: My_great_odyssey
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton on the Park is one of my favourite Hotels to stay in. Over the years I've stayed there well over a dozen times and always without incident. The Hotel staff are friendly, the rooms not just monster-sized, but very clean, they always have robes, the Mini-bar has a good selection, the location is fantastic and generally, everything lives up to or exceeds expectation. The hotel doesn't pretend to be anything it isn't and the rooms don't have any fancy tricks to make them seem larger than a shoebox (I'm talking about you, Sydney Hilton). With the Sheraton on the Park you get a good old fashioned 5 star hotel, with great service, baggage assistance and a smile. They'll hail a Taxi for you in the morning and they leave a Newspaper outside your door in the morning. None of this is revolutionary, but when you travel as often as I do, having this consistently high level of service is not just refreshing, it's highly appreciated. So well done Sheraton, this is a world-class example of how to set an expectation with your customers and keep them coming back and staying happy.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: creekgirl01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton for 9 nights and had a wonderful experience. The rooms are extremely comfortable. I loved the blackout curtains that can be brought down at night. The bathroom is appointed with beautiful black marble with a separate bath and shower. The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. The concierge was able to book a ticket to a show that was sold out for months. Everything you asked for was taken care of within mintutes. The business center in the lobby could use a few more laptops/computers because they were always busy. Internet is not included in your rate and is 25.99 Australian Dollars per day, which is expensive. Otherwise, nothing but good things to say about this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from Hell!”
Reviews.Author: phoensam
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many 5 star hotels around the world (The Hazelton in Toronto, the Encore & Bellagio in Vegas etc), and many less than 5 star hotels, and can say this is the worst hotel experience I've ever had. I checked in after a very long flight from Canada, and seriously jetlagged and having been awake for about 40 hours straight, I wanted to go to bed early. I was in my room at about 6pm and noticed it was very cold, despite the fact I had the heat turned up full. I got on a chair and confirmed the vents were sending out cold air. I called downstairs at 6:40pm to advise of the problem and told them I wanted to go to sleep....they assured me someone would be up to fix it soon. About an hour later, and struggling to stay awake, I called again. A half hour after that, I called again. About 9pm an engineer showed up, tried to fix it, and in the process a terrible burning smell filled the room. A housekeeping staff member was sent up with an air purifier to remove the burning smell from the room. At about 10pm, I was advised it could not be fixed and I would have to change rooms. I had been awake 46 hours straight at that point, had 5 very heavy bags, and told them I could not physically manage a room change and asked them to bring me extra blankets. The next morning, they organized my room change....I re-packed my bags, and when I was in the middle of dragging them between the rooms, I was locked out of the first room and had to arrange to be let back in to remove the rest of my stuff. Finally, I got myself into the new room, unpacked, started making some phone calls, had the heat up high (I'd frozen the night before), but after a couple hours noticed the room was very cold....I got on a chair, checked the vent, and noticed cold air was pumping out. I called downstairs again....another engineer was sent up, he confirmed the heat was broken in this room too and would take hours to fix, and I had to move rooms again (3 rooms in less than 24 hours). When I complained to the manager, I was given a comped breakfast and some other small credits (I believe $77 in total)....when I said I was still not happy and would have preferred to have had some sleep, the manager sent up a tea tray with oranges. A few days ago (I've now stayed 9 nights), after discovering that the SPG rate was more expensive than the expedia rate on a particular night, I approached the front desk, advised them of this and asked whether or not SPG had a Best Rates Guaranteed program....I was told they did not and that I would have to book through Expedia to get that rate, which I did. Every day I checked who had the better rate, and for 3 nights I booked through Expedia. Today I found out that SPG do have a Best Rates Guaranteed program, and that the rate should have been matched by SPG and I should have received 2000 points each time Expedia had a better rate. When I called SPG to complain, they basically told me it was too late to do anything about it and they would contact the hotel manager so that it didn't happen to other people. I went to see the front desk manager (a woman) and by way of explanation, was told by her that the junior staff don't know about these things. I told her that was no excuse and they should have asked someone more senior rather than tell me the program didn't exist. She wanted to know if I had kept screen shots of the rates...I said "of course not", as I had been told there was no best rates guranteed program. She said all she could do was tell another manager who might contact me later today. Now it looks like I'll have to lug my luggage to another hotel. So much for valuing a guest who has stayed 9 consecutive nights in your hotel! Re the rooms, they are ok and tastefully furnished. Housekeeping has been great, and the staff at the breakfast buffet are the very very best! I've been eating at that buffet for about 10 years, but won't be staying in the hotel again. I have stayed in many 5 star hotels, worked at the Four Seasons many years ago, and what I have encountered here is not even close to what I'd expect from 5 star. This is not the first problem I've had with Sheratons....after a stay at the Toronto Sheraton (separate review will be posted shortly), a couple of months later I noticed my credit card had been charged for 3 consecutive nights and meals, at a time when I was on the other side of the country. I assumed someone had stolen my card number and was using it there unlawfully....I contacted the hotel to advise them and had to cancel my card and have a new one couriered over, at my expense, from Australia (I had no access to money for days while I waited for the new card). Eventually they admitted their mistake (not stolen, just a stupid accounting department) and the charges were reversed and I was given 20 000 points. I was not reimbursed my courier expenses etc, which were over $100. A friend of mine had the same thing happen to him when he stayed at the Sheraton 4 points in Arizona....he is still waiting for a reply from the hotel many months later.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: TITraveller
Reviews.Content: In years past, the Hilton Sydney (pre-two year refurbishment) was our venue of choice. Located on George Street, it was handy for the bus to the airport and for shopping and so forth. But as time went on tastes and needs change - the two-year refurb meant stays at the Le Meridien (now the Amora Jamison) and the Sofitel Wentworth and more trips to Melbourne instead. So, would a change of scenery be a good thing ? Indeed it was. In fact,, I might go so far as to say this might be my preferred base. No, not because of the opulent marble - that's a part of it. No, not because the room was a big as an apartment and the bathroom was huge - that was a part of it. Nor the massive plasma TV, the comfortable beds, the view of the park from the room (it was only the 8th floor). No, it is a short distance from St. James station (so you can get there in 15 minutes from the airport), from David Jones and the developing Westfield Sydney, from the QVB, from the Galeries Victoria and other important places. It is convenient as well as being well-appointed. And that is why I like this hotel very, very much. (But you need not dine in - the food's ok but you can get better for more elsewhere).

Reviews.Title: “Nice location on park, great club lounge”
Reviews.Author: kazkid7
Reviews.Content: This review is particularly relevant for SPG platinum members. In May, I stayed at the Four Points, Sheraton, and Westin in Sydney. I was upgraded to a suite at each of the hotels. The Four Points is the worst of the three, but is cheaper generally too so is good value. The Sheraton has the best club lounge, which they just renovated. Its huge, modern, and classy with floor to ceiling windows that have great views over the park. The design in the rooms is a bit dated for my taste compared to the Westin, but you really can't lose between the Sheraton and the Westin. Both very close to eachother.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 1307boss
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the sheraton on the park recently for a "catch up with friends" weekend. We found the location excellent though that was all. The hotel was over booked and over crowded. I was surprised they do not do a turn down service in the evenings! The staff in my opinion were over worked and under staff as they were helpful though rushed. There was a line up for breakfast the next morning that we did not bother with instead we opted to walk to China Town for Yum Cha. The view over the park is impressive as with the gym facilities. Bottom line is this is a large corporate hotel in the middle of the city. Nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel overlooking park ;-)”
Reviews.Author: sti5brigade
Reviews.Content: Arrived from Mumbai for a long weekend for a Monday Business meeting hotel is well located 10-15 minutes walk from the harbour front area Rooms nice, nothing lavish or spacious with fast internet connection for free Food choice good, though breakfast times were a bit ridiculous - enormous queues over the weekend with all the Tourists Drink prices quite high, Sydney itself seemed an expensive area (from UK exchange rate poor at $2 Aus to the Â£ but even at say $2.40 it would have been expensive) Quite a posh hotel, with a nice gym on the top level, no views as such just looks onto the other buildings Sydney itself is great - plenty to see and do in this area. Make sure you get a 15 minute taxi to Bavers (sp?) pavilion - lovely restaurant overlooking small but quaint beach Watsons Bay cliff top area superb, but you must avoid the fish and chip place there (Doyles)- truly awful, greasy oven chips and poor quality fish I've been to Sydney before and much preferred the Budget, Novotel for its views of the Harbour area - the room I had in the Sheraton was an obscured view of the park, which to be honest is nothing special anyway So if I come again will probably chose a different hotel - then again the hotel was fine and I would recommend it overall

Reviews.Title: “Not all 'park view' rooms have full views of Hyde Park”
Reviews.Author: SFTraveler10
Reviews.Content: Overall I give the Sheraton on the Park good marks. If you opt to pay extra for the â€œpark viewâ€� rooms make sure you insist on actually getting a room with a complete view of Hyde Park. The faÃ§ade of the hotel facing the park is really more of a â€œUâ€� shape in some areas so several rooms which are marketed as a â€œpark viewâ€� rooms really have more of a view directly across to the rooms on the other side of the â€œU.â€� Yes, you can put your head up to the window and see part of the park but I think it is probably not a fair proposition to sell those inward-facing rooms as true â€œpark viewâ€� rooms. Much like hotels on a beach perhaps a middle category of â€œpartial park viewâ€� room would be a good idea for this hotel in addition to â€œpark viewâ€� and â€œcity sideâ€� which seem to be only two room categories. Looking at the 15th floor (I donâ€™t know if all floors are the same) hereâ€™s how it seemed to break out: Full direct park view: 1512-1516, 1530-1533 Partially obstructed park view: 1517-1520, 1526-1529 Facing rooms on opposite side of hotel: 1521-1525 If you are paying for a â€œpark viewâ€� room, and the view is important to you, I would suggest not arriving too late in the evening only to be stuck with â€œwhatever is leftâ€� in the room category. Chances are you will be disappointed. The Executive Club Lounge was very nice and the staff helpful and friendly. The lounge is on the 21st floor of the hotel yet not all â€œclub levelâ€� rooms are actually on floor 21. The other club level floors appear to be 15 and 16. Card key access is required to move between floors in the hotel and also to enter the club. The club hours are 7am to 9pm with complimentary cocktails from 5:00p-7:30p. The breakfast selection could use some improvement; there is traditional continental breakfast fare and three hot items served daily (the hotel calls this service â€œContinental Plus.â€�) The problem is the three hot items were virtually the same every day with only minor differences in presentation. It would not seem to be too much trouble to mix-up at least the hot item selection so guests staying 2 or more nights donâ€™t see the same thing each morning. There is free WiFi access in the lounge (it costs AUD$29.95 per 24 hours in the room) and the club staff were most pleasant. The health club, on floor 22 of the hotel, was well equipped and complimentary to Starwood Preferred Guest members. Housekeeping at this hotel was very efficient and, even as a continuing guest, there was never any trouble getting our room cleaned when it was most convenient for us. With service cutbacks so prevalent in the industry I have found that, if you are not checking out, it does seem housekeeping comes later and later in the day after the rooms being turned-over are first cleaned. I did find it unusual for a hotel of this level that you have call each day to request evening turndown service but, once the call was made, the turndown service was prompt. Also, if you want a newspaper you need to put a card on your door indicating you would like a paper delivered in the morning. Again, I was a bit puzzled by these extra-required steps which are â€œautomaticâ€� at most similarly situated business properties. Needless to say the first day we missed both turndown service AND our morning paper (not a big dealâ€¦ but worth a mention here in case these services are important to you). A few notes on the actual room: the exterior windows do not open at all (not even a small crack for fresh air), the shower heads were high and had very good pressure, and the HVAC system was quiet and efficient. The TV has very limited channels but does include the CNNI, BBC World, CNBC and the Australian national networks. I would say this hotel is an excellent choice for both business and pleasure. The location, slightly away from the hustle of the Circular Quay and directly across the street from the St. James train station, is ideal to be â€œin the actionâ€� for a visit to Sydney but not too much â€œin the actionâ€� where you have to put up with tour busses and cruise ships. Enjoy! â€“ SFTraveler10

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a city visit- super location, wonderful service and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: dougly
Reviews.Content: Great fitness center with treadmills, eliptical machines, stationary bikes, rowing machine, new strength training machines and limited free weights. Wonderful staff. Great breakfast (included in our package rate). Room was modern and well furnished, but I'm not sure about the cleanliness. There was daily housekeeping service to keep the room tidy, but I suspect there may have been bed bugs. Best attribute of the Sheraton was its location. One block from pedestrian mall part of Pitt Street and on the other side, across the street from Hyde Park. Very easy walk to Circular Quay, Surrey Hills, Darlinghurst and Darling Harbor attractions. Free-of-charge internet terminals located in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Well located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lorelaina
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in the Sheraton on the park, our room was spacious and nice, probably a bit old and not as modern as other refurnished sheraton but it was ok, nothing to complain. The location is very good, 10 minutes walking from the Opera House, 10 minutes from Darling Harbour...you don't need to take any public transport if you want and you are just in front of the Hyde Park, so it's nice going there for a stroll. Breakfast is quite good although a bit the same every day. Our stay was our honeymoon and we expected a kind os upgrade of present at the check in, probably they are more into business travellers. There are some PC with free internet at the business center, so you don't need to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, just something missing”
Reviews.Author: Willjd
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel opposite Hyde Park and a 10 minute walk away from Circular quay through the shopping streets. Rooms were very big and roomy, bathroom especially. Got a great rate through the sale that was on when we were looking to book so very happy with the price. I would say though that its a business hotel and everything is geared towards that. Its very hard to describe as the rooms were big and plush with big bed, big TV, a desk and sofa chair to relax in but it was all very impersonal. Not sure why but i just felt that everyone who worked there was on autopilot and every questios asked had the same text book response. Not that there were any problems, well aprt from eth room key to get to our floor and into our room just suddenly stopped working on the second day we were there (this was both cards not just one) and then on check out they tried to charge us for some nuts and juice from the minibar that we never used and had been replaced by housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great for lone travellers”
Reviews.Author: S_G.UK
Reviews.Content: This was a kind of solo holiday with a bit of work thrown in. I needed to be central, and usually prefer to stay in smaller/boutique hotels. But I did a lot of digging around and decided I needed a hotel that was pretty central to everything, so I wouldnt be trekking around in less reputable parts of town, or more suburban areas, alone at night, etc. Always plenty of people around, taxis etc but without being stuck in some Business District. This met my expectations - it is opposite the lovely leafy Hyde Park; across the park is the Art Gallery and then further along the gardens open out onto the coastline. I jogged every morning through the park, up to Lady Macquarie's Chair, along the seawall of the Botanic Gardens, up to the Opera House, around it and back through the Gardens themselves. What a way to start the day! On the day it rained, I used the very nice hotel gym on the 22nd floor, where you can stand on the balcony and take in the view while you have your well-earned post-workout drink... I arrived early in the mornign and the staff were great, giving me access to the health suite to have a shower, etc and stored my bags for me. When I returned much later that afternoon my bags were in my room. The room was great- exactly as you would expect from a large reputable 'chain' hotel in this part of the world. I travel a lot in Asia and this was on a par with a decent similar hotel in HKG or SIN. Large room with all the usuals - nice llarge comfy bed, desk, etc. Decent walk-in wardrobe. Lovely big bathroom with separate walk-in shower and lots of space. Great space to call home for 6 days. I got a fab deal - would never have stayed there otherwise. 3 nights for price of 2. So my 6 night stay came in really reasonable. I didnt eat in the hotel - I found Sydney to offer a fantastic, diverse selection of great food places and very inexpensive to eat out. Drinks in the hotel bar were quite expensive, but sure, arent they all? Bambini Wine bar right next to the hotel - turn riight as you leave the foyer - is a great little place to hang out if you want to get out of the hotel but you dont want to venture too far. Lovely selectoin of wine and great vibe. Not sure it was at all cheaper than the hotel, but the environment/surroundings very nice indeed! Similarly, I would skip out the back door from the lobby to get my coffee and muffin the morning and bring it back to do my emails. Loads of small independent coffee shops at the base of the tower blocks in the street behind. Like all the best hotels, the wifi connection in the main lobby and bar areas of the hotel was free, so I was variously joined of an evening by fellow travellers who've also figured out that a short trip in the lift with their laptop can save them a small fortune. Why do hotels continue to insist on charging for in-room wifi?! Staff at the concierge, etc were also very helpful and friendly. I didnt really use any other facilities - although, word of warning - a friend from out of town left their car parked in the hotel garage overnight - from about 11pm til about 8am and they tired to charge him about $100. He declined to do so, obviously! Best to query it.... Sydney itself - what can i say? As a single travelling female, I felt pretty safe most of the time, except in the Kings Cross area, etc where I felt a little nervous when alone, but fine when with colleagues. Rest of the time - down near the harbour and wandering around the various areas of town, I felt very comfortable. I loved The Rocks. Dont forget the fab little markets that are on around town (great locations for purchasing unqiue momentoes) are only there on sat and sun - so plan your time accordingly! And get on some ferries and get out further afield - forget the touristy ones. Im sure they're great, but I used the network of 'commuter' ferries to get around and visit Manly etc. Great way to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “Get Breakfast in Your Rate”
Reviews.Author: zoshi
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in central location. Old school hospitality. Breakfast is fabulous buffet so try and get a rate that includes full breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: bookworm720
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last month for a conference for four nights. I'm a SPG member so I had a great room on the 17th floor, which was very spacious and facing the park. My sister and I LOVED the comfortable beds, and they helped us get over jetlag. The room and bathroom were clean. The digital safe in the closet didn't work when we got there, but the hotel replaced it immediately when it couldn't be fixed, and we used it throughout our stay. There's high speed internet for a fee, but bring your own wire. My one gripe about the room was the bathroom doors. They slide together to shut, but they don't close completely--leaving a half inch open gap. There's a business center (a few computers with a b/w printer), but I needed some presentations printed in color ASAP. I talked to Cameron (manager on duty) and he printed them for me for a fee. Staffs were nice to us and answered all my questions. The hotel is in a great location and most attractions are walking distance. We walked to Darling Harbour in 10-15 minutes, and the Sydney Opera House wasn't too far either.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: born4hotels
Reviews.Content: It was my first time to Sydney, and this hotel was great. It was an easy walk to some of the tourist sites, and I really enjoyed jogging in the park in the morning. I'd stay here again next time I'm in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel - Great location”
Reviews.Author: Fourkiwis
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton on the Park for a long weekend away without the kids. This was the perfect hotel for us with beautiful, spacious, quiet and luxurious rooms in a superb location in the heart of Sydney. Walk to Darling Harbour or Circular Quay, beautiful Hyde Park across the road and shopping just around the corner. We got a deal off their own website ( stay 3/ pay 2 ) so all up this hotel was hard to fault. Would definitely use again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place but need to work on service”
Reviews.Author: dingyadi
Reviews.Content: Terrific location and room and would stay here again when I go to Sydney, but they need to work on the service a bit, it wasn't what I would have expected from a Sheraton. The hotel is opposite Hyde Park and I walked all over the place, it is wonderfully central. My room was lovely and the bathroom was huge. I initially scoffed at the Sheraton blurb about their special 'sweetsleeper bed' but then was smitten with the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. The electric blinds were also great. On the downside the service was not great. I got sent away by a surly reception staffer when I arrived as the room wasn't ready . After a couple of hours I got into my room but then my bags had vanished and there was no-one answering the reception or service desk phones for a considerable time. After I had got through I had to ring back again as my bags still didn't arrive. It wasn't really anything major but there is just a lack of attention to service. That being said, I loved the room and location and the price was really reasonable so would defintely go back. Avoid room service too - they put a delivery charge on top of the already high prices - $15 all up for a $1 yoghurt is a bit ridiculous

Reviews.Title: “5-star hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: bertman815
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife & 17 month old son for 8 days at the hotel. We arrived early at 10AM and didn't expect any room to be ready. They had one ready in 30 min and held our bags while we tool a stroll in the beautiful Hyde park across the street. The room was huge, with a flat screen TV, DVD player, separate bath and shower, big bathroom, walk-in closet, refrigerator (no microwave), and safe. They even delivered a complimentary crib for our baby and power transformer to convert to US voltage for our use throughout our stay. Bed was one of the most comfortable ever. Free newspaper every morning. We had a city view with a view of the Sydney Tower. We used the rooftop indoor swimming pool and spa, which has awesome views of the city. Free internet PCs and wireless in the lobby area. The hotel is in a central location, walking distance to Chinatown, shopping areas, Circular Quay for the ferries, the Rocks, Opera House, and Botanical gardens. The concierge was extremely helpful in giving us directions to many places and best way to get there on foot or by bus or trolley. Woolworth is only 2 blocks away, where you can buy cheap water and groceries. The only thing that went wrong was that our room key card was demagnetized multiple times and I had to go to front desk to get a replacement. Overall, we had a great stay and couldn't be more satisfied. It is great for young children. The entire staff was very nice and helpful. It is truly 5-star.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL, SOME SMALL IMPROVEMENT NEEDED”
Reviews.Author: Kramax
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel, very clean and staff are very nice, ie room service and front desk. I stayed in a city view room to compare it to the park view rooms. I actually preferred this room. It seemed bigger and the windows had wooden plantation shutters which made the room quite attractive. The rooms are a min. 40sq and the bathroom was huge and modern. The only drawbacks are the towels, standard size and only 2 in the room. For a hotel of this class, I would expect towels of bath sheet size. The other drawback was the charges for room service meals. Food was lovely, but so overpriced, even for Sydney! Add the service charge and tip and you are paying over $60 for a steak, ironice since a top Sydney restaurant was reviewed the week of my stay for charging a $58 steak! Television was trying, takes ages to change the channel and the cable channels are sparse and aimed at men (sport). Other than that, this is a great hotel which I highly recommend. The king size bed is sublime!

Reviews.Title: “A four day visit to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: jambomccotter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on our trip to New Zealand and Australia. Hotel is impressive to look at, and first impressions are good. We stayed in an executive room on the 21st floor, and the room was clean, and spacious with a superb bathroom area. However, we booked the executive club package, and that was the big let down. We are frequent visitors to Mandarin Oriental hotels, which should in theory be of a similar standard to the Sheraton on the Park. In reality, they are day and night. I would suggest that if the Sheraton wishes to maintain its 5* status, which is already dubious in my opinion, the senior mgt team should spend some time in a few of the Oriental hotels to find out how a proper 5* hotel should operate. The breakfast selection in the club room is very poor, and the evening food selection to accompany evening drinks was also pretty devoid of imagination. I would also suggest that the club could do with more staff, as service was at best slow.
