As an aside, I would suggest fitting a door to the kitchen area in the lounge, so guests cannot hear the staff swearing or complaining about the guests in the lounge. We have also stayed at the Radisson Hotel in Sydney, and if we were to return to Sydney I suspect we would return there as overall it was a better experience. In summary, I would rate our stay here as acceptable, but I would not rush to stay at another Sheraton Hotel after this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jimbo1000001
Reviews.Content: This is an impressive hotel, starting with the expansive lobby & trendy lower level restaurants. The pool with skylight looking up at Centrepoint Tower is great (although the spa is below average), and the gym has good quality equipment with nice views over Hyde Park. We ordered room service one night, which was good quality. Unfortunately the downside is that it isn't cheap - breakfast prices meant that we ate out every day, and mini bar prices are (as expected) over the top. Also, a word of warning - the 20% off deal which is currently on is great value - but it's for a very small room...ok for one person on business, but for 3 of us (including small child) too small - so we upgraded to a larger room - still no Hyde Park view, but comfortable & good quality nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Great value package - room, b/fast and parking.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisandDave0
Reviews.Content: We chose a great value package with bed, breakfast and parking for the time we stayed (1 night) and our parking was validated for a bit longer to give us extra shopping time in Pitt street. Late checkout (midday) was also extremely handy. Breakfast buffet was of decent quality with lots of fresh fruit and a wide selection of hot/cold food. The location of the Sheraton is also fantastic, a two minute walk from the main city shopping area and the park opposite provides a great view. We didn't choose room service for dinner - although it was very tempting. Instead, a 10 minute walk to Darling Harbour was perfect. All up - a top stay. WIll definately stay again when next in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton on the Park - Impressed”
Reviews.Author: BarryEmm
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sheraton on the Park for 2 nights for a conference/business trip. Room was excellent - large and clean with superb fittings etc. I suspect it may have been recently renovated. Room was fitted out with Large Flat Screen LCD TV, corner couch and large desk which was great for doing work in the room. The bathroom was sensational. Large again and fitted out with dark marble. Huge shower and bath and everyone was spotlessly clean. I used in room dining for breakfast and dinner. The service and quality was great - in house dining is always at a premium price point so expect steep prices for this service. Nevertheless, the food was excellent and served with a smile by efficient and very polite staff. (NB - stay away from the scrambled eggs if dining in room). Dinner and breakfast orders were delivered on time and food nice and hot. Check in/Check Out staff were also excellent. Attentive and courteous at all times. Didn't use the concierge so no feedback from me there. All in all a very enjoyable stay at Sheraton on the Park. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely deserves good reviews”
Reviews.Author: Seven_Continents
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 nights, a business trip with extra time for pleasure tacked on so I will review from both points of view. Location is excellent, close to the CBD but easy to hop to the suburbs to tour without a hassle. Hyde park is great for relaxing and it leads on to the Domain and the Botanic gardens for a great long walk or running path. You can end up on a hill overlooking the bay and the harbour bridge which is a nice treat to be out of the crowds on circular quay. There are plenty of basic and nicer places for quick or long breakfasts nearby, as well as easy access to the best Sydney has to offer. Upon check in I was told a request was put in to upgrade me if was unhappy with the present room as the hotel was full. I went up to my assigned room which was a corner room on the 20th floor, with windows across the whole room with views of the city, the park and the harbor. Since I'm only SPG gold, I didn't think I was going to get a suite, maybe a bigger room with less of a view so I immediately asked to keep the room for the entire stay. Staff were uniformly courteous, moving out of the way at elevators, talking in a pleasant tone of voice, offering assistance. The only point I'd make is like some previous posters, porters inside the lobby did not exactly jump to help. I had a large bag upon checkout and three people stood around and watched me carry it out to the entryway. The porter outside did jump to get me a taxi and load my bags though. The health club is not included if you don't have status or a high level rate. It is very nice with a pool, decent number of machines, views, lockers, steam and sauna. I treated myself to a massage and it was extremely well done. Room was as expected, larger then usual LCD TV, housekeeping pretty even but not perfect, i.e. got back at 4pm after being out all day and room was not clean. On the day of checkout I was asked if I wanted my room cleaned before I left which was a nice touch. Have stayed in two other hotels in the CBD of Sydney of about the same price point, Sheraton definately wins over both hotels which were both perfectly fine, just the Sheraton leaves a better impression.

Reviews.Title: “Mmmm.....”
Reviews.Author: annieNgeorge
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for 2 nights just before New Years. The hotel was OK - the room was quite large and everything seemed clean and nice. However, my memory of the stay was: (i) something in the bedsheets - could have been washing powder or something, resulted in some type of allergic rash. (ii) the electronic safe was faulty. We had followed all the instructions and locked a laptop and passports inside. However we couldn't open it. Subsequently, the repairman came up and despite all attempts, could not open it. He then had to call the firm who supplied the safe, for help. Byt this time it was around 9.30 - 10.00pm. The safe company said we had to wait another 1/2 hour...which after a flight and a long day, we decided to wait until the next morning. The next morning, we followed up with hotel staff and went out saying that they could leave the items with front desk once the safe was opened. On our return 2 hours later they said they couldn't give us the items as they were with the duty manager. After subsequent follow up, we found that the safe still hadn't been fixed....they asked us to wait a little longer. We spent another 1+ hour hanging around...what a waste of time. Eventually it was fixed and the hotel said there was an electronic fault and several guests had the same problem. That's the end of it - at check out, they charged the telephone calls to the safe company, to us! (of course refunded). The duty manager, can't remember her name, was quite good about it ...but the receptionist at checkout, was sooooo insistent we had made calls from the room and wouldn't listen. Fortunately the duty manager was there at the time. (iii) Staff service and lack of it (maybe we are used to service standards in Asia) - at check in, I guess we didn't look 'posh' enough so we had to wait and wait although there was staff member standing at the Starwood guest section doing nothing until some well dressed ladies appeared behind us and offered to serve them - at breakfast, it was nearly impossible to get a waiter/waitress - at checkout, we wanted to leave bags until we left for the airport. There were 4 staff at the conceierge desk - again...just chattering but couldn't be bothered to assist bar 1 When we went to get our bags, a very serious and snobby looking person (he looked like he was in charge as he was giving other staff orders on what /how to do things), after some time, asked if we needed help. He had some problems locating one of our items and then tried to blame blame my husband for not telling him it was a fragile item - which we had explained in the beginning and it was on the label - pretty bad for a manager who had been having a go at his team! oh...they need to work on the plumbing for the toilet

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NQTropics
Reviews.Content: Sorry for the delayâ€¦so busy. Quite a different location to our last stay. Hotel We stayed for 5 days in Sydney covering all the important Christmas 2008 dates. First up, the website for this establishment does show indicative proof of the style and type of hotel/foyer/restaurant/ rooms/suites. In other words itâ€™s accurate. We arrived at the Hotel by booked limo to be greeted very nicely by porters. The limousine Company had obviously liased with the Airline and Hotel, which worked out fine as we were greeted on time at the Airport and also by name as we exited the vehicle at the Hotel (Hire Company is Royale limousines. Highly recommended) Reception The Hotel has a fantastic feel. A WOW factor, especially the foyer and majestic stairs that lead to upper levels. It oozes character. Michael on front of house operations was excellent, and obviously well versed in his role. He was so tentative toward us at every opportunity. Six lifts so no real wait for transport upwards! Room Suite was as advertised and booked online through SPG. (Starwood Hotels Clb) A Park View Terrace Suite on level 19. Spacious, comfortable, and well appointed. Bathroom/bath nicely designed, large, and clean. Well positioned for access from either the main bedroom or small entrance foyer to the suite. The King bed was nothing less than to die for. Absolute comfort and luxury for us. Very difficult to get out of bed for the next dayâ€™s activities! Lounge area OK, perhaps showing some age but nothing dramatic. Dusty entertainment area tops/side tables was noticeable. A little behind on housekeeping for a new long stay check in perhaps, but that is the only real problem. Seating and study area was comfortable. Lounge was a good size. Nice Terrace with fantastic views. Our suite being on Club level included access to the Executive Club on level 21. Very nice with private areas available. High Speed Internet if you are not on holidays. Great views over the harbour and park. Plenty of staff to assist every need. Breakfast offers three small but adequate hot options with the continental spread. Afternoon tea available, along with evening canapÃ©sâ€™ and drinks after 5 pm daily. Pretty much what ever you want. So the club level accommodation costs are, I believe, worth it. Hotel room service is fine, meal options limited as one would expect, but are adequate and tasty. Remember itâ€™s room service, so much higher costs are involved for being a little lazy yourself! But what the hell itâ€™s holidays! Restaurants Botanica was pleasant. We only had one meal at breakfast and it was fine. The usual buffet fair and chef on hand to create your style of eggs or omelette. It was great. However, The Times on The Park steak house in the hotel on level one was our first evening meal in Sydney. Not the greatest experience. Food took forever to arrive, was not cooked to order, bread had to be returned as it was stale and like a rock! Slow service, really slow. Unfortunately the service was not that welcoming to anyone else either it seemed. Perhaps because it was Christmas Eve. Never the less, it should not happen. Rest assured itâ€™s not part of the Sheraton per say its independent. I would not recommend eating there. The Sheraton Hotel has other nicer areas to enjoy. Sheraton on The Park is close to all that one would need, including shopping, transport, restaurants and the obvious site seeing and water activities. Would we stay at Sheraton on The Park Sydney again? My word we would! Absolutely wonderful. 5 stars from us. Highly recommend the upper levels of accommodation and features for that bit extra. Either way, itâ€™s a fantastic Hotel to stay with. Next tour takes us to South Australia in April 2009. The Barossa and Adelaide City. Will advise when ready! Raise a glass! Cheers. R & G.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, fantastic location. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: TheAusSmithFamily
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a king room facing Hyde Park. Although not straight on to the Park, we could still enjoy a view of the Park. On the 12th floor we could still here a bit of traffic noise, in particular buses, but it was pretty mild and was not disruptive or disturbing. From start to finish, we found the Sheraton staff friendly, highly efficient, and helpful. Our room was beautifully fitted out, we particularly loved the bed as it was very comfy (although a greater range of pillows would have been helpful). Botannica Brasserie puts on a fantastic breakfast brasserie but it's not cheap. We had a gorgeous meal at Times one evening as well - which was definitely worth the money. The location was great too. Right across the road from St James underground train station. Buses almost outside the door. A short walk from the monorail. Getting to and from the hotel, and therefore to and from shops, is just too easy. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: bennyboy1987
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton just before Christmas 2008. I have stayed in many hotels in Sydney, and the Sheraton is definitely my favourite. The lobby was stunning, walking in at 6:30pm with all the christmas lights on and decorations up, this really is a proper classy hotel. I stayed in an Exceutive Suite for 2 nights, which i booked on Wotif.com for half the normal price. The room was outstanding, really big with separate lounge and bedroom, massive marble bathroom and walk in robe, 2 huge tv's, and a good room service menu, although the mini bar was slightly lacking. My keycard wasn't working in the door to the executive lounge (located on the top floor with amazing views to north head), and the staff at reception were quick to rectify the problem and replace my faulty card. While there I joined Starwood Preferred Guest and am now staying at several Starwood properties in North America and Canada over the next year, thanks to their fantastic rewards system.

Reviews.Title: “Beware currency conversion”
Reviews.Author: landcruiserBJ
Reviews.Content: Having decided to take a February break in Australia the search for accommodation began. The write-ups for the Sheraton on the Park looked promising and their â€œthree nights for twoâ€� deal looked attractive. We decided on a three night stay there as a finish to our first week in Sydney. On entering our required dates through the â€œthree nights for twoâ€� link we were quickly able to complete our $600 dollar booking, which needed to be paid in advance. A couple of days later a check online of our credit card statement revealed the Sheraton had converted our $ booking to Â£s before charging our card, the rate of conversion they had used was very unattractive and had been done without our agreement. Their conversion equated to $1.9612 to the Â£ whereas the rate levied by our card issuer equated to $2.191461 to the Â£, meaning their unauthorised conversion booking had increased our accommodation costs by Â£32.14. Dealing with their accounts department to get this wrong put right was a nightmare, although it was eventually put right and our room was upgraded as a gesture of goodwill. Our initial greeting at reception was â€œcoldâ€�, that was until our reservation details came up on screen when there was a transformation in the attitude of the clerk â€“ there was doubtless some on screen reference to our determination over the currency conversion issue and perhaps even our letter to Starwood Chief Executive in White Plains, New York! The Executive Suite was first class, clean, excellent size, excellent facilities and excellent view over Hyde Park. The hotel location is perfect for accessing Darling Harbour, Circular Quay/Opera House, China Town, Central Shopping Area, Botanical Gardens and Train Station. After the initial hiccup at reception we found all the staff to be friendly and helpful. Our stay was generally enjoyable, itâ€™s a pity it got off to a bad start with the booking and a â€œcoldâ€� start at reception. We would consider staying at the Sheraton on the Park again, provided we could access a promotional rate and provided they levied their accommodation charge in the currency it was booked in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ATrekker
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple of nights over the Australia Day weekend. The rooms are very nice and location is central to most everything in Sydney. I typically stay at more Hilton properties (Diamond HH Member) but have been a strong PG supporter (Gold Member) for a number of years. The hotel seemed slow and on my second day it occurred to me that they hadn't given me access to the club lounge - so I called and requested and was denied (not on this stay according to front desk). It's not a big deal as I really don't use these to much extent anyway (maybe a morning juice or bottle of water) - but I thought it was a bit strange. The hotel was slow and they have a loyal customer a long way from home (Chicago) - with one day left - it may have been a nice gesture. Otherwise, this was a nice hotel and good location. After a week in Melbourne, I returned to Sydney and stayed at the 4-Points Darling Harbor (5-nights) and think I enjoyed it a bit better. The rooms are certainly better here but Darling Harbor was great! Overall - I would recommend this hotel and Sydney was terrific!! Bridge Climb is a must!!

Reviews.Title: “A five star experience for our stay!”
Reviews.Author: beach_specialists
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was very enjoyable with professional, efficient and friendly employees that offered attention to detail and what we considered a five star experience! ARRIVING & DEPARTING We used taxis to/from the airport and found the staff on hand to assist on both occasions. They were very prompt and professional in helping with our things. There are stairs and a ramp to access the lobby area. A lovely hotel entrance awaited us and it was very nice to see the staff in uniforms on hand to help. RECEPTION On entering the hotel the lobby area was very busy with activity and it took a moment to be orientated. We found the reception desk on the right and were promptly attended to by the friendly staff member. It was great initiative of the staff member to ask us if we would like to upgrade to a park view room for an additional $30 AUD however we decided to stay with the city view room and thanked him for his offer. During our stay we approached reception for assistance on two questions we had and on both times the service was professional and efficient. On check out we were attended to very quickly and our last impression was as good as our first â€“ an excellent five star hotel. ROOM We walked in our king city view room and were surprised with how big it was! On entry we had a walk in luggage storage and wardrobe to the right, the bathroom to the left, straight ahead the desk area with a sitting area and around the corner to the left one of the most comfortable king beds in our many hotels to date! The bathroom was big, the range of amenities impressive and different lighting options were available. There were ample towels provided, a big bath and a walk in shower with a glass door. The water pressure was perfect and it was a wonderful room and bathroom to be in after long flights! The mini bar had a very good selection and there was a big tea selection as well as hot chocolate & coffee. The cot provided for our infant was beautiful and it was so lovely to see the staff take the time with it each day and even tuck in the little toy under the blanket! As a family staying at this hotel we felt very welcome. There was so much attention to detail in this room and many things were thought of for the guest and traveller, we were very impressed and would not hesitate to return here if ever have the opportunity to! There were the shutters to offer privacy in the room as the view was to a city building and it okay to not have a view as the room offered so much comfort we didnâ€™t even notice! FACILITIES The swimming pool and health club were at a charge and not included in our room price. The internet was at an expensive fee for in room use however free in the lobby area as well as an internet area for guests with no laptop. We didnâ€™t dine at the options in this hotel so canâ€™t comment on these however they all looked nice and inviting. AREA The location of this hotel is ideal for the first or regular visitor to Sydney. Main tourist attractions are accessible on foot, monorail, bus, or taxi from the hotel (or near it in case of monorail). We were very happy with the position of the hotel for shops, restaurants and ease to get a taxi. The Hyde Park is across the street that some rooms face and it is very beautiful to walk through.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service!!”
Reviews.Author: Ms.NatalieB
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and our room was big. However, the design of the bathroom drove me crazy. It was huge and beautiful however, the shower design was terrible. When you turned on the shower, water sprayed out onto the floor. I tried to put a towel on the floor to collect the water so I wouldn't slip, and then the shower door wouldn't shut. It was very frustrating. Pool closed early. Free Internet access but they only have 4 computers (it's a big hotel). So we had to wait most of the time. $6.50 Aus for a regular coffee. Location was pretty good. Hyde park was nice, we walked to Chinatown and Darling Harbor. There is a Starbucks night around the corner (much cheaper then the Sheraton's coffee). We took a cab to the Opera House...about $10. Eat at Cafe Sydney...delicious!! The staff helped as to make a reservation there. They went above and beyond to help us multiple times. The staff was very friendly and professional. Overall a good stay. I would probably recommend the hotel...not 100% sure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views in the Central Business District”
Reviews.Author: Kutless-inspired
Reviews.Content: Sheraton on the Park has beautiful views of Hyde Park. It is within easy walking distance of Circular Quay and Darling Harbor. The room we had was spacious, and had great city views. The skytower was visible out of our windows. Also, this was the first hotel we've stayed in which had electric window shades behind the shutters. Staff was friendly, and views from the Executive Lounge were gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Antarctic
Reviews.Content: Good position overlooking the park. I stayed there two weekends in January, one of which included Australia Day. Very busy during the second weekend but the hotel seemed to cope in most areas. Both rooms I were given were large with good ammenities. Bathroom excellent, separate room for baggage, refeshments in room and large TV. Achieved a good night's sleep. The main restaurant was configured for buffet dining although there was a nominal alternative menu which appeared to be difficult to order from. The dinner buffet was strong on seafood and reminded me of the cruise ship style of dining. Not a place to go if you wanted something simple or personal. The breakfast was good but each day I was charged for the full hot breakfast even though I only took the continental. The impression was go with the flow and do not be a customer who wants something out of the norm. The upmarket restaurant was closed when I was there. The bar could offer hot snacks but there were no tables, only chairs. My recommendation would be good accommodation but dine elsewhere unless you like upmarket holiday camp food.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: parisi615
Reviews.Content: Just as a disclaimer, I am a Platinum member of Starwood's loyalty program (Starwood Preferred Guest). I booked the hotel through the SPG website, and upon arrival, my girlfriend and I immediately got upgraded to a junior suite. We arrived straight from an international flight in the morning, and since our room wasn't quite ready, they redirected us to the gym to take showers and to relax in the Executive Lounge until our rooms were ready. Once we had the chance to refreshen in the gym showers, we headed to the Executive Lounge and were informed that our room was ready. We arrived in our room to find the junior suite about the size of an apartment - a living room with a big couch and TV, desk, and the bedroom separated with a great view of Hyde Park. The bathroom was quite large as well. Everything was spotlessly clean. As a Platinum member, we also received free breakfast, high tea on the weekends, and evening drinks. The location of the hotel is great, across from Hyde Park and about a 15-20 minute walk from both Darling Harbour and Circular Quay. Shopping is right around the corner as well. Buses to Bondi Beach and the St. James train station are right across the street. The concierge was quite helpful in making dinner reservations and providing recommendations. Overall, the service was amazing. This hotel might be a bit pricy but is a great value based on the quality and service. We would definitely stay there again in Sydney and look forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer14
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the starwood preferred guest website that was having a sale, and got a very reasonable rate of $180aud per night (non-park view room). Upon arrival in the morning, the room was ready early for us which was great because we were much earlier than check-in time. The room itself was quite large, and the marble bathroom was huge! The bed was one of the most comfortable I have slept in, and the shower was also great! The location was just wonderful, we could walk to the cbd, rocks, darling harbour, and the botanical gardens. We also took some longer walks to paddington & east sydney through the beautiful park across the road. The equipment at the gym was reasonably new, and is free for guests, and the pool looked wonderful also with views of the city but we didn't get the chance to use it on our stay. The free internet in the lobby was also handy to check emails or locations of places to visit. One of the highlights for us at this hotel was the concierge desk. There was a thunderstorm on one of the nights we were staying there, and the concierge recommended a fantastic italian restaurant in nearby east sydney (and made the reservations for us), and also provided us with umbrella's for our walk. The only (& minor) gripe I had about this hotel, was that upon checkout there were charges to our mini-bar that we did not use, but this was reversed as soon as we stated this. I would certainly stay here again if the price was right & highly recommend if you are considering this hotel for your stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NCtraveler51
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton on the Park is a lovely, modern hotel in an excellent location and we found it to be a real value at the under $200 a night price we were able to get by booking directly with the hotel for two nights in early January '09. I agree with all of the positives noted by other reviewers and just want to add a few additional comments. We were traveling with our college age sons and booked a king room overlooking Hyde Park and a twin room with a "city view." We arrived at the hotel around 10:30 AM, having just disembarked from a cruise. We were delighted to be greeted warmly at that hour and were able to check into the king room immediately, despite the official 3 PM check-in time. The twin room was available about an hour later. Both rooms (and bathrooms) were very spacious, attractively decorated, and extremely comfortable. As another reviewer mentioned, there is a charge for internet use in the room, but there is a small business center in the lobby area where computers can be used at no charge. Be aware, however, that the hotel charges by the page to use the printer -- even to print airline boarding passes -- and that you have to get the paper yourself from the front desk. This seemed unusual and something of an annoyance. It was our only negative experience at the hotel. On the positive side, I found the hotel staff extremely helpful in recovering some items that I left behind in the room. When we got home to the US and I unpacked, I realized that I had left a small bag containing several things purchased during our travels. I called the hotel and they quickly determined that my items had been found by housekeeping. I offered to pay to have the items mailed to me and the concierge desk was able to tell me the cost of several different shipping options. I chose air mail as the least expensive and am happy to report that my package arrived today with everything intact. Finally, although the hotel is not in the heart of the tourist district, we found it relatively easy to walk to Darling Harbour (about 5-10 minutes) and to the Circular Quay, the Rocks, and the Opera House (about 20 minutes). For those with mobility limitations, low energy, or small children, you should know that the walk is downhill going to any of the above locations and uphill coming back. Taxi's are readily available, however, and it only cost about $5-6 (AUS) for the four of us to go by cab from the Rocks back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “true to its name 5 star +”
Reviews.Author: oz_rocks
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is a magnificent hotel. It was so lovely, my wife and I are going to find it hard to enjoy other hotels. We are going up to Noosa this January and staying at the Sheraton up there, so I hope we will experience the same service. Check in staff friendly and helpful. Our room was very spacious and the view of the park and the old church was great. The buffet breakfast was delicious, with a huge variety of food available. The location is central to shops and The Rocks area is within walking distance. We would definately recommend this hotel and we will definately stay again. If you are looking for something interesting to do, try a visit to the Jewish Museum in Darlinghust its a great place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Branding”
Reviews.Author: 71gav
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay, and we love the hotel. it's obvious a lot of time and effort has gone into the hotel and staff training. However they have forgotten the little things that do make a difference. Great branding does not make up for great service. Stay here, love the location and the well appointed rooms, but forget about there being a connection between you and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TravelerDB
Reviews.Content: We went to Australia for our honeymoon and Sydney was kind of our "hub" b/c after taking side trips we always ended back in Sydney. This hotel is in a great location and the park accross the street (Hyde Park) is really nice. The rooms are spacious (as long as you get a king room bc the queen are SMALL) but they are all fairly clean. I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 b/c when we checked in Mel who was the "floor mgr" was incredibly rude that it made me want to cancel the reservations. Luckily the rest of the staff was OK. Also when they say "city view" don't expect much b/c you are probably blocked in with tall buildings. Other than that, the stay was nice and I would book there again if coming back to Sydney specifically b/c it is centrally located and easy to get everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobertoChile
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, in a very good place in downtown Sydney facing Hyde Park and close to the main commercial streets and shopping center, as well as the main atraction as the Opera House, Habour, etc. The rooms are wide with modern and warm furnitures. The bathroom is very wide for the normal bathroom at the hotels, ahving shower and tub. The hotel has a nice swimming pool at the highest floor with a wonderful view of the city and the harbour. Recommended for business or tourism.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: TravellingThoughts
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 9:30 a.m. after 24 hours of traveling, and I had no problems getting a room right away. I booked an executive king suite, which was surprisingly spacious with a beautiful black marble bathroom that had a soaker tub and a separate glass shower with amazing water pressure. The room was very quiet, and the bed very comfortable, however, the best part was the hotel staff. I had difficulties getting into my room safe at 3:30 in the morning, and the hotel security was at my door in less than five minutes. The next morning at 3:30 a.m. (I wake early) I requested ice, and within 5 minutes someone was at my door with a silver champagne bucket filled with ice. The concierge booked my return arrangements to the airport, called jazz clubs to find the best acts, investigated high tea options, and fulfilled many other requests. Because the hotel is surrounded by restaurants, I did not try the dining room. My only complaint - no free wireless internet connection in the room, however, there is free wireless service in the lobby along with several terminals and printers.

Reviews.Title: “Abova beyond”
Reviews.Author: P-Fogg-1873
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week in Sydey and booked this hotel with Starwood points. Positives: -Excellent location: literally in the center of the city; on Hyde park, walk to waterfront, Opera House, old part of the city, harbor bridge, aquarium and chinatown. 1-2 blocks to all shopping, in the center of the business district, so-so many restaurants to choose. 20 mins to Bondi beach and zoo. -Clean, Modern and Elegant: rooms were excellent size, very modern and clean, restaurants and bars in the hotel were top notch. Free high speed internet. -Staff were helpful, kind and curteous: exchange money at the desk w/ no fee; provided maps, directions, tips for sightseeing. TRUE STORY: after a long day of touring (walking) we didnt want to leave the hotel, but really felt like eating chicken schnitzel (saw it while touring); the chef actually made it for us while the restaurant was still closed and served it at the bar so we could have a view of the park. on top of that, the chef customized the rest of the meal to our taste (chips, rocket salad). its not like we were VIP's- we booked with points! TRUE STORY: A bottle of water went missing from the mini-bar, and when we told them we didnt take it, they removed the charge without a fuss. (This actually happened to me with a lousy Snickers bar in Florida, and I had to see the manager about it!) Negatives: -Honestly, none. No kidding, my wife wants to move to Sydney now...

Reviews.Title: “It was OK - nothing special”
Reviews.Author: btna
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed in a Park View Twin on the 8th floor for 3 nights in November. The Reception staff were pleasant and the check in service was efficient. The lobby is quite impressive but I did notice that the flowers arrangements behind the desk and by the lift were a bit dead looking and in need of changing. They were fresh the next day but I think the the hotel ought to consider changing them on a more regular basis as dead, ratty flowers bring down the tone. Curiously, the young woman at reception told me they were fully booked for the weekend - which I found interesting seeing as I had only booked the room a half hour ago (having walked out of the Establishment, where I was originally booked). I have no idea why she told me that. Perhaps it was just chit chat? They were awfully busy when I arrived. I would describe the room as reasonably clean; ie) it was not dirty enough for me to complain but it neither was it spotless. There was dust on some of the cabinets and the armchair was badly stained. A wine glass I wanted to use had grubby fingerprints - that sort of thing. I got the impression that this hotel is more geared for businessmen than for holiday makers because the room decor is quite masculine. Also, there was no drawer space whatsoever, There was only one sink in the bathroom and not much bench space for toiletries. For two women getting ready to go out this was not so good. I could see up through the top of the bathroom's sliding doors up into the ceiling and see the air conditioning pipes and insulation which I thought was pretty poor. Unfortunately the air conditioning does not tell you what temperature you are setting so we alternated between too hot and too cold which was a bit uncomfortable. Apart from that the room was quite nice with a lovely leafy green view of the park. It was larger than most hotel rooms I've stayed in in Sydney - around 40 m squared - which is good for two singles. The beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was clean and the shower had amazing water pressure, which we really enjoyed. A good sleep in is something I also enjoy while I'm away but unfortunately, one of the cleaning staff entered our room on Saturday morning at around 8.30 am and woke us up. We had room service the first night. it was very good and arrived promptly. The buffet breakfast was also very good but ruined by the attitude of the duty manager who asked if we wanted coffee then poured one for me but not my friend and stomped off. The percolated coffee was dreadful - stewed and cold. We ordered flat whites instead. I don't know if we've been charged for this yet because I still haven't received my invoice by email. (We chose an express checkout because the hotel was very busy on Sunday.) We also had to queue for breakfast on the last day but not for too long. This hotel is in a very convenient location. We walked to the Art Gallery and also picked up some wine and snacks from David Jones, just around the corner. Overall I would describe the service as good but not outstanding and the room as comfortable but certainly not luxurious. The hotel is more 4 star. Definitely not 5 star for the reasons I've given, above. Our stay was OK but I really would have preferred to stay somewhere luxurious. I do research on the net before deciding where to stay when travelling but sadly it's still always pot luck, isn't it - particularly in Sydney :/

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sydney_beach_gal
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is very nice and plush, and brilliantly located. Check-in was swift but there was fairly long queue at check out with a few extra staff just standing around - not too helpful when you lingered too long at the fantastic breakfast buffet. Room was gorgeous and spacious, and the bathroom was lovely. I like it when 5 star hotels give you high-end brand name toiletries (l'occotaine etc) but the sheraton brand is fine. Had a lovely night and the bed was divine. The breakfast buffet was impressive - sets the standards for all other hotel breakfasts in sydney! Except for plunger rather than expresso coffee :( But the omelette chef is fantastic! Reasonable value. Probably not quite five stars but pretty close!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tania m
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay, even if it was only 1 night! The staff were excellent, especially the young girl on the front counter (I think she had a badge that said she was a trainee). The view was not the best but we only booked a city view. The block out curtains and shutters are a nice touch. The bathroom was great and loved the products. Our rate included self parking and breakfast, the best value package if you can get it, I would suggest that you call the hotel direct if you cannot find a rate that includes these things, you may find you can get it direct. The parking is a must as it was for 24 hours and because we did things the following day we could leave the car all day and travel around on the public transport. This in itself is worth $40- $60. The breakfast had everything and more!!! Then we requested a late check out and they kindly were able to supply it - I think they may have been quiet the next day. So that helped with a young child and a midday break. Thanks again and we are staying in again in November.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: hulahunny
Reviews.Content: This was a holiday trip and for our three nights in Sydney, we chose the Sheraton on the Park. Everything about the hotel, for the most part, was very good. The room and bathroom were a pleasant surprise, as they were both very good sized. We had a king room with a roll away and had ample room to move around and spread out. For our stay, we booked a room that came with breakfast for two nights and used Starwood points for the other night. The only disappointing thing was that the view from the room was supposed to be a city view, however, from room 1108, it is an air conditioning and roof view. As gold members, we were told at check in that they were not changing our room for our stay, so we assumed that because we used points, any chance for an upgrade had been squashed. It is just one of those things that makes you wonder why obtaining status with a hotel chain matters. Although a better view would have been nice, when in the city, it really didn't spoil the trip. The breakfast that came with our room was outstanding. The cost is $39 per person, so if you can book a special rate with breakfast, it is well worth it. The buffet was bountiful and even had fresh honey comb available. It was so fresh, that I was half expecting to see bees flying around. The location of this hotel can't be beat. Taxi cabs are plentiful and there is a subway station directly across the street. Additionally, there are numerous shopping malls right outside the door and within several blocks. The Queen Victoria Building is a few blocks away and is a quick 5 -7 minute walk. All in all, I highly recommend this property. The rooms are large, the beds are very comfortable, the breakfast is outstanding, the location can't be beat, and there are four, free computers available to check e-mail. The only real downside is that the service was a little spotty. On several occasions, we had to call down to guest services and we had difficulty getting someone to answer the phone. We had to call back a few times until someone answered. A bit annoying, but not a deal breaker for a return trip. Also, be advised, if you need a roll away, there is a $45 charge. This is common for hotels outside the U.S., although this charge was about Â½ the price of a roll away in Tokyo.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andy123Northampton
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed here, it was great last time and it was great this time too. Rooms are big, we didnâ€™t have much of a view but since the hotel is in the city it doesnâ€™t really matter. Bed was big and comfortable, large flat screen TV, DVD player. Bathrooms are the big plus in the rooms at the Sheraton, large with marble floors, bathtub and shower. There are lots of facilities within the hotel as you would expect, business centre downstairs had free internet access (4 pc). Great covered pool on the roof too. Staff very friendly and efficient, sometimes in hotels of this size staff can be a bit snooty but in both our stays here we have never found this. The hotel is about 20 minutes easy stroll to circular quay and the rocks, nice restaurants (we tried Zia Pina in the Rocks and although the food was good the staff were rude as they leaned over you while eating) although perhaps not as many as you might expect. Buses and taxis are plentiful if you donâ€™t want to walk. We didnâ€™t have breakfast at the hotel (usual high prices) if you exit at the rear of the hotel onto Castlereigh Street and turn right there is a nice place for breakfast - Take a break cafÃ©, approx $14 for a full breakfast (not Sunday), turn left there and is a Subway sandwich shop. We wouldnâ€™t hesitate to stay here again when in Sydney; we got what we think it a pretty good rate direct from the hotel ($220/night).

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: countryNSWBam
Reviews.Content: I stay here for work on occassions. The rooms are lovely and the service is always friendly. The beds are extremely comfy and the bathrooms are 100 times larger than the wentworth. The only negative would have to be the prices in the bars and for room service. If you order room service you will pay an $8 delivery fee on top of the already very expensive prices. A coffee in the tea gallery will set you back around 7bucks and a beer is around $8. Apart from the prices its a lovely hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good for business travellers, if they have their act together..!!”
Reviews.Author: melbournelass
Reviews.Content: Would suggest this is more appropriate for business travellers than those seeking quality time together. My initial thoughts were not as impressive as despite having booked and receiving a confirmation from their website they had no record of the booking. Combined with a somewhat officious little man on reception who curtly said that I was at fault and not the hotel, I was able to negotiate a free drink while they got their act together. Some 40 minutes later I was in my room. Adeqiately sized for a 5 star property and with all features you would expect. Central location with good views of park.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravellers25
Reviews.Content: We had three fantastic nights at this Hotel recently . We booked an Executive floor Club Room and from the moment we walked into the Hotel until the time we left, the level of customer service and attention to detail was exemplary. Alex completed our check in, we were upgraded to a corner room with both park and water views and told if we were not happy to come back and they would find something more suitable. Great service. As for the Club room facilities it more than met our expectations. The staff were extremely friendly, the service was exceptional and the ambience just about perfect. We chose this Hotel because of the reviews on Trip Advisor and were definitely not disappointed in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DevMarc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely and ideally situated right in the middle of downtown amidst the skyscrapers, and directly across from Hyde Park and the Royal Botanic Gardens. It is walking distance from the Sydney Harbor (where the bridge and opera house are) as well as Darling Harbor, where there are numerous restaurants and bars. It is also right down the street from one of the most amazing shopping complexes, called David Jones. From the outside it looks like a regular dept. store, and then you go into this labyrinthine mass of stores that goes on forever and extends onto a pedestrian-only street. It also has the most extensive food court I've ever seen...the best food we had in AUS was definitely in the food court...and it was inexpensive. (Elsewhere in AUS the food is pretty substandard, although everyone serves with a smile!) Inside the hotel, the TIMES restaurant was ordinary and overpriced, but the Botanica Brasserie was magnificent for brunch and lunch buffets, although not cheap. The Internet is available for free in the lobby, but you'll have to wait, if you don't have your own laptop. The only thing I didn't like about the room was the lack of drawer space.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable for Business Trip, Wouldn't Book for Personal”
Reviews.Author: Martrese
Reviews.Content: My company booked me here for an eleven-day business stay. It's quite the schmancy hotel - well-appointed, lots of amenities, and the high prices to match. The in-room internet fee is astronomical, so I brought my laptop to the lobby for free access. (They have computers in the lobby for those without their own, which is nice.) The laundry fee is high too, so I brought my one load to a laundromat down Elizabeth Street for a third of the cost. (I know, it's a business trip and my company was paying, still, the frugal traveler in me wouldn't justify the cost.) And they charge you for use of the fitness center!!! At these prices, you should have unlimited access. I experienced a few technical difficulties. . .my room safe failed to work twice and it was annoying to have to keep calling for assistance. And my room key stopped working half-way through my stay - ugh. Again, for these prices, this shouldn't happen. The location is ok - it's a 15 minute walk to the harbor and there aren't a lot of restaurants in the immediate vicinity. I walked to Darlinghurst a few nights for a MUCH better food selection - I had some great meals there. (Try Fish Face - divine.) I'm a runner, so I mapped out a few really nice runs from the hotel - through the Botanic Garden (which is very close), along the harbor, over the bridge & back. In that respect, the location was great. If you have the funds or if someone else is footing the bill, go for it. But the next time I'm vacationing in Sydney, I'd rather stay in a less expensive hotel in Darlinghurst, which is much more alive with activity & dining choices.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great room”
Reviews.Author: amaunette
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in this hotel for our anniversary. From the minute we arrived out of the taxi until we checked out, the staff were really friendly and willing to help in any way. We arrived at 11am and hadn't requested an early checkin, but they accomodated us with no hassles. We stayed in a King Hyde Park Room and although the view wasn't as great as we expected, the room made up for it. The room was clean, the marble bathroom is lovely and the bed is super comfortable. We had buffet breakfast included and found this to be a great addition as the food was great. We also really enjoyed the high tea served in the lobby restaurant with a glass of moet! Although this hotel is on the pricey side, the location and level of service is well worth it. We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Yibbert
Reviews.Content: This is a great sheraton property. It is very centrally located and the rooms are great. The fitout is exceptionally good and the views (over the park) are very nice. The rooms are exceptionally clean and all the common areas are bright clean and well maintained. The hotel is in a great downtown location and are very close to the harbour. The staff are excellent and i could not fault any aspect of our stay. I would also mention that the facilities are (as you would expect) limited because of the downtown location but this did not limit my stay in any way.

Reviews.Title: “OK - but you could get better value elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: dancemonkey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three weeks, which is a long time for any hotel. While the staff were generally fantastic, very friendly, the hotel really needs a bit of a refresh, I was staying on an executive floor and the rooms, while very spacious, really aren't up to the standard of a hotel which charges $400 a day, and then throws additional charges on for the internet ($30 per day), to use the gym ($15 per day), etc. Other things were really up to scratch, the selection of in room TV and the room service menu were also very limited. On the plus side, the hotel does have a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed stay”
Reviews.Author: jojoMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night over the long weekend and had a good experience. We also arrived early, and they tried to get us straight into the room but unfortunately it was unavailable (we hadn't expected it to be available!) But they checked us in, took our bags, and when we came back after hours of sightseeing we picked up our key and our bags were in our room - all very easy. The room was nicely fitted out, hotel lobby was very impressive, serivce across the board was good and helpful. Hotel is also in a great location. Only minor downside was drinks in the Level 1 bar on the Sunday night - I just dont think they had anticipated the crowds on a Sunday night of a long weekend, and they were woefully understaffed, which led to the staff being stressed, spilling drinks because they were trying to rush, etc. But it was understanable! The drink prices were extortionist, but that is what you get in a hotel bar. We booked direct on the hotel website for $250, and I thought it was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: KylieOberon
Reviews.Content: Really lovely hotel, in a great location. The entrace to the hotel is just beautiful , sweeping staircase , marble etc. Check in was good and they allowed us acess to our room a few hours before check in. Room was lovely, good size, nice view of the park and a wonderful big bathroom, even a small walk in closet. Breakfast was amazing - it was by far the best breakfast I have had in a hotel in Australia- try to get it included in your room rate. Service was very good, staff very friendly and accommodating. Location was fabulous especially for Sydney shopping Would definately stay again

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Business_Asia
Reviews.Content: While the Sheraton compares favorably to the other five star hotels in Sydney, it fell short of what I expect from a premeire SPG property and International five star level of service. I had two rooms during my five night stay. Upon check in the first night I was given a room with twin beds while my reservation was for a non-smoking king. I am a base SPG member (previously a Gold ). It was too late in the night to complain and get a new room. The twin beds were not suitable for a 6' tall person. The room features, cleanliness and functionality were commensurate with a five star property. When I changed rooms for the 3rd through 5th night I was told that they would roll my account into the new room. While on business I like to separate accomodation charges from food and beverage for my expenses. Upon checkout I found that my room was closed out and it was not possible to separate the bill without a manual invoice. I had to leave before the day manager could whip up a manual invoice. The concierge was capable and helped me with a movie reservation. One of the low points of the hotel are the very ordinary service upon check in. No one helped with luggage on my way in or out. Not acceptable for a five star hotel. The other thing is the very dear price for food and extras. Internet is $30, two trousers and three shirts was almost $70 standard service and a charge for excersise room if you are not SPG gold or above. While the room service food was quite good, the price far excedes any of the other five star hotels I have been in Sydney; Hilton, IC and Swiss Hotel. There are better values in town. Drop downstairs on Casteleigh street and get an egg sandwich and espresso for $6! If not for the poor welcome and check out experience, I would definitely stay here again on my return and eat out but I will try another hotel just because of this. Caution if you are not on an unlimited expense account.

Reviews.Title: “As expected”
Reviews.Author: invisigirl23
Reviews.Content: Efficient and friendly check in, simple swipe of the credit card as expected. The room was lovely, recently refurbished, very comfy beds. Bathroom was large & clean, although it was a bit dark even with all the lights on so a bit hard to put make up on! I didn't get to try the breakfast so can't comment there. In summary, and excellently located, grand, if unremarkable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: jmcf171
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we have stayed at the Sheraton on the Park, but it certainly won't be the last. A great central location- close to St James station, David Jones, Pitt Street Mall, and of course Hyde Park. The whole hotel has a lovely warm ambience, from the grand lobby to the guest floors, and our room was newly renovated with a large marble bathroom, walk in wardrobe, and the Sweet Sleeper bed. Service was friendly and professional, and all requests were accommodated. On the whole, we enjoyed our stay much more than other five star hotels in the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location and Property”
Reviews.Author: MCPO-USN-2011
Reviews.Content: Navy visit to Sydney. Great get-a-way from being at-sea. Location is perfect. Staff is very accomodating. Rates very resonable for location---in the heart of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Really very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Hibit
Reviews.Content: I stayed here three nights as part of a last minute business trip. All hotels in Sydney are good value compared to London (home) prices so the value of course seems great to me. The hotel is newly renovated and everything is in perfect condition. I had a standard room which was large with large bathroom and small walk in closet. Location is great - not quite as close to Circular Quay as the Marriott or Shangri-La but easily walkable in ten minutes or less. Concierge is very helpful and I would particularly recommend the buffet restaurant. In the evening they have a wide range including lots of seafood.

Reviews.Title: “Loved breakfast - but I don't want to pay twice!”
Reviews.Author: kangagirl
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous hotel perfectly located for shopping in Sydney. We were a little disappointed that our room faced a boring office wall, which made it feel a little enclosed - but otherwise the room was great - very large, big comfortable bed, massive bathroom and very generous closet. At night we had some noise from neighbours on each side, although the blackout blinds cut out street noise. I highly recommend the mojitos on the terrace of the Conservatory Bar overooking the park, and dinner at Times on the Park was delicious although a little pricey. Access to the health club was part of our package and it was well equipped. A work out was needed to build up the strength to face the breakfast queue - probably 20 people lined up for tables, which then translated into long waits at the buffet. However, the staff stayed cheerful and served juice and pastries to those in line. Our package included parking and we were welcome to leave the car in the parking station while we shopped after checking out, which was great. I noticed a few reviews commented that they were charged for breakfast even though it was in their package - happened to us too - I'm glad I'd read the reviews and watched out for it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: LuvSydney
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay here after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor and I am very happy that I did! The staff was friendly and helpful, rooms were nice and clean. I recommend getting a room vith a view of the Park. Also it was very convenient location right across the street from Hyde Park and St. James Station. It only took us 5-10 minutes max total to get to Circular Quay . Shopping Malls and Shopping Arcades were around the corner. Concierge is very helpful and friendly, not snobby like other hotels. I highly recommend trying their breakfast buffet atleast once, (it is pricy $40 per person, but a lot of variety and great fresh fruit)\ If you don't have much luggage very easy to hop on the train to St. James station to get to the hotel, its faster than taking a cab. Cab to hotel is about $35-$40.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton did not dissapoint”
Reviews.Author: EmaAustralia
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the sheraton, I booked the room as a package through last minute.com which included a twin room buffet breakfast and self parking. As we were going into the city to shop we parked early and had no hassles, when we arrived back at the hotel late evening we were exhausted and just opted for a room service dinner.. I have never in all my travels had such a great room service meal. The beds were comfy, bathroom was big and impressive and buffet breaky had it all. The only down side to our stay was there was a fire near by and we could not shower that evening. That was not the hotels fault. I would definatly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: oasiscalm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over the NYE period for ten nights. Booked online - due to the being fully booked over this period we had to book two separate rooms one on a lower floor for three nights (NYE) and another on the higher floors for the remainder. On check in they allocated us on the higher floor for the full stay which was a bonus. We arrived at the hotel having used a airport bus, so had been able to see other hotels on route. This hotel without a doubt had the grandest entrance. The front of the hotel is very busy during the day but there is always someone available to welcome you and give u immediate service. Check in was slow and lacked warmth. We weren't shown to our rooms just given vague directions. We stayed on the 19th Floor which houses executive rooms. The room was fully equipped - large full marble bathroom with large tub and shower and fully stocked with toiletries. A walk - in double closet with plenty of hanging and folding space. The room comes with black out blinds which along with the renowned Sheraton beds, guarantees a good nights sleep. The dissapointment of this room was the view - it was a brick wall of a nieghbouring building, we had a city view room so wasn't expecting an amazing view but this was horrific, as the hotel was full we had no choose but to stay put. So do book a park view. This hotel is fully equipped - there is free wireless internet on the ground floor and top floor. The ground floor has a working area which has five computers & printers and a networked desk for laptops. The computers are handy for planning your day however there are some guests who fail to acknowledge the other people waiting and hence waiting can be a chore. The gym/pool is on the top floor and well lit due to the large windows and the pool is in an infinite style - with a powerful side jacuzzi. There is also a steam room and sauna. It is very relaxing and recommend a visit. The club room room is on the 21st floor - evening drinks selection is sufficient and canapes are changed daily. The patio areas have a great full of hyde park and are great for breakfast seating. There is also two computers/printers in the club room. The club room is open all day and has books and magazines for just lounging if bored. The breakfast buffet was fully stocked and well managed. Staff are attentive. Overall i would give this hotel 4/5 - what lets this hotel down is the lack of warmness from staff - i appreciate it is a large hotel but the staff could do with being more personable.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of al la cart meals in the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: waiheke
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sheraton on the park for three nights in March 2008. The entrance and lobby area are impressive, the staff friendly and helpful. Our room was large with a good size bathroom which had a bath as well as a shower. The room had all the amenities you would expect from a hotel of this level and price. Our room was at the back of the hotel but the rooms at the front have views over the park, but at an additional cost. For all services such as housekeeping, maintenance, room service etc there is only one number â€œguest servicesâ€� to dial. I think all hotels should have this feature, no dialing one number for one thing and another number for something else. Another feature we liked about the room was the electrically operated blackout curtains, nothing worse than having light leaking into a room at night. Unfortunately the Botanica Restaurant was another story. It is basically set up as a buffet restaurant. The buffet breakfast was great with a large choice of food. We did not sample the dinner buffet but it looked very good with a seafood bias. Unfortunately we dined al la carte. Once for dinner where the food was just OK but for the price not up to expectations, and once for a light lunch where the food was terrible. We both had a burger but could not finish them as they were burnt and dry. The waitress handled the situation very well and took it back to the kitchen and offered complimentary desserts and coffee. I filled out one of the â€œhow was your mealâ€� cards which I always assumed went straight into the bin but to the Sheratons credit the food and beverage Manager contacted us and wanted details of why we were dissatisfied. To sum up the Sheraton on the Park in Sydney, good rooms and good guest services. On the downside eat at the Botanica Restaurant if you are into buffets but eat elsewhere if you want al la cart service.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton was great!”
Reviews.Author: Cactusqueen
Reviews.Content: Just stayed with several other people at the Sheraton for over a week. It was a business stay for my husband and other working folks but a friend and I were sightseeing while in Sydney. The hotel staff are all very friendly, the rooms very spacious and quiet. We faced away from Hyde Park and there was construction going on outside on the street, but it was hardly noticable. The bathroom was large with a nice shower and large tub. The hotel also has a nice pool, spa and sauna on the top floor, with great view of the CBD. It is close to a subway station to get around and close to the monorail as well. It is expensive, but not as expensive as the Hyatt, which has a better view (friends also stayed there and I saw their room), but the room sizes at the Hyatt are much smaller. The Sheraton King sized beds were great! The concierge folks were all very helpful in giving aid to finding restaurants and if you don't want to have the buffet breakfast there are a lot of small cafes around to grab a bite to eat. I really enjoyed our stay there and would stay again if I get a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, EXCELLENT service and good location”
Reviews.Author: goblondie
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Sheraton every year due to business, it' s a beautiful hotel but of course that comes at a cost. It is quite expensive. The main reason we stay there is the quiet rooms and the willingness of the rather helpful but snobby staff to accomodate our needs. The service at this hotel is second to none and will always help you when you need it. (Though be sure to order room service early as it takes abouts 30-45 minutes.) It's in a wonderful location, opposite the park and withing walking distance to anywhere in the CBD. The lobby is spectacular, you feel like royality walking in there. Although I always get a little bit intimidated with all the Mercedes and fancy cars in the hotel's driveway. The breakfast is amazing, we usually fill up for the day and skip lunch. Just be sure to be very cautious with what you put on your room bill, it might surprise you! (To be honest though, I think you could find another hotel for half the price with the same qualities)

Reviews.Title: “NYE Sydney”
Reviews.Author: itsbart
Reviews.Content: Booked a city side king room for 5 night in this hotel for NYE arriving on the 28th of december ( if New Years Eve is in your stay you only can book 4 nights minimum). After checking in our room on the 17th floor next to the elevator. Inside the room you could hear the elevators going up and down. After complaining they gave as another room on the 17th floor with partially park view. The room was great with a spacious bathroom, a walk in closet and nice view. Breakfast was included but the first morning we arrived to late (10.40) because the bellboy told us breakfast served till 11.00 but it was served till 10.30. When checking out, we picked up our rental car while we requested the lady at the frontdesk to collect our suitecases from the room. When we came back after 20 minutes, are suitecases were still in the room. But overall a great hotel on a central location in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “5 star means 5 star”
Reviews.Author: stevej58
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay in in January. Service and room were fantastici. What a relief to book a 5 star hotel and find it actually equates to the rating. We loved the king bed, requested a larger corner room to accomodate a rolleraway for our daughter which was arranged no problem and a unplanned early check in was quilcky arranged. Concierge recommneded a great restaurant for dinner (out of the hotel) I've stayed in most capital cities in Australia and this is my best hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Dinodub
Reviews.Content: We booked the Sheraton from their website and were so glad we did. The price was excellent and we were upgraded from a City Room to a Hyde Park room on arrival. We stayed two days and enjoyed not only the beautiful Hyde Park but the shopping district which is literally just outside the door and around the corner. The walk to Circular Quay takes about 10 minutes as well so everything is literally on your doorstep. Still jetlagged from our flight from Dublin we didn't get to sample too much of the nightlife but the all inclusive breakfast was superb. We were sad to leave and would definitely stay here again if in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible stay as always!!”
Reviews.Author: melbourneboys
Reviews.Content: From the minute you arrive the service is amazing, check in is a breeze with great service and a special check in area if you are a SPG member, i would join if you are not already! the rewards program i great!. The location of the hotel is only a 5 minute walk down to the opera house positioned right on the city doorstep and opposite lovely Hyde Park, public transport trains are right across the road and buses out the front. The Circular Quay ferry terminal is only a short 5-10 walk and takes you anywhere around the bay. The rooms at the sheraton are huge, all with lovely big open bathrooms, there are views opposite Hyde Park or the City,most rooms now have black out blinds all electronically operated from the bed side. If you have the chance dont miss the buffet breakfast a trade mark of the sheraton with an great array of food and service. Oxoford Street (Sydneys main gay area) is also a close walk through Hyde Park in less then 5 minutes. With great nightlife. The hotel is what you would expect, you pay for the privilage but the rewards are worth it, also on the top floor is a great spa, sauna gym and rooftop pool with views through the city. I have no problems in recommending this hotel, if you are arriving from the airport consider a cheaper option of the underground train network its about 12$AUD and takes you almost to the hotel. If you are going to catch a taxi and its off peak (late at night or very early morning) consider avoiding the toll ways they can be quick but at that time s are alternative routes that you dont need to pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton on the Park”
Reviews.Author: MorganWollongong
Reviews.Content: Arrived to a busy reception, however all guests were quickly attended to. There was a mix-up with our room which was remedied with an upgrade to a king suite on the 20th floor overlooking the park towards the harbour. The marble bathroom was large with separate bath and a large shower - probably the best bathroom in a hotel I have stayed - very luxurious. Our room rate included full buffet breakfast and parking. We paid an additional $10.00 for valet parking which made our stay great value for money - $260.00 all up for the Friday night special. Staff were very professional and nothing was too much trouble. Overall a fabulous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: catraveller7
Reviews.Content: I stayed 10 nights at the Sheraton on the Park. The hotel is located in the center of the city (central business district)--convenient for both business and pleasure. It is about a 10 minute walk to both Darling Harbour and the Sydney Opera house area. Very convenient to shopping, with major shopping areas just a couple blocks away. Rooms are nice size, with walk-in closets and a very large bathrooom. Rooms aren't ultra-fancy, but are a step up from most Sheratons. Rooms were well kept and clean, and beds were very comfortable. Some rooms have view of Hyde Park (mine did not), and there is a faily good gym at the hotel. I had access to the "Executive Lounge", which offers a buffet breakfast in the morning and some snacks in the evening. It also offers coffee, tea and drinks (although you need to ask a server to bring you tea and drinks--it would be a lot more convenient if you could just help yourself, as is common at most other executive lounges). The lounge also offers free wireless internet access, although reception is somewhat spotty--I think the signal is intentionally weak to prevent neighboring rooms from getting internet access for free--the hotel charges $39 a day for internet access is you're not in the lounge (although it does have free computer access in the lobby). Staff were very accomodating, especially those in the lounge. All around service was good and workers had a very positive attitude and welcoming attitude. All in all a good hotel, and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel let down by bad service...”
Reviews.Author: Krystalg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sheraton on the Park for three nights in a city view king room on the 11th floor, the room was large and spacious, newly renovated and had a marble bathroom with a separate bath and shower. The hotel is in a great location, it's close to major shopping areas and multiple forms of public transport, and the executive lounge is fantastic. The lobby decor is nice and the bar/dining options were good. However the service wasn't that amazing, it took 25 minutes to get our car out of valet on one occasion and 15 minutes on another. The bell boy took so long to come collect our bags when we checked out we ended up just struggling with them ourselves. The staff were neither rude or nice, just average. The room was very noisy, we could hear the rooms around us and everything going on in the hallway. My parents were also staying at the hotel on a different floor and they also had the same noise problems. In the room we stayed in we had shutters instead of curtains, these didn't block out enough light in the morning and had large cracks where they joined each other, so the room wasn't very dark in the mornings. If I stayed here again I'd definitely be requesting a room with curtains. Overall my experience at this hotel was a good one, I would stay at this hotel again if I got a good rate, I was just disappointed a 5 star hotel would have poor service.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel pool in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: SophieCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I was lucky to get a fantastic deal for a two night's stay in The Sheraton and it's by far the best Sheraton I've ever stayed in. I got two nights B&B, with a complimentary bottle of wine with a board of different cheeses, a free cocktail at the bar and a large, very comfortable double room. Having stayed in other five star Sydney hotels, I would choose this hotel above them all for the best package deals and health club facilities. The swimming pool is located right on the roof, undercover, but you get amazing views of Sydney and you can sunbathe on the balcony just outside, above the whole city and views of Hyde Park just across the road. The bar is open until late and serves really good cocktails. This is a favourite hotel for visiting rock bands and celebrities visiting Sydney and it's understandable why. The shops and bars of busy Oxford Street are just a few minutes walk and you can explore and relax in the park opposite.

Reviews.Title: “Good central position - across from Hyde Park.”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneKiwi
Reviews.Content: Overall we were well satisfied with the Sheraton during our 3 night stay here. We took advantage of the hotel's special offer (on their own website) of pay for 2 nights and get the third (consecutive) night for free. Decided to splash out and book an Executive suite for A$430 night, so in fact paid a total of A$860 for three nights (average A$285). We had a city view (not worth writing about) but you could pay more for a park view if you wanted to. We had Executive Lounge priviliges which basically meant breakfast on the 21st floor (not as lavish as the ground floor breakfast for everyone else, but then that was a cost of about $40pp) with the lovely harbour views, less people, etc. And great coffee. In the evening between 5-8pm you could also go to the Lounge for drinks and canapes etc, free internet use and very attentive and friendly staff. The food and drinks were more than ample to keep us going to breakfast - no problems there. Room was on the 15th floor and was very modern, stunning bathroom with black marble and very comfortable king bed - slept like a log. Plenty of space with desk and chairs. Gripes - even at $430 listed price per night, the hotel could not extend itself to provide free internet access from the room, so we limited ourselves to use it in the Lounge. They also charged for two small bottles of water from the refrigerator (There were two large bottles of water on a cabinet which clearly had a price of $8 over it so you knew those two were not complimentary. I then checked the bar price list and no mention of any charge for the two small water bottles - each only 400ml. But they apparently are not complimentary). I believe Sheraton management should start to move with what is happening in overseas Sheratons - provision of free internet (ie include in the room tariff), provide complimentary water (or at least clearly disclose a price), and also provide a clock that can take an I-Pod - many travellers take their music nowadays!! I have deducted one mark due to the 'gripes', but on balance a good welcoming hotel, big foyer and attentive service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dalton1skiing
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton on a saturday night for a friends wedding. We were given the $275 weekend special which includes parking and breakfast for 2. Note that the parking is free, but an extra $10 for valet service. We weren't given the option of parking the car ourselves though. Check in was quick and efficient. The room was clean and spacious. The bed was soft and very comfortable. We had a shower and bath. Despite being on the 18th floor, the view was mediocre of surrounding buildings. No balcony or open windows made it a little claustrophobic. Also, no smoking unless you request a smoking room. We visited the bride and grooms one bedroom suite. It was large with a small balcony overlooking the harbour & park. A fabulous view. A small bathroom & toilet considering it was a suite though. The bar stayed open until 3am and had a large selection of beers, wines and spirits. Staff were very friendly and willing to help where they could. Our only compaint was at breakfast. Dont arrive between 9-10am. We had to line up the get a table, this took 10mins. Then there was a long line to get hot food and another line for the egg chef. It was 30mins before we were sitting down with food. Being a large group, we had tea/coffee in thermous pots on the tables. This coffee was dreadful, but the cappacino I got was lovely. There seemed to be a limit of 1 coffee or tea being made for each person The choice of food was adequate.
