The usual array of hot foods such as bacon, baked beans, grilled tomatoes and mushrooms, sausages, pancakes and eggs benedict which was delicious. There were 2 egg chefs making all things eggs. Yoghurts, pastries, fresh fruit, cereals and miso soup. The food was fresh & delicous but selection not as large as some other 5 star hotels. The dining area seemed inadequate for the number of guests there. I went to get juice and when I came back, my plate with half my breakfast was wisked away too! I then got up to get more food (joining the back of the line again) and came back to find my juice had been taken and the table being cleared. The staff seemed rushed and stressed and didnt know we were still eating, despite a coat being on the back of my chair! Overall we had a terrific stay, but only compaint was the long wait for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, poor service”
Reviews.Author: flaming_lamborghini
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and the rooms are wonderful, but everything is spoilt by the attitude of many staff. On my first night, I had just arrived from overseas and needed a good sleep. However, there was a function being held below my room and the loud noise continued until well after midnight. When I rung Reception to complain, I was basically told "too bad". I later spoke to security staff who had the same attitude. Obviously, the noisy function area had precedence over guests' peace & quiet. I must say however, that after writing a letter of complaint, I was actually contacted by the Manager who promised to compensate me. He did eventually, after I reminded him of his promise! I would stay there again, but ask for a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “nice room”
Reviews.Author: sereneMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We booked at the spur of the moment, 4hours before check in, and received a free upgrade to a park view room. The 7th floor was a little low but there was a good view of the fountain and park. The room was excellent and so was the bed. The Bathroom 5 star and all was very clean and quiet. The breakfast was fantastic. Much better than Shangrila and Four Points by Sheraton both of which are also in Sydney. The view is not as good though as oppossed to a full harbour view of D harbour or C. quay. Good value for the money, it also included parking. Lovely lobby and bar area.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, especially the service!”
Reviews.Author: SonOfBruin2
Reviews.Content: Unless the Sheraton completely restaffed their hotel between my stay and those of the negative reviewers, I cannot understand in whom the complaints regarding service are founded. Every employee we encountered was cheerful, helpful, and genuinely glad to be of service. When our taxi pulled up to the drive, the doorman, Tetley, welcomed us to Sydney and the hotel with beaming energy and was equally as friendly and cheerful throughout our stay. Check-in was pretty standard, but at least there was no wait, and our bags were sent to the proper rooms (we had two rooms on different floors). The Executive Club Lounge staff was superb. Cameron, Anders, and the entire Club staff were warm and helpful, eagerly calling restaurants to secure reservations and pulling up menus for various eateries. Food and drink service were good as well. Lobby Concierge Mike (I think that was his name...) recommended a great low-key, no frills Thai restaurant that served the best soft-shell crab I have EVER eaten. And I could never forget the housekeeping attendant from the 18th floor (I can't remember her name, though). Aside from keeping the room clean and bathroom amenities restocked, she was one of the nicest and friendliest hotel employees I have ever encountered. I found myself having conversations with her on a daily basis where she demonstrated a genuine care and interest in her guests that is rarely experienced. As I am about to begin my assessment of the room and facilities, I remember now a manager/supervisor in the gym and spa who took it upon herself to lead my family and me on a tour of the fitness facilities when it became evident that we were first-time visitors - she was truly lovely. The gym featured Life Fitness-brand cardio equipment with individual tv screens, as well as a few weight machines, free weights, a couple benches, and two spinning bikes. There is an indoor pool and whirlpool with breathtaking views of the park and city. Locker rooms had separate men's and women's saunas and steam rooms. All in all, a nice gym, but nothing spectacular (except with regard to the views). The rooms are comfortable and modern in style. The Sealy beds were a nice break from dormitory-quality mattresses in other Australian hotels. The down comforter was heavenly, and the sheets soft, though not 100% cotton (they are a 50/50 poly-cotton blend, which I thought I would notice but didn't once in bed). There is a desk and small sofa with a checkerboard table in each room, as well as a Philips-brand tv (27 or 30 inch, flat-screen though not flat-panel). Bathrooms are done in rich wood and black marble - beautiful. The separate shower was excellent - tremendous water pressure. Lastly there is a more than amply-sized walk-in closet in each room, which was perfect for us (traveling with huge duffel bags). My only complaint is with the soundproofing in the walls. I could hear numerous conversations from the adjacent room as well as from the hallway. To be fair, these were probably louder than normal guests, but they were still audible. This wasn't an issue for two of the four nights, but it could pose a potential problem, I guess. We didn't order room service or dine in the restaurant or bar, but the food on the club level was very good. It was nice to have a hot breakfast waiting for you every morning, and I am such a sucker for eggs, bacon, and roasted tomatoes. Afternoon canapes were primarily Asian-themed (dumplings, sushi, et al.) and good, as were cheeses and cured meats. Not a great drink selection, but they WERE pouring champagne and James Boag Premium beer (my fave). The restaurant and IRD menus were VERY pricey, but the lavish dinner buffet was half-price (or discounted in some fashion) with Starwood membership at least. In all, we truly enjoyed our stay and would love to come back were it not for the steady devaluation of the American Peso, er, Dollar. This would be our pick in Sydney without question. Fabulous. Oh, just remembered, a great amenity is the FREE internet access in the lobby for all guests. Also, check out the bar on the second level - it's beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Hyatt!”
Reviews.Author: electroshock
Reviews.Content: I stayed here using my hotel loyalty points (as I did at the Park Hyatt afterwards) and the experience could not have been more different. The Sheraton is a beautiful hotel with large rooms and luxurious bathrooms, but that's it. The service is indifferent and you feel an inconvenience by daring to ask for anything. At the Hyatt you are made to feel like royalty, and nothing is too much trouble. Saturday morning I asked concierge for a late dinner reservation for that night at a restaurant with a view of the harbour. I stated a preferred location, and dietary preferences & said if full please try any others so that we have somewhere to go for dinner. I left my cellphone number and received no call, and returning to the hotel at 6ish, discovered they had made no reservation at all. Call that service? - I certainly don't! Another member of staff eventually found us somewhere to dine. For my money (and next time I visit Sydney on business) I will stay at the Hyatt no question.

Reviews.Title: “Let me know when the service gets sorted out”
Reviews.Author: vague travellers
Reviews.Content: I followed up a stay in August for a conference with an overnight stay in October. It has a lot going for it -- opposite a good park, decent sized rooms particularly for suite deals, on a mall etc.Comfy beds. But the staff seemed to be just going through the motions on little things. When the room wasn't ready at 2pm (which was fair enough) they said they'd allocate it and put in the bags. They then forgot, had to find one at 5pm, which wasn't a good one, and took 45 mins to deliver the bags. When I rang to find them --we were going out --I was told they were coming and no more interest. When they didnt and I rang for the manager I was put on hold. Bad start. It might have been a one off but it took a similar time to get bags the previous trip. When I asked about a late checkout they said that they didn't need the room but it would be $50 if more than an hour. Since we had a suite and were in the exec club, this was a little surprising. When my wife called later to check that we hadn't been charged twice (which we hadn't) it took her three calls to speak to someone as she was simply transferred to someone who wasnt there! All in all we might have just been unlucky on two stays. The rooms were still fine and the price competitive. If I were a tourist I think I'd look for a hotel with a great harbour view. If I was staying for business or was used to Sydney, I'd wait for them to iron out these wrinkles as there are plenty of 5 stars without them I think. I'll be interested to see if the next reviews find that this has been sorted out..

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MBarr
Reviews.Content: My stay here, although only one day, was worth every cent. I only stayed here for the day before flying out again. The location was certainly the best of all the hotels I looked at. The door at the rear of the hotel leads straight onto Pitt Street Mall with every shop imaginable. The restaurants in the hotel were simply magnificent. The seafood buffet is well worth the cost. The staff are great assisting with bookings for restaurants and even some local attractions. Something that was a pleasant surprise was Hyde Park across the road. After a few drinks and dinner it was a relaxing walk around the fountain. There's also an underground railway station in the park on the edge that opens up a trip to anywhere in the city for two dollars. I walked around the rocks and foreshore area where most of the other hotels were located and found them busy and noisy. When returning to the Sheraton, walked down a shopping mall into the hotel which was quiet and relaxing. When staying in Sydney, this is now my hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, Roomy & Upmarket”
Reviews.Author: hitlong
Reviews.Content: A high quality hotel close to the centre of town. The rooms are of a good size, signficantly larger than the standard room at most other Sydney central hotels. The rooms are well appointed as is most of the hotel. The beds are very soft, and with the block-out blinds make for a very peaceful nights sleep (irrespective of your body clock). The staff for the most part go out of their way to make you welcome or assist, although my experience on this trip at reception both on check-in and out left something to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Terrace Room is huge”
Reviews.Author: firstclassboy
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed overnight at the Sheraton on the Park. Hotel is stunning and i stayed in a Deluxe Terrace Suite. This room was amazing. Huge rooms,two seperate areas (living and Sleeping ) , powder room, huge balcony overlooking Hyde park. , one of the bext beds i have ever slept in. If you stay and are able to lash out and spend a bit extra for a great night, book a Deluxe Terrace Suite, the hotel only has a few and you also get access to the executive club lounge !!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: RobertMNZ
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Lovely ambience. Executive suite room had spectacular views and very pleasant balcony. Some maintenance needed.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great location, good stay”
Reviews.Author: ho_sik
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights with the family. rm was a good size & bathrm was great. Separate shower & the water was powerful! Very comfy bed. Good lighting in room - not like some of the dimly lit hotels these days. Turn down service is offered , u just hve to call housekeeping(they actually put a note out telling u this). Great full lenght mirror, hair dryer they provide is powerful, plug adapter in the room. Free internet acess in lobby . room we stayed in was "parkside" and on checkout I queried the reception & said I could hardly see the park. He explained it is NOT "park VIEW" but "park SIDE" versus the lower catogory "city side" -- so I guess I'll just get the city side next time as he said the rms are the same but approx AUS$40 less. Restaurant service very average- seems everyone is a trainee. Vacated rm @1400hrs & bags stored at Bell captain's. Paid bill @ 1900hrs & left for airport. On arriving airprt saw I was missing a hand carry bag that I left in the room. Called hotel, they found it & handled my call very well. But I wondered why housekeeping had not contacted the front desk and given my bag to them rather then send it straight to "lost property". As I did vacate rm at 1400hrs. Bit of inter department communication needed here.

Reviews.Title: “Best business hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: not_only_but_also
Reviews.Content: I have stayed regularly at the Sheraton on the Park since 1997, usually for business but occasionally also for personal trips. I have also stayed at the Westin and the two Stamfords in Double Bay. The Sheraton is the best (with the Westin a close second and the two Stamfords an equal and definite last). Staff: The staff is warm and welcoming, unfailingly polite and always efficient in dealing with requests. Checking in/out is always a breeze (they have an automoated speedy check-out which is great for business travellers). Rooms: The rooms are generously sized and come equipped with all mod cons. The bathrooms are the best I've seen in any hotel around the world (and I've seen a few!). The rooms are always well cleaned and products replenished a couple of times a day. Good mini bar with tea/coffee/hot chocolate making facilities. Room service: Very nice and usually prompt but with the usual room service mark-up. Breakfast is really good. Location: It's great for business. Sydney as a city isn't really for tourists (the famous sights are all around the harbour and surrounding suburbs/bays) but the hotel is very well placed for transport (underground train station across the road and bus stops for all the major routes just outside the front door). It's only about 10 minutes drive (or a healthy walk - I've walked it many times) from Paddington, leafy Woolhara, Oxford Street, etc, so no shortage of things to do or places to see. Being on the edge of the city, it's good for driving too (or as good as Sydney driving can be!). Concierge: Funnily enough, this is what clinches the deal for me. They have a really well organised taxi rank that supports the hotel almost exclusively. I don't recall ever having to wait for a cab, no matter how late I leave my mad dash for the airport. They also have a plentiful supply of umbrellas for those famous Sydney storms. And they're always there to open my cab door when I arrive. The service starts and ends with those guys and they leave me happy every time. And believe me, I'm fussy!

Reviews.Title: “Not your average Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer74
Reviews.Content: I was in Australia on business and was required to visit Sydney over the course of my trip two separate times. My first few days were spent at the Westin which I loved, and on my second few days back through the Westin was sold out so I booked the Sheraton on the Park. My expectations weren't all that high because I think in the US Sheratons on average are a little ho-hum. I was definitely wrong about this Sheraton. The rooms were beautiful, the staff absolutely top notch, the quality of restaurants on property, and the beautiful views overlooking the Park were all excellent. This hotel is easily on par with the Westin, Amora, and others in the central business district. Don't let the name fool you.

Reviews.Title: “Another stay at the Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: Australianc0uple
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed another lovely stay at the Sheraton. We had a park view wich was stunning, great position with everything right at your finger tips! Loved the piano bar before going out for dinner, and even had close to high tea! Bathroom was very clean, the black marble gives the perfect off set while in the tub! Great robes and nice big bed what more could you want! Love it , being before and will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved sheraton on the park”
Reviews.Author: missy20
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night ( a saturday night). I booked on there website, a special package. $275 upgrade to a hyde park view room if available, Breakfast for two and parking. Didnt get a hyde park room, but my room on the 14th floor had a fantastic view of centrepoint tower. Breakfast was fantastic, it had everythig you could think of. The room was beautiful, very clean, and the bed was very comfolrtabe with heaps of pillows. The black out blinds were a great touch. The bathroom was big and also clean. There was a separate bath and shower, and you can play the sound form the TV in the bathroom, which included music stations. Overall i loved my stay and cant wait for my next trip to sydney so i can stay at the sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely comfortable hotel with excellent service & fab location”
Reviews.Author: Jon Potter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights, paying a little extra for a city view room. The room was very comfortable, quiet and was good in size. Our view was over Hyde Park, with a view of the harbour and Kings Cross in the distance. We thought the staff very friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was great (lots of choice and great quality), as was the food and drink in the bar and cafe. A billing issue on check out was resolved quickly. The hotel is located centrally in the city, close to transport and shops. We usually stay at the Sydney Westin but thought this hotel was more comfortable and welcoming. We plan to stay at the sheraton again, in preference to the westin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: filmhero
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton on Hyde Park last week for a 5 day holiday in Sydney Australia. It is a great place to stay. The Location is superb, just right across the street from the St. James subway station (which is really great because you can take the airport link train straight from the airport to hotel!). Hyde park is just across the street and is gorgeous. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk to the Opera House, Circular Quay, etc. The rooms are clean, and very comfortable, service is great. There is a free cool looking internet cafe in the lobby available 24/7. The gym on the 22nd floor is great (and free). I didn't eat at the hotel (or order room service), so I can't comment. The only potential downside is that because the hotel is located in the city center/business district, there doesn't seem to be a whole lot to do in the immediate area of the hotel after 5pm. This being said, everything (Circular Quay, Rocks, Darling Harbour) are all within reasonable walking distance. I loved the city and my stay at this hotel. It is a bit pricey, but made the trip extra special. Contact for photos!

Reviews.Title: “Great Sydney Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: maptravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton on the Park in May 2007 using our Starwood points. It is a great property right next to Hyde Park. Our room was spacious with a gorgeous marble bathroom (separate tub and shower) and nice small sectional. Decor is nice, current and classy. Service was excellent. Concierge had great recommendations. Highly recommend this place for both business and leisure travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the best in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Tricolours
Reviews.Content: My wife and I do around 4-5 weekends in Sydney per year and always stay at one of Sydneys 5 star hotels. Having done this now for several years we have found some lovely places to stay but would have to say now coming back to the Sheraton for the 4th time it remains as my favourite. It is a grand hotel with a lovely rooftop pool/jacuzzi and fitness room and some wonderful dining options. But most impressive to me are the rooms. We stayed there again on the 11th May and had a Hyde park room which was a good size with lovely furnishings and beautifully decorated bathroom. The beds as you expect from Sheraton were very comfy and most importantly the rooms are very quite with no discernible outside noise. For those perhaps travelling to Sydney for the first time and not really knowing the city the hotel is is in a great spot. Across the road is the beautiful Hyde Park and round the corner is one of the major shopping areas in the city which is no more than a two min walk. Also at the back of the hotel is access to the monorail which will take you to Darling Harbour. Also the restaurant area of Cockle Bay and King Street Wharf are only a pleasant 10 & 15 min walk respectively all of which is pretty much flat. Also at the moment they are running a Friday package where for $245 you get a room upgrade, breakfast for 2 and self parking. For the city of Sydney in a hotel of this standard that is almost unbeatable value. I will definitely be coming back

Reviews.Title: “Would Definately Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: MariaAustralia
Reviews.Content: I loved the Sheraton on the Park. The newly renovated rooms are beautiful, very clean and spacious. The hotel staff are very helpful and friendly. The buffet breakfast is amazing - which was included in our package. Valet parking was also included in the package - which was very useful. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone - it's a bit pricy but it is worth every penny!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better choices elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Chern
Reviews.Content: we booked a 5 night stay at the Sheraton on the Park and decided shortly after checking in that we would be moving -and did so the next day. The room was adequate. The front desk staff ran hot and cold - inconsistent and not very helpful. The concierge was uninformed and hence, not too helpful. We moved to the Quay West Suites.la.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: njtraveler4444
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this Sheraton for 4 nights using our Starwood Preferred Member reward points. What a great experience! This is definitely a top notch hotel. We had a wonderful room and although it did not face the park it did not take away from the experience one bit. The room was beautiful and comfortable and very large....even included a separate dressing room/closet. Great linens and super comfy bed and a wonderful bathroom. The bathroom was huge with a big tub and very large stall shower, also a double sink vanity. Only complaint in the bathroom was that the lights could be a little stronger for applying cosmetics. The service was terrific. We arrived from our 14 hour flight early in the morning and we were checked in immediately, something we really appreciated. The concierge desk was so helpful with everything from directions to restaurant suggestions to an umbrella for the rain. The hotel lobby was gorgeous also and the hotel is so conveniently located. Half mile from every site you would want to see (Opera house, Darling Harbor, etc.)! For breakfast...don't miss Pancakes on the Rocks!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but staff have an Attitude!!”
Reviews.Author: JamesVki
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night, on arrival I found the staff to be â€œstuck-upâ€� and not very welcoming, manly the front desk and porters. The hotel itself is very nice and the rooms are very large and newly renovated. My room didnâ€™t have any view just one straight into the concrete wall of next-door hotel. Due to the staffâ€™s attitudes I donâ€™t think I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “cold reception”
Reviews.Author: howardgraham
Reviews.Content: stayed here for just 1 night but that was enough. pompus staff and a room with plenty of problems. never again shereaton

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel let down a bit by a couple of small slip ups”
Reviews.Author: travelcomments
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton on the Park is a rather nice and well run hotel. It would be near perfect but for a couple of small slip ups. Located in the city close to two MRT stations it can be easily reached from the airport in less than 20 minutes by train. The location right at Hyde Park is excellent. The hotel itself is well appointed. The entrance with the staircase is pretty and one of the nicer entries I have seen. Everything in the public areas was clean and well organized, a clear sign for a well run hotel. My room was smallish but the furniture was new and the white blinds are nice touch (rather than the huge drapes often found). The gym is spacious and well equipped with some of the better machines on the market. A letdown was that the free weights were rusty. Using them resulted in rust-stained hands. The opening hours also could a bit longer. The hotel has an excellent lounge on the 21st floor. The food and drink selection is far better than anything I have experienced in North America. Staff was highly attentive. But Internet and printing access in the lounge - the business center closes at 5:30 pm - were unbelievably complicated or dysfunctional. Half of all the people using the PCs needed staff support just to go online. The wireless access signal dropped off half a dozen times per hour. Printing on the available HP Laserprinters produced 1 page per minute (these printers can print 10+ pages a minute) - if it worked at all. During six hours in the lounge, I saw no-one else printing anything out successfully. Anyone who does not need to use the hotel's office facilities can have a great stay. Having to work can make the stay a tad strained.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel - my #1 in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: p0ppet
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on a 2 night business trip and loved it. For future trips, I will try to stay here as well (when my budget will allow it). I can not fault the location - it is right across from Hyde Park, next door to David Jones, and a short stroll down to King Street Wharf. The rooms are clean and spacious. There are gorgeous prints on the walls and a very comfy sofa in the room. I even had a walk in robe, which meant that the room felt more like home as I could close the door on my suitcase and clothes. The airconditioning works well and bathrooms are spacious and clean. The foyer is very spacious. Check in and out was efficient and the staff are helpful. The restaurant downstairs is very good for breakfast, with a fantastic buffet available. I put the hire car into valet parking during my stay, and the concierge was very helpful and even pointed out to me that I had a flat tyre on the car - and then offered to get it pumped up for me. So helpful! I can highly recommend this hotel for business and holiday makers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: arfurcanberra
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for the weekend and had a great time. The hotel is beautiful in every aspect. We had a large corner room overlooking Hyde park with great views. The views from the roof top pool and spa are unbelievable, and make it easy to relax. The staff were very proffesional, however not overly friendly. They always remembered which room we were staying in, and were very polite, however you did not feel as though you could develop a repore with them. The meals were excellent, even if they were a little over priced. Overall a great hotel, in one of the best locations in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Awful service and overcharged for the privilege”
Reviews.Author: baswitzer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton on the Park in Jan 07 and have been thoroughly disappointed with the Hotel. Upon our check out we were shocked to find (on our card statement) that the Hotel had charged us twice for the same room at varying rates. Naturally, one telephones the Hotel to give them the opportunity to correct the problem which we did. After speaking with a reservation staff member, I was informed that they needed to contact a Manager and they would call me back as soon as possible. As the amount on my card which had been tied up needed to be used, I enquired with them as to whether the call would be sometime that night. I was assured that this would happen. Alas no call was received and in fact none was forthcoming the following morning. I had to then follow up again after lunch the next day and was given some spiel about an error being made and they could not do anything about it for a few days. This was completely ridiculous. No real apology or anything. When I enquired as to why I never got a phone call to explain, I was just informed that they did not know. Again no apology. Apparently a Manager is going to call me but I am not holding my breath- they did not really seem to be interested in the problem. I note from this forum that others have also been overcharged so it seems to be a consistent problem for this one star customer service establishment. I could not recommend this Hotel to anyone quite frankly.

Reviews.Title: “On the Park”
Reviews.Author: Giank
Reviews.Content: Great location, very comfortable room, great dining.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rooms & Location”
Reviews.Author: SamW_DC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sheraton on the Park over a busy New Years period in Sydney and had a great stay. The common areas are impressive. Upon entering the hotel, the grand staircases in front of you are beautiful. I was even a bit lost in the front section as to where check-in was, but soon found it. The check-in agent wasn't that friendly - I'm sure most of them are, but mine wasn't. I asked about an upgraded room (SPG Plat) but he said that this time of year it's near impossible - asked for a Hyde Park View room and again, no can do. Not the agent's fault and they were booked out but he just seemed a bit too quick to move on to getting me checked in and away from the counter. Once I had my room key, I made it to the 14th floor, as the agent mentioned, only to find that there was no room number on my check-in card. So back down I went to the agent and he apologized and wrote it on there. Once IN the room, I was impressed. The renovations are wonderful - there are warm brown finishes with crisp white linen, and the bathrooms are very clean and modern (see photo). Internet access was an astounding $A24.95 a day, but the connection was fast and reliable. The 'black-out' blind that can be drawn at the touch of a button are a great idea. I also had a chance to use the work out facilities on the top floor and they are very good by hotel standards. There were plenty of people using the pool, and the gym itself was free for Starwood elite members which was a nice touch. The Executive Lounge looked spacious with a great view, however I didn't go in. All in all, a great stay and, despite the minor check-in blunder, I would stay here again. Incidentally, as I left the hotel one evening, Paris Hilton was on her way back in. So if it's good enough for a Hilton to stay at a Starwood property...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: Mystie
Reviews.Content: Booked our rooms via the hotel's website. We had a "Romantic Package", so had an upgrade to a Hype Park View room, which was absolutely fantastic!! The BED is as awesome as the hotel claims to be!! Super-comfortable, made it a bit difficult to wake up in the mornings! We also had a gift of wine & cheese sent to our room (I did request no blue cheese, but my request was ignored, still- it was a gift, so I'm not too bothered). Room was excellent: spacious, clean, and it felt very luxurious. There's a small walk-in closet which was a nice touch, and the black marble bathroom (separate bath & shower) was great!! There's also a little seating & working area which gave the room that extra oomph. We had breakfast at the hotel cafe, my hubby really enjoyed it, but I'm not much of a breakfast person, although I did try the order-to-cook omelette which was very nice!! Check-in was handled efficiently, and the concierge was very happy to store our luggage for us. One thing that I'll point out- the concierge don't seem to have the latest "tourist info" leaflets, so make sure you stop by a Tourist Information centre. The night staff was a bit clueless, and whilst polite, wasn't very helpful. Location is fantastic!! Smack bang in the centre of the city, easy access to all public transportation. Although all shopping areas & Darling Harbour is only a close walk away. Overall an excellent experience at Sheraton on the Park!! Will have to try the Four Points by Sheraton on our next trip only because we are absolutely in love with Darling Harbour!

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service...”
Reviews.Author: bubblewinku
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights and was placed into the wrong room type on the first night due to 'overbooking'. This was not a bother as I was by myself for the first night. The next day the staff were extremely apologetic and moved me to a Hyde Park view room. Overall, very impressed with the service. The rooms were immaculate. Would definitely recommend this Hotel if you have some spare cash to spend on accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Maddison Clare
Reviews.Content: Mu husband and I have stayed a number of times at the Sheraton on the Park Sydney. I cannot say enough about how lovely this hotel is. The service is wonderful with friendly courteous staff, rooms are spacious and beautiful and the hotel is very central to everywhere. Bathrooms are very large and comfortable. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay, Get an Executive Club Room”
Reviews.Author: sue20058
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights for a conference that was also held at the hotel. Overall, my stay was excellent. At check-in I was upgraded to a Corner King Room, which gave me a partial view of the park. It was larger than a standard king with a large dressing area and entrance hall. The room was well furnished and certainly met 5 star standards. Room service was of a reasonably good standard. I booked a club room for the extras - complimentary wireless internet in the gorgeous club lounge, complimentary alcoholic drinks and canapes from 5.30pm to 7.30pm and a pretty decent breakfast with proper coffee from a large espresso machine. The staff in the club lounge were particularly helpful. My only complaint (minor) was that they could have given a a 6pm checkout because I arrived at 9 pm on the first evening of my stay and my return flight was at 9 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Location, style but (often) no view”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFrier
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for a weekend in May and (as usual) got a room at the back that looks directly into an office building. I am told the views from the front are stunning. Even so, the rooms are well planned and decorated, and bathrooms are certainly 5 star. Breakfast is beautifully done, but at 5 star prices. Parking underneath is convenient. The rooftop pool has a great location, is often quiet, and is properly cleaned and heated. We would stay here again, but hope one day to get an East-facing room (ask for them!).

Reviews.Title: “Room a disaster!”
Reviews.Author: gspence
Reviews.Content: A special weekend in Sydney started badly when we booked a suite at the Sheraton. We arrived right on checkin time to be told our suite wasn't available. Unbelievably we were offered a downgrade, yes downgrade, if we wanted to check in immediately. No suggestion of a rate reduction. We returned later and were checked into suite 823. The bedroom was OK but the lounge area looked straight out of a cheap motel. Very little furniture, old decaying fixtures and completely devoid of atmosphere. It looked like someone had gone to a garage sale to furnish the room. When I spoke to room services they claimed all suites were the same. Having stayed at the hotel before I know this is not true. It seems the Sheraton is trying to make a buck out of rooms which are half way through being refurbished. Check your room before checking in!! We left and checked in at The Observatory. Simply fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely worth it!”
Reviews.Author: yes_chef
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton on the Park for our wedding night, in an Executive Suite. The location is great - right next to David Jones and other stores for some leisurely shopping. I think this hotel is great value given how much you would be charged at the Four Seasons or Westin for a similar room. The staff were spectacularly helpful in letting us check in two hours early so we could get ready. They were very friendly and attentive and even left us a cute little chocolate basket with strawberries and champagne. Unlike other reviewers, we did not find them rushed or rude at all. The suite was fantastic with a huge lounge room with corner lounge, desk and comfy chair and a television. The lounge room could be shut off completely from the bedroom which was useful. The bedroom had the comfiest king size bed with a beautiful view of St Mary's Cathedral and Hyde Park - and a tv if you needed distraction. The bathroom was enormous with marble and wood finishing and every nice thing you could think of from the bathrobes to the mouthwash (very important!). My only (very minor) issues were that it took a while to get our car out of valet parking when there was really not a lot of traffic at 9am on a Saturday and there was no-one else waiting to get their car out. Also, breakfast at the Executive Club on level 21 was a bit of an anticlimax. The pastries were nice but the Westin does a much better hot breakfast. The Club itself is beautiful and has the most incredible view, internet access, papers etc. All in all it was absolutely worth it. We have made a pact to come back every year for our anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel that is let down by the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Bailey_Schnapps
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton for one night, and for $350 got breakfast, valet parking, wine and cheese and 2 drinks at the bar included. Was a great package for 1 night, the room overlooked the parked and the bedroom was good size along with a great huge bathroom. The only let down was dinner at the restaurant. Even though Sydney has great restuarants, we decided to eat at the hotel restaurant. The seafood buffet at $95 per person is over priced for what you get (and the lobster is overcooked). For a 5 star hotel, the restaurant can not seem to manage seating people at various times. Ie, we got their at 8.15pm but had to wait to the second sitting at 8.30pm, even though the restuarant was empty, there was food layed out and then at 8.30pm we had to que to be seated. At breakfast the same Matre` D was working and once again it seemed all too much - there's only so many apologies you can take when you are hungry. So great hotel, just eat somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Better Ones...”
Reviews.Author: panjack
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in this hotel with a group of us spread across 3 rooms. I was a little wary after reading many negative reviews here, but can happily report that the service I received was at the very least, acceptable for a 5 star hotel (I should know, I work in a good one). The only service I received which anyone could possibly gripe about was the slightly slow bar service, and this was acceptable as we had just ordered a large and tricky round of cocktails (around a 25 minute wait as the bar was certainly not quiet). The City View (who needs a view?)(fairly recently refurbished) rooms were great, large, spacious, beds fantastic! The bathrooms here are like Hyatt bathrooms with nice fittings and black marble throughout! During my stay, we encountered no problems at all, and all of the staff were friendly and efficient. This is one of the better 5 star Sydney hotels I have stayed in, and will return....

Reviews.Title: “A sad farewell to the Sheraton on the Park”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found it rather entertaining to read all the reviews on the Sheraton on the Park at tripadvisor.com, simply because of their disparity! I stayed in the hotel every year since 2001 for at least one week and I finally tend to agree with those, who were disappointed. I once rated this hotel as one of the best five star hotels, but year by year the dissatisfaction was growing. Rates were going up and became totally unacceptable. Don't get me wrong: It's still a good hotel with nice, spacious rooms, an elegant lobby and a proper health club. But the staff is absolutely clueless, not very well trained and simply not on the level that you would expect from a five star hotel. Service in this hotel deteriorated incredibly over the years. For example they now charge you for using the gym!?!? You wouldn't expect that in a hotel, where you're paying 400 AUD per night, wouldn't you? When you're checking in, nobody asks you, if you prefer a smoking or a non-smoking room. These are basics, well known by every front desk manager or receptionist in every Holiday Inn all over the world... When I stayed there for the last time in November 2005, I really felt cheated. I will definitely come back to Sydney, one of the most vibrant cities in the world I know. But I surely will not spend a penny at the Sheraton on the Park.

Reviews.Title: “First-class hotel”
Reviews.Author: JCW
Reviews.Content: Great location. Great rooms. Good restaurants. Superb executive lounge. Decent value for money. I stayed there a week, and was extremely impressed from start to finish. There are probably trendier places to stay in Sydney, but this is highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “I didn't realise this was a training hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amazingplanet
Reviews.Content: Compared to other hotels you could stay at in Sydney, for similar prices, I would steer clear of this one. Whilst the rooms are quite large and comfortable, if you get the right room, and the view across the park is lovely, especially if you can see the harbour in the distance, the service at this hotel makes the stay not worth it. I have stayed at this hotel several times when visiting Sydney for both business and pleasure (not my choice), and would not stay there again. The staff seem to run the hotel as though it is a training establishment or a factory. It was more like a place filled with uni students who were having a great time socialising with each other, but forgot the job at hand ... they're working in a hotel ... and YES ... there are customers! They demonstrate a lack of knowledge, are immature and lethargic. I will not go into spelling out the numerous examples, because they are just that ... numerous. Perhaps this is the sort of hotel that appeals to a certain crowd ... that would just look for the Sheraton name, rather than quality.

HotelInfo.Name: Sheraton on the Park, Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 161 Elizabeth Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
